analyzed: bsags pa'i skyon ni mi bden par byas zla ba nyi ma gnyis ni kha sbyar byas pa yis //

analyzed: bsod nams dang ni sdig rnams lhan cig 'bar //

analyzed: 'gro ba bkang zhing sgyu ma'i gti mug gis ma gos pa bde las skyes //

original: bla ma dag ba mdzad la phyag byas nas //
analyzed: bla ma dag ba mdzad la phyag byas nas //

analyzed: sems can bsgral ba'i rgyu yi phyir //

original: @2b ngag gi rdo rje gsor bar byas //
analyzed: @2b ngag gi rdo rje gsor bar byas //

original: kun mkhyen rnams kyis sngon gsungs pa'i //
analyzed: kun mkhyen rnams kyis sngon gsungs pa'i //

analyzed: sngon yod pa ni 'dir brjod bya // kho bos kun mkhyen gsung gi ni //

original: pha rol bgrod pa'i nus med de //
analyzed: pha rol bgrod pa'i nus med de //
translated: Of the speech of the Omniscient One.

original: gsung gcig gi ni nang du yang //
analyzed: gsung gcig gi ni nang du yang //

original: bka' mang po ni gsungs pa'o //
analyzed: bka' mang po ni gsungs pa'o //

original: de phyir bdag gis rim pa yis //
analyzed: de phyir bdag gis rim pa yis //
translated: Therefore, I will gradually

original: ji lta'i rgyud tshig rnams brjod de //
analyzed: ji lta'i rgyud tshig rnams brjod de //
translated: Express the words of the tantra.

original: rdo rje bla ma'i bka' lung gis //
analyzed: rdo rje bla ma'i bka' lung gis //
translated: By the command of the vajra guru,

original: da ni rgya cher 'grel par bya //üîΩzab mo'i pha rol bgrod pa yi //
analyzed: da ni rgya cher 'grel par bya // zab mo'i pha rol bgrod pa yi //
translated: Now I will explain the commentary.üîΩThe ship that crosses to the far shore

original: gru gzings de ni rab tu bsnyad //
analyzed: gru gzings de ni rab tu bsnyad //
translated: Of the profound is well proclaimed.

original: rgya mtsho drug po'i rgyud chen du //
analyzed: rgya mtsho drug po'i rgyud chen du //

original: rnal 'byor ye shes mthar bgrod rnams //üîΩsna tshogs sbyor ba rgya mtsho che'i //
analyzed: rnal 'byor ye shes mthar bgrod rnams // sna tshogs sbyor ba rgya mtsho che'i //
translated: The yogis who reach the end of wisdomüîΩShould understand the words of the great ocean

original: tshig rtogs gyur nas bzhud par byos //
analyzed: tshig rtogs gyur nas bzhud par byos //
translated: Of various practices and depart.

original: khams gsum 'dir ni shin tu brtson pa ru //
analyzed: khams gsum 'dir ni shin tu brtson pa ru //
translated: In this three-realm world, with great diligence,

original: sangs rgyas nyid ni gzhan gyi sdug bsngal spong //
analyzed: sangs rgyas nyid ni gzhan gyi sdug bsngal spong //
translated: One should abandon the suffering of others for the sake of buddhahood.

original: de phyir theg pa mang la gnas pa yi //
analyzed: de phyir theg pa mang la gnas pa yi //
translated: Therefore, those who abide in the many vehicles

original: slob dpon rdo rje theg pa yi ge gsum //
analyzed: slob dpon rdo rje theg pa yi ge gsum //
translated: The master is the Vajra Vehicle, the three syllables.

original: samba rar ni 'dir brjod de //
analyzed: samba rar ni 'dir brjod de //
translated: The Samvara is said here.

original: theg pa kun gyi go 'phang che //
analyzed: theg pa kun gyi go 'phang che //
translated: The state of all vehicles is great.

original: 'dir nges par rjod par byed pa dang brjod par bya ba dang 'brel pa dang dgos pa dang dgos pa'i dgos pa rnams mngon par yang dag par mthong ste de brjod pa sngon du 'gro bar sangs rgyas nyid mngon par brjod do //
analyzed: 'dir nges par rjod par byed pa dang brjod par bya ba dang 'brel pa dang dgos pa dang dgos pa'i dgos pa rnams mngon par yang dag par mthong ste de brjod pa sngon du 'gro bar sangs rgyas nyid mngon par brjod do //
translated: Here, the one who expresses, the expression, the connection, the purpose, and the purpose of the purpose are clearly seen, and Buddhahood is expressed as preceded by that expression.

original: thams cad du 'di ltar rtogs pa dang ldan pa rnams kyi bsam pa dang sbyar ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: thams cad du 'di ltar rtogs pa dang ldan pa rnams kyi bsam pa dang sbyar ba'i phyir ro //
translated: Because in every way, those who possess such realization are engaged in accordance with their intention.

original: de rnams dang bral na 'jug par mi 'gyur te /
analyzed: de rnams dang bral na 'jug par mi 'gyur te /
translated: If they are devoid of those, they will not engage.

original: bstan bcos rnams su 'gal ba srid pa'i phyir ram /
analyzed: bstan bcos rnams su 'gal ba srid pa'i phyir ram /
translated: Because contradictions are possible in treatises,

original: thun mong ma yin pa nyid kyi phyir ram blo gros dang ldan pa rnams kyis ma thos pa nyid kyi phyir ro //
analyzed: thun mong ma yin pa nyid kyi phyir ram blo gros dang ldan pa rnams kyis ma thos pa nyid kyi phyir ro //
translated: because of their uniqueness, or because the wise have not heard them.

original: de'i phyir yang bdag gis rjod par byed pa la sogs pa brjod par bya'o //
analyzed: de'i phyir yang bdag gis rjod par byed pa la sogs pa brjod par bya'o //
translated: Therefore, the one who expresses and so on should be expressed again.

original: 'on kyang bsgrub par bya ba dang sgrub pa'i thabs dang sgrub pa po rnams sgrub pa'i dus su yi ge med pa'i sbyor ba las rang gi dang gis rjod par byed pa la sogs pa la rab tu 'jug par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: 'on kyang bsgrub par bya ba dang sgrub pa'i thabs dang sgrub pa po rnams sgrub pa'i dus su yi ge med pa'i sbyor ba las rang gi dang gis rjod par byed pa la sogs pa la rab tu 'jug par 'gyur ro //
translated: However, at the time of the accomplishment of the object to be accomplished, the means of accomplishment, and the accomplisher, one enters into the spontaneous expression of the inexpressible union.

original: ji ltar rgyud kyi nang la lar yang ma mthong ba dang ma bshad pa nyid kyi phyir ro //
analyzed: ji ltar rgyud kyi nang la lar yang ma mthong ba dang ma bshad pa nyid kyi phyir ro //
translated: Because it is not seen or explained in some tantras.

original: de 'dir ji ltar 'jug na byis pa'i pandi ta rnams gzhug pa'i don dang / gang yang pandi ta'i nga rgyal gyis chud zos pa de rnams kyi nga rgyal gzhom par bya ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de 'dir ji ltar 'jug na byis pa'i pandi ta rnams gzhug pa'i don dang / gang yang pandi ta'i nga rgyal gyis chud zos pa de rnams kyi nga rgyal gzhom par bya ba'i phyir ro //
translated: How does it enter here? For the purpose of introducing the childish panditas, and for the purpose of destroying the pride of those who are lost due to the pride of being panditas.

original: de bzhin du gsungs pa /
analyzed: de bzhin du gsungs pa /
translated: Thus it is said:

original: mkhas pa mngon pa'i nga rgyal can //üîΩsangs rgyas gsung @3a * //
analyzed: mkhas pa mngon pa'i nga rgyal can // sangs rgyas gsung @3a * //

original: ni mi shes pa //üîΩmnar med la sogs 'jigs rung bar //
analyzed: ni mi shes pa // mnar med la sogs 'jigs rung bar //
translated: ignorant of the Buddha's speech,üîΩthose lost ones will go

original: chud zos de rnams 'gro 'gyur nyid //
analyzed: chud zos de rnams 'gro 'gyur nyid //
translated: to the terrifying Avici hell and so forth.

original: 'dir yang mar me mdzad la sogs pa'i de bzhin gshegs pa rnams kyi dus su sngags kyi theg pa chen po bsdus par ma gyur te /
analyzed: 'dir yang mar me mdzad la sogs pa'i de bzhin gshegs pa rnams kyi dus su sngags kyi theg pa chen po bsdus par ma gyur te /
translated: Here also, during the time of the Tathagatas Dipankara and so on, the Mahayana of the Mantra was not compiled,

original: dngos su rtogs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: dngos su rtogs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because it was directly realized.

original: slar yang ji ltar sh'akya thub pas bstan pa sdud pa po rnams kyis bris ta rang gis rtogs pa med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: slar yang ji ltar sh'akya thub pas bstan pa sdud pa po rnams kyis bris ta rang gis rtogs pa med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Again, just as Shakyamuni taught, the compilers wrote it down because they did not realize it themselves.

original: 'o na ji ltar rtogs zhe na /
analyzed: 'o na ji ltar rtogs zhe na /
translated: Well then, how was it realized?

original: gal te re zhig sangs rgyas mi bzhugs pa de'i tshe 'jig rten thams cad ma dag pa'o //
analyzed: gal te re zhig sangs rgyas mi bzhugs pa de'i tshe 'jig rten thams cad ma dag pa'o //
translated: If the Buddha did not exist for a while, at that time the whole world was impure.

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: sangs rgyas dang 'jig rten dus mnyam pa nyid na dag pa nyid kyi phyir ro //
analyzed: sangs rgyas dang 'jig rten dus mnyam pa nyid na dag pa nyid kyi phyir ro //
translated: When the Buddha and the world are simultaneous, it is pure.

original: gang gi tshe ma dag pa de'i tshe bstan par bya ba'i ngo bor ma gyur to zhe na /
analyzed: gang gi tshe ma dag pa de'i tshe bstan par bya ba'i ngo bor ma gyur to zhe na /
translated: When it is impure, it did not become the essence of the teaching.

original: de la 'di bshad pa /
analyzed: de la 'di bshad pa /
translated: To that, this is explained:

original: gang gi dus su sangs rgyas rnams chos ston pa de'i tshe nyid na 'jig rten thams cad dag pa'o //
analyzed: gang gi dus su sangs rgyas rnams chos ston pa de'i tshe nyid na 'jig rten thams cad dag pa'o //
translated: At the time when the Buddhas teach the Dharma, at that very time the whole world is pure.

original: de'i phyir rtsod pa'i dus su phyi ma pa'i sems can rnams la bstan par bya ba dang ston pa po'i nus pa med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de'i phyir rtsod pa'i dus su phyi ma pa'i sems can rnams la bstan par bya ba dang ston pa po'i nus pa med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Therefore, in the age of discord, there is no one who is able to teach or to be taught, because of the lack of ability in sentient beings of the later time.

original: rdo rje phag mo bcom ldan 'das las byung bas yang dag pa'i thugs rjes de nyid kyi tshe rgya mtsho la sogs pa rnal 'byor ma'i rgyud sdud par byed pa por yang 'di nyid du gsungs pa yin no //
analyzed: rdo rje phag mo bcom ldan 'das las byung bas yang dag pa'i thugs rjes de nyid kyi tshe rgya mtsho la sogs pa rnal 'byor ma'i rgyud sdud par byed pa por yang 'di nyid du gsungs pa yin no //
translated: Since VajravƒÅrƒÅhƒ´ arises from the BhagavƒÅn, she is the one who, at that time, is the compiler of the Yoginƒ´ Tantras such as the Ocean (of Dakinis) and so forth, due to her perfect compassion.

original: de yang rjod par byed pa dang brjod par bya ba dang 'brel ba dang dgos pa rnams yang dag par mthong nas thos pa brgyud pa ni de bzhin gshegs pa'i gsung las gzhan du 'gyur ba dang / sems can rnams kyi dngos grub 'joms par 'gyur ba dang /
analyzed: de yang rjod par byed pa dang brjod par bya ba dang 'brel ba dang dgos pa rnams yang dag par mthong nas thos pa brgyud pa ni de bzhin gshegs pa'i gsung las gzhan du 'gyur ba dang / sems can rnams kyi dngos grub 'joms par 'gyur ba dang /
translated: Moreover, having seen the connection between the one who expresses and that which is expressed and the purpose, the transmission of the hearing is other than the speech of the TathƒÅgata, and the power of sentient beings is destroyed.

original: slar yang phyin ci log tu bshad pas dmyal ba la sogs par 'gro bar byed do //
analyzed: slar yang phyin ci log tu bshad pas dmyal ba la sogs par 'gro bar byed do //
translated: Moreover, by explaining in a distorted way, one will go to hell and so forth.

original: da ni rjod par byed pa la sogs pa rnams thor long du bshad par bya ste /
analyzed: da ni rjod par byed pa la sogs pa rnams thor long du bshad par bya ste /
translated: Now, the one who expresses and so forth will be explained in a haphazard way.

original: 'di skad bdag gis zhes bya ba la sogs pa dgos pa la sogs pa rnam pa lnga ste /
analyzed: 'di skad bdag gis zhes bya ba la sogs pa dgos pa la sogs pa rnam pa lnga ste /
translated: Thus have I heard and so forth are the five aspects of purpose and so forth.

original: 'di skad ni dgos pa'o //
analyzed: 'di skad ni dgos pa'o //
translated: Thus is the purpose.

original: bdag gis ni dgos pa'i dgos pa'o //
analyzed: bdag gis ni dgos pa'i dgos pa'o //
translated: I is the purpose of the purpose.

original: thos pa gcig na ni 'brel pa'o //
analyzed: thos pa gcig na ni 'brel pa'o //
translated: If it is heard, it is the connection.

original: dus na bcom ldan 'das dpa' bo'i dbang phyug chen po ni rjod par byed pa'o //
analyzed: dus na bcom ldan 'das dpa' bo'i dbang phyug chen po ni rjod par byed pa'o //
translated: At the time, the BhagavƒÅn, the Great Lord of Heroes, is the one who speaks.

original: de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad kyi dpa' bo'i sku dang gsung dang thugs ni brjod par bya ba'o //
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad kyi dpa' bo'i sku dang gsung dang thugs ni brjod par bya ba'o //
translated: The body, speech, and mind of all tathƒÅgatas are what is to be spoken.

original: rnal 'byor ma'i bha ga rnams su ni rdo rje phag mo la sogs pa'i le'u rnams su rtsen pa dang ldan par 'gyur pa'o //
analyzed: rnal 'byor ma'i bha ga rnams su ni rdo rje phag mo la sogs pa'i le'u rnams su rtsen pa dang ldan par 'gyur pa'o //
translated: In the bhagas of the yoginƒ´s, in the chapters on VajravƒÅrƒÅhƒ´ and so forth, he plays.

original: @3b thog ma la sogs pa nas le'u tha ma'i bar du 'di skad ces bya ba la sogs pa rnam pa lnga yis bzhugs pa'o //
analyzed: @3b thog ma la sogs pa nas le'u tha ma'i bar du 'di skad ces bya ba la sogs pa rnam pa lnga yis bzhugs pa'o //
translated: From the beginning up to the end of the chapter, he abides with Thus have I heard and so forth in five aspects.

original: 'di ltar le'u lnga bcu rtsa gcig pa rnams le'u rnams su shin tu phra ba'i dngos po'i khongs su gnas pa 'bras bu dang rgyu la sogs pa'i don phan tshun bstan pa nyid 'dir yang ye shes kyi rgya mtsho la 'jug pa ni rjod par byed pa'o //
analyzed: 'di ltar le'u lnga bcu rtsa gcig pa rnams le'u rnams su shin tu phra ba'i dngos po'i khongs su gnas pa 'bras bu dang rgyu la sogs pa'i don phan tshun bstan pa nyid 'dir yang ye shes kyi rgya mtsho la 'jug pa ni rjod par byed pa'o //
translated: Thus, the fifty-one chapters are the very subtle entities that reside in the chapters, and the meaning of the effect and cause, etc., are mutually taught here.

original: yang dag pa'i ting nge 'dzin dpal he ru ka'i dkyil 'khor gyi sgrub pa'i thabs kyi le'u bco lnga pa ni brjod par bya ba'o //
analyzed: yang dag pa'i ting nge 'dzin dpal he ru ka'i dkyil 'khor gyi sgrub pa'i thabs kyi le'u bco lnga pa ni brjod par bya ba'o //
translated: The fifteen chapters of the method of achieving the glorious Heruka mandala of correct concentration are what is to be expressed.

original: sngags btu ba'i le'u ni 'brel pa'o //
analyzed: sngags btu ba'i le'u ni 'brel pa'o //
translated: The chapter on selecting the mantra is the connection.

original: nyi shu rtsa gsum pa la sogs pa le'u gsum ni dgos pa'o //
analyzed: nyi shu rtsa gsum pa la sogs pa le'u gsum ni dgos pa'o //
translated: The three chapters beginning with the twenty-third are the purpose.

original: lnga bcu rtsa gcig pa dang lnga bcu pa gnyis ni dgos pa'i dgos pa'o //
analyzed: lnga bcu rtsa gcig pa dang lnga bcu pa gnyis ni dgos pa'i dgos pa'o //
translated: The two chapters, the fifty-first and the fiftieth, are the purpose of the purpose.

original: rdo rje phag mo la sogs pa nas gshin rje 'joms ma la sogs pa'i mthar thug pa bcu gsum dang / de bzhin du bcu bdun pa la sogs pa nas nyi shu rtsa gnyis pa'i bar le'u drug ni dpa' bo dang dpa' mo'i dbang phyug ma dag gi go cha'o //
analyzed: rdo rje phag mo la sogs pa nas gshin rje 'joms ma la sogs pa'i mthar thug pa bcu gsum dang / de bzhin du bcu bdun pa la sogs pa nas nyi shu rtsa gnyis pa'i bar le'u drug ni dpa' bo dang dpa' mo'i dbang phyug ma dag gi go cha'o //
translated: The thirteen chapters beginning with Vajravarahi and ending with Yamini, and similarly the six chapters beginning with the seventeenth and ending with the twenty-second, are the armors of the heroines.

original: slar yang nyi shu rtsa drug pa la sogs pa nas ji srid bzhi bcu rtsa dgu'i bar le'u nyi shu rtsa bzhi dang / de ltar le'u bzhi bcu rtsa gsum ni rnal 'byor ma rnams kyi bha ga rnams te de rnams kyi bha ga rnams su rtsen pa dang ldan pa'o //
analyzed: slar yang nyi shu rtsa drug pa la sogs pa nas ji srid bzhi bcu rtsa dgu'i bar le'u nyi shu rtsa bzhi dang / de ltar le'u bzhi bcu rtsa gsum ni rnal 'byor ma rnams kyi bha ga rnams te de rnams kyi bha ga rnams su rtsen pa dang ldan pa'o //
translated: Again, the twenty-four chapters beginning with the twenty-sixth and ending with the forty-ninth, and thus the forty-third chapter, are the vaginas of the yoginis, and in those vaginas he sports.

original: rjod par byed pa la sogs pa rnams ni 'di'i 'brel pa'o //
analyzed: rjod par byed pa la sogs pa rnams ni 'di'i 'brel pa'o //
translated: The author and so forth are the context of this.

original: da ni 'di dag thams cad du bya ba dang byed pa dang mngon par mtshams sbyar ba bstan bcos la sogs pa rnams su rkyen gsum gyis bdag gis bshad par bya'o //
analyzed: da ni 'di dag thams cad du bya ba dang byed pa dang mngon par mtshams sbyar ba bstan bcos la sogs pa rnams su rkyen gsum gyis bdag gis bshad par bya'o //
translated: Now, in all these [chapters], I will explain the connection between the agent, action, and object by means of the three conditions in the treatises and so forth.

original: 'di ni 'jig rten pa thams cad kyi 'gro ba dang 'ong ba la sogs pa'i las gang yin pa de yang dgos pa dang bral na mi byed do //
analyzed: 'di ni 'jig rten pa thams cad kyi 'gro ba dang 'ong ba la sogs pa'i las gang yin pa de yang dgos pa dang bral na mi byed do //
translated: This is because all worldly people do not perform any action such as going and coming without a purpose.

original: de'i phyir dgos pa la bsams nas bya ba la ltos pas byed pa nye bar gdags pa byas pa zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: de'i phyir dgos pa la bsams nas bya ba la ltos pas byed pa nye bar gdags pa byas pa zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: Therefore, since the performance is dependent on the purpose, the meaning of the term ‚Äúperformance‚Äù is that it is done with reference to the purpose.

original: 'di ltar dgos pa la ltos nas dgos pa'i dgos pa yod do //
analyzed: 'di ltar dgos pa la ltos nas dgos pa'i dgos pa yod do //
translated: Thus, with reference to the purpose, there is a purpose of the purpose.

original: de yang dgos pa ni ae wam zhes bya ba thog ma'i yi ge gnyis shes rab dang thabs kyi bdag nyid can no //
analyzed: de yang dgos pa ni ae wam zhes bya ba thog ma'i yi ge gnyis shes rab dang thabs kyi bdag nyid can no //
translated: And that purpose is the two initial syllables of ‚Äúevam,‚Äù which have the nature of wisdom and means.

original: dgos pa yang nyi shu rtsa gsum pa la sogs pa'i le'u gsum rnams su bcom ldan 'das kyis bstan to //üîΩde la thog mar ni gtor ma dang 'khor lor mchod pa'o //
analyzed: dgos pa yang nyi shu rtsa gsum pa la sogs pa'i le'u gsum rnams su bcom ldan 'das kyis bstan to // de la thog mar ni gtor ma dang 'khor lor mchod pa'o //
translated: And the purpose is taught by the Blessed Lord in the three chapters beginning with the twenty-third.üîΩThere, first, there is the offering of oblations and worship in the ma·πá·∏çala.

original: gnyis par dkyil 'khor gyi thig gdab pa la sogs pa dang mchod pa dang / dbang bskur ba dang sbyin sreg gi @4a * //
analyzed: gnyis par dkyil 'khor gyi thig gdab pa la sogs pa dang mchod pa dang / dbang bskur ba dang sbyin sreg gi @4a * //
translated: In the second, there is the layout of the ma·πá·∏çala and so on, worship, consecration, and fire sacrifice.

original: thabs kyi mtshan nyid dang slob dpon gyi yon mchod pa dang bcas pa'o //
analyzed: thabs kyi mtshan nyid dang slob dpon gyi yon mchod pa dang bcas pa'o //
translated: The characteristics of the means, and the master's qualifications along with the offerings.

original: gsum pa rab tu gnas pa dang rnam par dag pa'i mtshan nyid rnams gsungs so //
analyzed: gsum pa rab tu gnas pa dang rnam par dag pa'i mtshan nyid rnams gsungs so //
translated: The third [chapter] teaches the characteristics of consecration and purification.

original: de ltar byas pa yod pas phyi dang nang gi bdag nyid can gyi rigs las rtogs pa nyid kyi phyir dgos pa'o //üîΩbyed pa ni sems can thams cad la bu gcig pa ltar byams pa'i mtshan nyid kho nas dpa' bo nyi shu rtsa bzhi khams las byung bas 'chi ba mi 'chi bar 'gyur ba dang sna tshogs pa'i las kyi tshogs nyid dang de kho na nyid dang rnam pa
analyzed: de ltar byas pa yod pas phyi dang nang gi bdag nyid can gyi rigs las rtogs pa nyid kyi phyir dgos pa'o // byed pa ni sems can thams cad la bu gcig pa ltar byams pa'i mtshan nyid kho nas dpa' bo nyi shu rtsa bzhi khams las byung bas 'chi ba mi 'chi bar 'gyur ba dang sna tshogs pa'i las kyi tshogs nyid dang de kho na nyid dang rnam pa
translated: The purpose is that by doing so, one realizes the family which is of the nature of the external and internal, and is existent.

original: sna tshogs pa'i chos thams cad yongs su shes pa rnams te /
analyzed: sna tshogs pa'i chos thams cad yongs su shes pa rnams te /
translated: The hero is the one who has the characteristic of love for all sentient beings as if they were his only child, who has arisen from the twenty-four sacred sites, who has become immortal, who has various collections of karma, who has the reality of the twenty-four heroes, who has the various aspects of all phenomena, and who has complete knowledge.

original: de yang ma y'a zhes bya ba'i yi ge gnyis nyid kyis lnga bcu pa la sogs pa'i le'u gnyis su gsungs pa'o //
analyzed: de yang ma y'a zhes bya ba'i yi ge gnyis nyid kyis lnga bcu pa la sogs pa'i le'u gnyis su gsungs pa'o //
translated: And that is taught in two chapters, the fifty-first and so on, by the two syllables ma and ya.

original: de la thams cad gsang ba zhes bya ba'i le'u dang po'i rab tu byed pa nyi shu rtsa lngas de kho na nyid kyi bdag nyid can dang rgyud thams cad kyi don ston par byed do //
analyzed: de la thams cad gsang ba zhes bya ba'i le'u dang po'i rab tu byed pa nyi shu rtsa lngas de kho na nyid kyi bdag nyid can dang rgyud thams cad kyi don ston par byed do //
translated: In the first chapter, called ‚ÄúThe Secret of Everything,‚Äù the twenty-five sections teach the nature of reality and the meaning of all tantras.

original: gnyis par mchod pa bzhi dang dam tshig bsten pa dang de bzhin du dam tshig gi bslab pa rnams dang gnyis su med pa ni dgos pa'i dgos pa ste mngon du byed pa'i phyir zhes bya bar gnas so //
analyzed: gnyis par mchod pa bzhi dang dam tshig bsten pa dang de bzhin du dam tshig gi bslab pa rnams dang gnyis su med pa ni dgos pa'i dgos pa ste mngon du byed pa'i phyir zhes bya bar gnas so //
translated: In the second chapter, the four offerings, the reliance on the commitments, and likewise the trainings in the commitments, and nonduality, are the ultimate purpose, because they are for the sake of realization.üîΩHere, too, the nature of the two syllables e and vam is stated:

original: 'dir yang ae wam gyi yi ge gnyis kyi rang bzhin ni brjod par gsungs pa ;

analyzed: gal te rtsen pa dang rtsen par gyur pa'i dngos po gnyis yin pa de'i tshe 'di ltar bcom ldan 'das 'di skad bdag gis zhes bya ba la sogs pa de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad kyi sku dang gsung dang thugs zhes bya ba'i mthar thug pa'i tshig lnga
translated: If there are two things, the play and the one who plays, then, in that case, this is the statement of the BhagavƒÅn, ‚ÄúThus have I heard,‚Äù and so on, up to the word ‚Äúthe body, speech, and mind of all tathƒÅgatas.‚Äù

analyzed: de nas bcom ldan 'das kyis rnam par gzhag pa sna tshogs pa nye bar bstan pa'i tshig rnams la rnal 'byor dang rnal 'byor ma thams cad kyi dgos pa dang byed par 'dogs pa gsang ba'i tshul gyi mtshan nyid ni brjod par bya ba'o //
translated: Then, the Blessed One's words that teach the various principles are to be expressed as the characteristics of the secret method, the purpose and function of all yogis and yoginis.

original: rgyud kyi brjod par bya ba dang rjod par byed pa'i mtshan nyid gang yin pa de ni 'brel pa'o //
analyzed: rgyud kyi brjod par bya ba dang rjod par byed pa'i mtshan nyid gang yin pa de ni 'brel pa'o //

original: mchod pa dang mchod par bya ba dang sgom pa la sogs pa dang gtor ma dang sbyin sreg gi las kyi tshogs bsgrub par bya ba dang sgrub pa'i thabs dang las kyi tshogs kyi dngos grub gang yin pa de ni dgos pa'o //
analyzed: mchod pa dang mchod par bya ba dang sgom pa la sogs pa dang gtor ma dang sbyin sreg gi las kyi tshogs bsgrub par bya ba dang sgrub pa'i thabs dang las kyi tshogs kyi dngos grub gang yin pa de ni dgos pa'o //
translated: The collection of rites to be accomplished, such as worship, the object of worship, meditation, and so forth, as well as the means of accomplishment, the collection of rites, and the powers that are to be accomplished are the purpose.

original: de yang phyag rgya chen po'i sgrub pa'i thabs te dgos pa'i dgos pa'o //
analyzed: de yang phyag rgya chen po'i sgrub pa'i thabs te dgos pa'i dgos pa'o //
translated: And that is the means of accomplishing the great seal, the ultimate purpose.

original: he ru ka la sogs pa dpa' bo nyi shu rtsa lnga dang de rnams kyi mtshan nyid dang cho ga byed pa dang ming nye bar bstan pa las ni rjod par byed pa'o //

translated: The twenty-five heroes, Heruka, etc., are the subject matter, and their characteristics, ritual performance, and names are the subject matter of the text.

original: rdo rje phag mo la sogs pa rnal 'byor ma sum cu rtsa bdun gyi rang gi chu skyes la shin tu rol pa'i bcom ldan 'das ni brjod par bya ba'o //
analyzed: rdo rje phag mo la sogs pa rnal 'byor ma sum cu rtsa bdun gyi rang gi chu skyes la shin tu rol pa'i bcom ldan 'das ni brjod par bya ba'o //
translated: The Blessed One, who is very much engaged in his own lotus with the thirty-seven yoginis, Vajravarahi, etc., is the subject matter to be expressed.

original: de rnams kyi gnyis kyis gnyis su med pa nyid thob pa ni 'brel pa'o //
analyzed: de rnams kyi gnyis kyis gnyis su med pa nyid thob pa ni 'brel pa'o //
translated: The attainment of nonduality by those two is the relation.

original: de yang sku bzhi la gnas pa rnams kyi mnyam pa med pa'i sems can gyi don byed pas dgos pa'o //
analyzed: de yang sku bzhi la gnas pa rnams kyi mnyam pa med pa'i sems can gyi don byed pas dgos pa'o //
translated: Moreover, the performance of incomparable benefit for sentient beings by those abiding in the four bodies is the purpose.

original: sgyu ma'i rnam pa la gnas pa rnams kyi 'od gsal ba'i tshul la spyod pas dgos pa'i dgos pa'o //
analyzed: sgyu ma'i rnam pa la gnas pa rnams kyi 'od gsal ba'i tshul la spyod pas dgos pa'i dgos pa'o //
translated: The practice of the method of clear light by those abiding in the aspect of illusion is the ulterior purpose.

original: de bzhin du yang @11a * //
analyzed: de bzhin du yang @11a * //
translated: And likewise,

original: rgyud thams cad du rjod par byed pa rnal 'byor ma chen mo'i nges pa brjod pa 'bum phrag sum cu rtsa drug pa las mkha' 'gro rgya mtsho chen po ni rjod par byed pa'o //
analyzed: rgyud thams cad du rjod par byed pa rnal 'byor ma chen mo'i nges pa brjod pa 'bum phrag sum cu rtsa drug pa las mkha' 'gro rgya mtsho chen po ni rjod par byed pa'o //
translated: In all the tantras, the great yoginƒ´‚Äôs definitive expression is the 3,600,000-verse Great Ocean of Dakas Tantra.

original: brjod par bya ba yang mkha' 'gro rgya mtsho'i rgyud kyi rgyal po chud du 'di yis brjod par bya ba'o //
analyzed: brjod par bya ba yang mkha' 'gro rgya mtsho'i rgyud kyi rgyal po chud du 'di yis brjod par bya ba'o //
translated: The subject matter is the king of tantras, the Great Ocean of Dakas Tantra.

original: rdo rje slob dpon gyi zhal las gang rgyud chung du rgyud thams cad rgya che bas 'chad pas na 'brel pa'o //
analyzed: rdo rje slob dpon gyi zhal las gang rgyud chung du rgyud thams cad rgya che bas 'chad pas na 'brel pa'o //
translated: The connection is that the great tantra is taught by the vajra master‚Äôs mouth, and the small tantras are taught by the great tantra.

original: rtsod pa'i dus su sh'akya thub pas thos pa chud ba rnams dang blo dman pa rnams dang bsdus pa yis sangs rgyas nyid 'dod pa de rnams la rgyud chud du gsungs pa ni dgos pa'o //
analyzed: rtsod pa'i dus su sh'akya thub pas thos pa chud ba rnams dang blo dman pa rnams dang bsdus pa yis sangs rgyas nyid 'dod pa de rnams la rgyud chud du gsungs pa ni dgos pa'o //
translated: The purpose is that in the age of strife, for those who have heard the teachings of Shakyamuni but have lost them, and for those of lesser intelligence who desire buddhahood through the concise teachings, the great tantra is taught.

original: slar yang sdud pa po rnams kyis bsdus te sh'akya thub pa yongs su mya ngan las 'das nas phyin chad kyi dus sam snyigs ma lnga rnams su yang rung sems can bla ma la bsnyen bkur ba dang bral ba dpyod pa por gyur pa gad su yang rung
analyzed: slar yang sdud pa po rnams kyis bsdus te sh'akya thub pa yongs su mya ngan las 'das nas phyin chad kyi dus sam snyigs ma lnga rnams su yang rung sems can bla ma la bsnyen bkur ba dang bral ba dpyod pa por gyur pa gad su yang rung
translated: Again, the compilers collected them, and in the future time after Shakyamuni Buddha has passed into nirvana, or in the five degenerations, whoever of the sentient beings who are devoted to the guru and are discerning,

original: ba rnams rang gi 'dod pa rgyud chung du 'di mthong ba dang reg pa dang thos pa rnams kyis sangs rgyas nyid du 'gyur ba ni dgos pa'i dgos pa zhes bya bar 'brel lo //
analyzed: ba rnams rang gi 'dod pa rgyud chung du 'di mthong ba dang reg pa dang thos pa rnams kyis sangs rgyas nyid du 'gyur ba ni dgos pa'i dgos pa zhes bya bar 'brel lo //
translated: will see, touch, or hear this small tantra of their desire, and they will attain buddhahood. This is called the purpose of the purpose.

original: de bzhin du yang rjod par byed pa ni gang stong gsum gyi stong chen po'i 'jig rten thams cad la sangs rgyas rnams kyis de lta bu nyid kyis ming du 'dogs pa'o //
analyzed: de bzhin du yang rjod par byed pa ni gang stong gsum gyi stong chen po'i 'jig rten thams cad la sangs rgyas rnams kyis de lta bu nyid kyis ming du 'dogs pa'o //
translated: Similarly, the expression is that all the worlds of the great trichiliocosm are designated as such by the buddhas.

original: de nyid kyis 'dir bcom ldan 'das kyis rgyud bstan pa ni sgra brnyan lta bu'i mtshan nyid kyis dgos pa dang byed pa gnyis nges par gsungs pa las smra bar mi nus pa nyid kyis rang gi ngo bo gang yin pa de ni brjod par bya ba'o //
analyzed: de nyid kyis 'dir bcom ldan 'das kyis rgyud bstan pa ni sgra brnyan lta bu'i mtshan nyid kyis dgos pa dang byed pa gnyis nges par gsungs pa las smra bar mi nus pa nyid kyis rang gi ngo bo gang yin pa de ni brjod par bya ba'o //
translated: Therefore, here the BhagavƒÅn teaches the Tantra with the characteristic of an echo, and from the two, purpose and function, he teaches the inexpressible. Whatever is its own nature is the object of expression.

original: bstan pa dang bstan par bya ba dag las gang nus pa'i gnas skabs skyes pa chos dang chos nyid kyi mtshan nyid thos pa dang bsam pa dang bsgom pa dag las rnal 'byor pa rnams kyis ye shes de ni 'brel pa zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: bstan pa dang bstan par bya ba dag las gang nus pa'i gnas skabs skyes pa chos dang chos nyid kyi mtshan nyid thos pa dang bsam pa dang bsgom pa dag las rnal 'byor pa rnams kyis ye shes de ni 'brel pa zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: From the teaching and the object of teaching, the state of ability arises, the characteristic of reality and the nature of reality. From hearing, reflection, and meditation, the yogins‚Äô wisdom is called ‚Äúconnection.‚Äù

original: de ltar mchog tu gnyis su med pas bde ba dam pa'i rnam pa nyid sangs rgyas bye ba rnam par 'phro ba las dgos pa'o //
analyzed: de ltar mchog tu gnyis su med pas bde ba dam pa'i rnam pa nyid sangs rgyas bye ba rnam par 'phro ba las dgos pa'o //
translated: Thus, the supreme nonduality is the form of ultimate bliss. From the emanation of ten million buddhas, there is the purpose.

original: dgos par ma zad de sems can thams cad kyi don byed pa'i phyir sangs rgyas de rnams kyis chos rnams bstan pas phyag rgya chen po'i dngos grub thob pa ni dgos pa'i dgos pa'o //
analyzed: dgos par ma zad de sems can thams cad kyi don byed pa'i phyir sangs rgyas de rnams kyis chos rnams bstan pas phyag rgya chen po'i dngos grub thob pa ni dgos pa'i dgos pa'o //
translated: Not only is it necessary, but it is also necessary for the sake of all sentient beings. Therefore, the buddhas teach the dharma. The attainment of the spiritual power of mahƒÅmudrƒÅ is the ultimate purpose.

original: de bzhin du yang thams cad kyi ming bsdus pa dga' ba bzhir chud pa de rnams kyi yang mthar thug par lhan cig skyes pa de'i tshe chud pa gcig dang du ma'i rang bzhin spangs pa chos nyid kyi yul de yang rjod par @11b byed pa'o //
analyzed: de bzhin du yang thams cad kyi ming bsdus pa dga' ba bzhir chud pa de rnams kyi yang mthar thug par lhan cig skyes pa de'i tshe chud pa gcig dang du ma'i rang bzhin spangs pa chos nyid kyi yul de yang rjod par @11b byed pa'o //
translated: Similarly, all the names are included in the four joys. When they are included in the innate at the end of those, the object of reality, which is free from one and many, is also expressed.

original: de dngos po thams cad kyi dbye bar bya ba dang 'byed par byed pa nyid las brjod par bya ba'o //
analyzed: de dngos po thams cad kyi dbye bar bya ba dang 'byed par byed pa nyid las brjod par bya ba'o //
translated: It is expressed from being the object of division and the divider of all things.

original: theg pa chen po'i chos mtha' dag nye bar 'dogs pa nyid las 'brel pa'o //
analyzed: theg pa chen po'i chos mtha' dag nye bar 'dogs pa nyid las 'brel pa'o //
translated: It is connected from being the very designation of all the dharmas of the MahƒÅyƒÅna.

original: zhe sdang la sogs par ltung ba'i sems can rnams gzhug pa'i don ni dgos pa'o //
analyzed: zhe sdang la sogs par ltung ba'i sems can rnams gzhug pa'i don ni dgos pa'o //
translated: The purpose is to engage those sentient beings who have fallen into hatred and so on.

original: de rnams kyis rang gi sems kyi bsam pas las kyi tshogs kyi rigs pas de kho na nyid sna tshogs pa'i ro myad ba ni dgos pa'i dgos pa'o //
analyzed: de rnams kyis rang gi sems kyi bsam pas las kyi tshogs kyi rigs pas de kho na nyid sna tshogs pa'i ro myad ba ni dgos pa'i dgos pa'o //
translated: The experience of the taste of the variety of realities by means of the reasoning of the collection of one's own mental actions is the ultimate purpose.

original: slar yang khyab par bya ba dang khyab par byed pa'i tshul gyis bcom ldan 'das kyi rnam par gzhag pa le'u thams cad dam dum bu yang rung rgyud rnams kyis yang rjod par byed pa'o //
analyzed: slar yang khyab par bya ba dang khyab par byed pa'i tshul gyis bcom ldan 'das kyi rnam par gzhag pa le'u thams cad dam dum bu yang rung rgyud rnams kyis yang rjod par byed pa'o //
translated: Again, the tantras express themselves by means of the method of the pervasion and the pervaded, either in all the chapters or in parts of the Blessed One's arrangement.

original: brjod par bya ba ni dpa' bo dang dpa' mo'i dbang phyug ma rnams kyi le'u thams cad du gtso bo dang dkyil 'khor pa rnams kyi kun du spyod pa'i gnas skabs gang yin pa der bshad do //
analyzed: brjod par bya ba ni dpa' bo dang dpa' mo'i dbang phyug ma rnams kyi le'u thams cad du gtso bo dang dkyil 'khor pa rnams kyi kun du spyod pa'i gnas skabs gang yin pa der bshad do //
translated: The subject matter is explained in all the chapters of the lords of heroes and heroines in the context of the conduct of the principals and the members of the mandala.

original: bsrub pa dang srubs pa'i chos rnams kyis mchog tu mi 'gyur ba'i dngos grub sgrub pa'i thabs ni 'brel pa'o //
analyzed: bsrub pa dang srubs pa'i chos rnams kyis mchog tu mi 'gyur ba'i dngos grub sgrub pa'i thabs ni 'brel pa'o //
translated: The connection is the means of achieving the state of supreme, unchanging, spiritual power by means of the phenomena of the churning and the being churned.

original: du ba la sogs pa'i rtags rnams yan lag drug gi rim pas byed pa ni dgos pa'o //
analyzed: du ba la sogs pa'i rtags rnams yan lag drug gi rim pas byed pa ni dgos pa'o //
translated: The purpose is the performance of the signs such as smoke by means of the process of the six limbs.

original: de rnams kyi rang bzhin dang bral bas phyag rgya'i dngos grub tu chud pa ni dgos pa'i dgos pa'o //
analyzed: de rnams kyi rang bzhin dang bral bas phyag rgya'i dngos grub tu chud pa ni dgos pa'i dgos pa'o //
translated: Since they are free from that nature, they are included in the spiritual powers of the mudra. That is the ultimate purpose.

original: de bzhin du yang /
analyzed: de bzhin du yang /
translated: Likewise,

original: rdo rje dang padma la sogs pa dang gnas dang nye ba'i gnas la sogs pa rnams kyi rtsa rnams kyi ming de ni rjod par byed pa'o //
analyzed: rdo rje dang padma la sogs pa dang gnas dang nye ba'i gnas la sogs pa rnams kyi rtsa rnams kyi ming de ni rjod par byed pa'o //
translated: the names of the channels of the vajra, lotus, and so on, and the places, and the neighboring places, and so on, are the expressions.

original: rlung dang rnam par shes pa gnyis 'dus pa las byang chub kyi sems rab tu 'bab pa ni brjod par bya ba'o //
analyzed: rlung dang rnam par shes pa gnyis 'dus pa las byang chub kyi sems rab tu 'bab pa ni brjod par bya ba'o //
translated: The descent of bodhicitta from the union of the two, the vƒÅyu and the consciousness, is what is expressed.

original: de yang bla ma'i gdams ngag gis gang steng du log pa de ni 'brel pa'o //
analyzed: de yang bla ma'i gdams ngag gis gang steng du log pa de ni 'brel pa'o //
translated: That is filled with the guru‚Äôs instruction, which is the connection.

original: de rnams kyi byang chub kyi sems mtha' dang bral ba khams bzhi rnams kyi thim pa nyid ni dgos pa'o //
analyzed: de rnams kyi byang chub kyi sems mtha' dang bral ba khams bzhi rnams kyi thim pa nyid ni dgos pa'o //
translated: The dissolution of the bodhicitta, free from extremes, into the four elements is the purpose.

original: de rnams kyi yang de bzhin du bskyed pa'i ye shes brjod par bya ba dang rjod par byed pa'i spyod yul ma yin pa'am bya ba thams cad kyi sgrub pa po ni dgos pa'i dgos pa zhes bya bar byas nas rjes su bsgrub par bya'o //
analyzed: de rnams kyi yang de bzhin du bskyed pa'i ye shes brjod par bya ba dang rjod par byed pa'i spyod yul ma yin pa'am bya ba thams cad kyi sgrub pa po ni dgos pa'i dgos pa zhes bya bar byas nas rjes su bsgrub par bya'o //
translated: The knowledge that is generated by those, in turn, is not the domain of expression or that which expresses, or the performer of all actions, which is called the ultimate purpose. Having made that, it should be accomplished.

original: de bzhin du 'dir yang gzhung gi tshogs gang yin pa de rten te /
analyzed: de bzhin du 'dir yang gzhung gi tshogs gang yin pa de rten te /
translated: In the same way, here, whatever is the collection of texts is the basis.

original: gzhung de rnams kyi ba rgyud pa'i rim pas sangs rgyas nyid du 'gro bar byed pa ni rjod par byed pa ste brten pa'o //
analyzed: gzhung de rnams kyi ba rgyud pa'i rim pas sangs rgyas nyid du 'gro bar byed pa ni rjod par byed pa ste brten pa'o //
translated: The one who goes to buddhahood by the process of those texts is the expresser, that is, the basis.

original: de rnams kyi len pa lus dang ngag dang yid rnams kyi las ni brjod par bya ba'o //
analyzed: de rnams kyi len pa lus dang ngag dang yid rnams kyi las ni brjod par bya ba'o //
translated: The action of those, which is the activity of body, speech, and mind, is that which is to be expressed.

original: 'di skad bdag gis zhes bya ba la sogs pa'i sbyor ba yan @12a * //
analyzed: 'di skad bdag gis zhes bya ba la sogs pa'i sbyor ba yan @12a * //

original: bgrod par bya ba dang bgrod par bya ba ma yin pa la sogs pa mchod pa bzhi'i mtshan nyid dang de nyid kyis mchod pa rnam par dag pa la sogs pa byed pa de ni dgos pa'o //üîΩdon dam pa'i sangs rgyas nyid 'gugs pa po byang chub kyi sems nye bar mtshon par bya ba dang de nyid kyis sna tshogs pa'i don byed pa ni dgos pa'i dgos pa'o //üîΩgal te 'dir de snyed kyi slob dpon du ma'i dgongs pa rnams kyis rjod par byed pa la sogs pa rnams bshad de /

original: 'on kyang mngon par shes pa dang ldan pa de bzhin gshegs pa'i gsung gi pha rol tu son pa nges par gcig tu rang dang gzhan gyi don la phan pa shes rab dang ldan pa gzhan la phan ba bskyed pa rang gi don dang gzhan gyi don skyed
analyzed: 'on kyang mngon par shes pa dang ldan pa de bzhin gshegs pa'i gsung gi pha rol tu son pa nges par gcig tu rang dang gzhan gyi don la phan pa shes rab dang ldan pa gzhan la phan ba bskyed pa rang gi don dang gzhan gyi don skyed

original: shes rab dang ldan pa rnams kyi tshig de bzhin du yang ji ltar bla ma dang rnal 'byor ma sngags las skyes pa dang gnas las skyes pa dang lhan cig skyes pa dang zhing las skyes pa rnams kyi mthu sna tshogs las sems can snod dang ldan pa
analyzed: shes rab dang ldan pa rnams kyi tshig de bzhin du yang ji ltar bla ma dang rnal 'byor ma sngags las skyes pa dang gnas las skyes pa dang lhan cig skyes pa dang zhing las skyes pa rnams kyi mthu sna tshogs las sems can snod dang ldan pa

original: zag pa zad pa rnams kyang skye'o //

analyzed: smras pa / phyi ma'i tshe phyi ma'i dus su gang rdo rje slob dpon gyi go 'phang la gnas pa'i slob dpon de rnams kyi yang dag par yid ches par bya ba'i don du slob ma sna tshogs la gnas pa'i dgongs pa rnams kyi gcig nas gcig tu brgyud pa gcig

translated: If it is one, then the BhagavƒÅn, the great hero, the lord, the hero of all the tathƒÅgatas, is endowed with the state of sporting in the bhaga of the yoginƒ´s of the body, speech, and mind of all the tathƒÅgatas.

original: de la 'di skad bdag gis zhes bya ba ni rang nyid mngon par rdzogs par sangs rgyas pa chos mdor bstan par gyur te ston pa po las thos par sdud par gyur to //

original: rang gis zhes bya ba ste /
analyzed: rang gis zhes bya ba ste /

translated: ‚ÄúAt one time‚Äù is stated in the nidƒÅna.

original: dus gcig gi tshe bcom ldan 'das rtsen pa dang ldan par gyur to zhes bya bar 'brel to //
analyzed: dus gcig gi tshe bcom ldan 'das rtsen pa dang ldan par gyur to zhes bya bar 'brel to //
translated: At one time, the BhagavƒÅn was dwelling in RƒÅjag·πõha.

original: dus ni dus te /
analyzed: dus ni dus te /
translated: Time is a time.

original: bcom ldan 'das zhes bya ba ni dbang phyug la sogs pa'i phun sum tshogs pa drug gi skal ba ste /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das zhes bya ba ni dbang phyug la sogs pa'i phun sum tshogs pa drug gi skal ba ste /
translated: ‚ÄúBhagavƒÅn‚Äù means the fortune of the six perfections of lordship, etc.

original: ji ltar gsungs pa /
analyzed: ji ltar gsungs pa /
translated: As it is said:üîΩLordship, wisdom, fame,

original: dbang phyug ye shes @13b grags pa dang // dpal dang gzugs kyi don dang ni //
analyzed: dbang phyug ye shes @13b grags pa dang // dpal dang gzugs kyi don dang ni //
translated: glory, form, and meaning,

original: rab tu brtson pa phun tshogs pa //
analyzed: rab tu brtson pa phun tshogs pa //
translated: 1. The Blessed One is endowed with the perfection of great effort,

original: drug rnams skal ba zhes byar dran //
analyzed: drug rnams skal ba zhes byar dran //
translated: and the perfection of great fortune in the six.

original: zhes so // 'di la skal pa dang ldan pas na bcom ldan 'das so //
analyzed: zhes so // 'di la skal pa dang ldan pas na bcom ldan 'das so //
translated: Here, the Blessed One is endowed with fortune,

original: de bzhin du yang dbang phyug ni bcom ldan 'das de ni bag chags dang bcas pa'i sgrib pa thams cad rab tu spangs pa'i phyir gzhan gyi dbang du ma gyur pa phun sum tshogs pa'o //
analyzed: de bzhin du yang dbang phyug ni bcom ldan 'das de ni bag chags dang bcas pa'i sgrib pa thams cad rab tu spangs pa'i phyir gzhan gyi dbang du ma gyur pa phun sum tshogs pa'o //
translated: and likewise, he is the Blessed One because he is endowed with the perfection of independence, since he has abandoned all obscurations along with their traces, and he is not dependent on others.

original: ye shes phun sum tshogs pa ni thams cad du shes bya'i rnam pa thams cad la thogs pa med pa'i ye shes mnga' ba nyid kyi phyir ro //
analyzed: ye shes phun sum tshogs pa ni thams cad du shes bya'i rnam pa thams cad la thogs pa med pa'i ye shes mnga' ba nyid kyi phyir ro //
translated: He is endowed with the perfection of intuition, since he possesses the intuition that is unobstructed with regard to all aspects of objects of knowledge.

original: grags pa phun sum tshogs pa ste yon tan thams cad kyi rten nyid pas phyogs mtshams rnams su grags par gyur pas khyab pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: grags pa phun sum tshogs pa ste yon tan thams cad kyi rten nyid pas phyogs mtshams rnams su grags par gyur pas khyab pa'i phyir ro //
translated: He is endowed with the perfection of fame, since he is renowned in all directions as the support of all good qualities.

original: dpal phun sum tshogs pa ni 'jig rten dang 'jig rten las 'das pa thams cad kyi phun sum tshogs pa 'dod pa rnams kyi rten du rung ba nyid kyi phyir ro //
analyzed: dpal phun sum tshogs pa ni 'jig rten dang 'jig rten las 'das pa thams cad kyi phun sum tshogs pa 'dod pa rnams kyi rten du rung ba nyid kyi phyir ro //
translated: The perfection of glory is the perfection of all mundane and supramundane perfections, because it is the basis of the desires of those who desire them.

original: gzugs phun sum tshogs pa ni dpe med pa'i mtshan dang dpe byad rnams kyis brgyan pa'i sku nyid kyi phyir ro //
analyzed: gzugs phun sum tshogs pa ni dpe med pa'i mtshan dang dpe byad rnams kyis brgyan pa'i sku nyid kyi phyir ro //
translated: The perfection of form is the body adorned with the major and minor marks that are without compare.

original: brtson pa phun sum tshogs pa ni rnam pa thams cad kyis sems can gyi don byed pa la mchog tu gyur pas 'bad pa nyams su bzhes pa nyid kyi phyir ro //
analyzed: brtson pa phun sum tshogs pa ni rnam pa thams cad kyis sems can gyi don byed pa la mchog tu gyur pas 'bad pa nyams su bzhes pa nyid kyi phyir ro //
translated: The perfection of effort is the undertaking of effort because it is supreme in the performance of the benefit of sentient beings in all aspects.

original: yang 'dir ci bcom ldan 'das de'i dus kyi ston pa pos shes nas rdo rje 'chang chen po rtsen pa dang ldan pas bzhugs par gyur pa dang ldan te bi sngon du 'gro ba'i ha ra ni mnyam par gzhag pa'i spyod pas bzhugs pa ste /
analyzed: yang 'dir ci bcom ldan 'das de'i dus kyi ston pa pos shes nas rdo rje 'chang chen po rtsen pa dang ldan pas bzhugs par gyur pa dang ldan te bi sngon du 'gro ba'i ha ra ni mnyam par gzhag pa'i spyod pas bzhugs pa ste /
translated: Here, what is the teacher of that time? The BhagavƒÅn, having known, abides in the play of MahƒÅvajradhara, and the prefix vi indicates the conduct of equipoise.

original: sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams ni rtag tu mnyam par gzhag pa'o //
analyzed: sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams ni rtag tu mnyam par gzhag pa'o //
translated: The BhagavƒÅn Buddhas are always in equipoise.

original: de 'di la bcom ldan 'das kyis rdzogs par sangs rgyas pa na sangs rgyas kyi bzhugs pa bzhi gsungs te /
analyzed: de 'di la bcom ldan 'das kyis rdzogs par sangs rgyas pa na sangs rgyas kyi bzhugs pa bzhi gsungs te /
translated: The Lord, when he was fully enlightened, taught four kinds of Buddha-activities.

original: lhag pa rnams kyis sbyor ba ji lta ba bzhin te /
analyzed: lhag pa rnams kyis sbyor ba ji lta ba bzhin te /
translated: The others are to be understood according to their etymologies.

original: de la sangs rgyas rnams kyi sku'i phrin las gang ci yang rung ba de de rnams kyi spyod lam gyis bzhugs pa'o //
analyzed: de la sangs rgyas rnams kyi sku'i phrin las gang ci yang rung ba de de rnams kyi spyod lam gyis bzhugs pa'o //
translated: Of these, whatever bodily activity there is of the Buddhas is their activity of abiding in posture.

original: gsung gi phrin las gang ci yang rung ba ni chos ston pas bzhugs pa'o //
analyzed: gsung gi phrin las gang ci yang rung ba ni chos ston pas bzhugs pa'o //
translated: Whatever verbal activity there is is their activity of teaching the Dharma.

original: thugs kyi phrin las gang ting nge 'dzin la snyoms par zhugs pas rang bzhin gyis mnyam par gzhag pa ni snyoms par 'jug pas bzhugs pa'o //
analyzed: thugs kyi phrin las gang ting nge 'dzin la snyoms par zhugs pas rang bzhin gyis mnyam par gzhag pa ni snyoms par 'jug pas bzhugs pa'o //
translated: Whatever mental activity there is, their natural meditative concentration is their activity of meditative concentration.

original: thugs kyi phrin las gang sangs rgyas kyi spyan gyis sems can rnams la rnam par gzigs pas lha la sogs pa nye bar 'ongs pas kyang nang du yang dag 'jog la bzhugs pa'o //üîΩde yang bzhugs @14a * //
analyzed: thugs kyi phrin las gang sangs rgyas kyi spyan gyis sems can rnams la rnam par gzigs pas lha la sogs pa nye bar 'ongs pas kyang nang du yang dag 'jog la bzhugs pa'o // de yang bzhugs @14a * //
translated: Whatever mental activity there is, their vision of sentient beings with the eye of a Buddha is their activity of vision, because even when they are in solitary retreat they see those who have come near such as gods.üîΩAnd that is their activity of abiding.

original: par gyur pa dang ldan pa'o //
analyzed: par gyur pa dang ldan pa'o //
translated: It is associated with their abiding.

original: rang gi mtshan nyid gsungs pa /
analyzed: rang gi mtshan nyid gsungs pa /
translated: The meaning of his name is stated:

original: dpa' bo chen po dbang phyug ces bya ba ste /
analyzed: dpa' bo chen po dbang phyug ces bya ba ste /
translated: The great hero is called ‚Äúƒ™≈õvara.‚Äù

original: nyon mongs pa dang nye ba'i nyon mongs pa las rgyal ba'i phyir dpa' po'am /
analyzed: nyon mongs pa dang nye ba'i nyon mongs pa las rgyal ba'i phyir dpa' po'am /
translated: He is a hero because he is victorious over the afflictions and the secondary afflictions,

original: rang gi lus dang srog la ltos pa med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rang gi lus dang srog la ltos pa med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: or because he is indifferent to his own body and life.

original: rab tu dga' ba la sogs pa'i rim pas rdo rje 'chang chen po'i sa brnyes par gyur pas 'gro ba mtha' dag gi don mdzad pa yang ngo //
analyzed: rab tu dga' ba la sogs pa'i rim pas rdo rje 'chang chen po'i sa brnyes par gyur pas 'gro ba mtha' dag gi don mdzad pa yang ngo //
translated: He is the great lord of the stage of Vajradhara, who has attained the stage of Vajradhara through the stages of the Joyous and so forth, and who acts for the welfare of all transmigrating beings.

original: de go mas pas gzung ba dang 'dzin pa'i rnam pa'i bag chags dang bral ba nyid kyi phyir chos chen po zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: de go mas pas gzung ba dang 'dzin pa'i rnam pa'i bag chags dang bral ba nyid kyi phyir chos chen po zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: He is called ‚Äúthe great Dharma‚Äù because he is free from the habitual tendencies of the apprehended and the apprehender.

original: 'di ltar gsum dang drug dang bcu gnyis kyi 'khor lo rnams su gnas pa rnams kyi bcu gnyis rnams la rnam par gnas pa'i rdo rje 'chang chen po'i dbang phyug ste /
analyzed: 'di ltar gsum dang drug dang bcu gnyis kyi 'khor lo rnams su gnas pa rnams kyi bcu gnyis rnams la rnam par gnas pa'i rdo rje 'chang chen po'i dbang phyug ste /
translated: Thus, he is the great lord of the stage of Vajradhara, who is situated on the twelve stages, which are situated on the three, six, and twelve channel-wheels.

original: dpa' bo chen po'i dbang phyug de rtsen par gyur pa dang ldan no zhes bya bar dgongs so //
analyzed: dpa' bo chen po'i dbang phyug de rtsen par gyur pa dang ldan no zhes bya bar dgongs so //
translated: He is the lord of great heroes, and he is the one who is sporting.

original: 'di la yang 'khor lo gsum ni thugs kyis so //
analyzed: 'di la yang 'khor lo gsum ni thugs kyis so //
translated: Here, the three wheels are of the mind,

original: 'khor lo drug ni gsung gi'o //
analyzed: 'khor lo drug ni gsung gi'o //
translated: the six wheels are of speech,

original: 'khor lo bcu gnyis ni sku'i ste de ltar sku gsung thugs kyi 'khor lo rnams su sangs rgyas bye ba mtha' yas mu med pa rnam par spro ba zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: 'khor lo bcu gnyis ni sku'i ste de ltar sku gsung thugs kyi 'khor lo rnams su sangs rgyas bye ba mtha' yas mu med pa rnam par spro ba zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: and the twelve wheels are of the body. Thus, the meaning is that he is the one who emanates infinite millions of buddhas as wheels of body, speech, and mind.

original: gang du bzhugs she na /
analyzed: gang du bzhugs she na /
translated: Where does he reside?üîΩTherefore, it is said:

original: de'i phyir gsungs pa de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad ces bya ba la sogs pa ste /üîΩchos nyid ji lta ba bzhin du gshegs pa'i ye shes 'di de bzhin du gsungs pa'i phyir de bzhin gshegs pa ni sangs rgyas kyi lung gi ye shes kyi don nyid kyi phyir ro //
analyzed: de'i phyir gsungs pa de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad ces bya ba la sogs pa ste / chos nyid ji lta ba bzhin du gshegs pa'i ye shes 'di de bzhin du gsungs pa'i phyir de bzhin gshegs pa ni sangs rgyas kyi lung gi ye shes kyi don nyid kyi phyir ro //
translated: All tathƒÅgatas, etc.üîΩThe wisdom of the tathƒÅgatas is so called because it goes just as it is to reality. The tathƒÅgatas are so called because they have the wisdom of the Buddha‚Äôs scriptures.

original: gsungs pa nyid kyis nges pa'i tshig gi rigs pas rtar brjod pa nyid kyis sgrub pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gsungs pa nyid kyis nges pa'i tshig gi rigs pas rtar brjod pa nyid kyis sgrub pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The word ‚ÄútathƒÅgata‚Äù is etymologized as ‚Äúhe who has gone thus‚Äù because he has gone to the meaning of the wisdom of the scriptures.

original: de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad kyi sku dang gsung dang thugs rnams ni de rnams kyi snying po'i don dam pa stong pa nyid do //
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad kyi sku dang gsung dang thugs rnams ni de rnams kyi snying po'i don dam pa stong pa nyid do //
translated: The bodies, speech, and minds of all the Tathagatas are the ultimate emptiness, the meaning of their essence.

original: de'i phyir 'di ltar gru gsum pa nam mkha' lta bu'o //
analyzed: de'i phyir 'di ltar gru gsum pa nam mkha' lta bu'o //
translated: Therefore, it is like this: the triangle is like the sky.

original: de yang dpa' bo'i bde ba thams cad kyi rten nyid kyi phyir ro //
analyzed: de yang dpa' bo'i bde ba thams cad kyi rten nyid kyi phyir ro //
translated: And that is the basis of all the bliss of the hero.

original: sku gsung thugs kyi dbye ba yis //
analyzed: sku gsung thugs kyi dbye ba yis //
translated: By the division of body, speech, and mind,

original: gru gsum du ni rnam par bsgom //
analyzed: gru gsum du ni rnam par bsgom //
translated: one should meditate on the triangle.

original: zhes bya ba'i gsung gis so //
analyzed: zhes bya ba'i gsung gis so //
translated: This is what is said.

original: rnal 'byor ma'i bha ga rnams su zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: rnal 'byor ma'i bha ga rnams su zhes bya ba ni /
translated: In the bhagas of the yoginis,

original: mkha' 'gro ma la sogs pa rig ma sum cu rtsa drug de rnams kyi bha ga rnams ni padmo rnams te de nyid snying po'o //
analyzed: mkha' 'gro ma la sogs pa rig ma sum cu rtsa drug de rnams kyi bha ga rnams ni padmo rnams te de nyid snying po'o //
translated: the bhagas of those thirty-six knowledge goddesses such as the dakini are the lotuses, and that itself is the essence.

original: 'di bud med nyid ma yin te /
analyzed: 'di bud med nyid ma yin te /
translated: This is not a woman.

original: ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: de nyid kyi snying po'i bye brag ste /
analyzed: de nyid kyi snying po'i bye brag ste /
translated: It is a particular essence of that,

original: nu ma dang gdong la sogs pa dang gos kyi dbye bas so //
analyzed: nu ma dang gdong la sogs pa dang gos kyi dbye bas so //
translated: by the division of breasts, face, etc., and clothing.

original: skye gnas rang bzhin nyid shes rab cis @14b bya ba'i tshig gis so //
analyzed: skye gnas rang bzhin nyid shes rab cis @14b bya ba'i tshig gis so //
translated: The nature of the wombs is wisdom.

original: de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad kyi sku dang gsung dang thugs kyi snying po ni de'i rdo rje btsun mo'i bha ga rnams la zhes bya ste /
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad kyi sku dang gsung dang thugs kyi snying po ni de'i rdo rje btsun mo'i bha ga rnams la zhes bya ste /
translated: The essence of the body, speech, and mind of all the Tathagatas is in their vajra-queen bhagas.

original: de bzhin du gsungs pa chos kyi 'byung gnas kyi phyag rgya zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: de bzhin du gsungs pa chos kyi 'byung gnas kyi phyag rgya zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: Thus it is said that the Dharma-source is the seal.

original: de rnams su bcom ldan 'das rtsen pa dang ldan pa'o //
analyzed: de rnams su bcom ldan 'das rtsen pa dang ldan pa'o //
translated: The Bhagavat sports in them.

original: chos kyi 'byung gnas kyi nang du khang pa brtsegs pa zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: chos kyi 'byung gnas kyi nang du khang pa brtsegs pa zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: The meaning of the ‚Äúpalace‚Äù in the Dharma-source is this.

original: 'di lta ste grong khyer na phyug po gnas so zhes bya ba yang grong khyer gyi dbus kyi khang bzangs na'o zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: 'di lta ste grong khyer na phyug po gnas so zhes bya ba yang grong khyer gyi dbus kyi khang bzangs na'o zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: For example, when it is said that a rich man lives in a city, it means that he lives in a fine house in the center of the city.

original: ci'i don du de rnams su rtsen par gyur pa dang ldan /
analyzed: ci'i don du de rnams su rtsen par gyur pa dang ldan /
translated: For what purpose does he sport in them?

original: rnal 'byor ma'i gsang ba chen po mkha' 'gro rgya mtsho bstan par bya'o zhes 'chad pa las de la dbang bar gyur pa rnams dgug par bya ba'i don du'o //
analyzed: rnal 'byor ma'i gsang ba chen po mkha' 'gro rgya mtsho bstan par bya'o zhes 'chad pa las de la dbang bar gyur pa rnams dgug par bya ba'i don du'o //
translated: The great secret of Yoginƒ´ will be taught in the Ocean of Dakas.

original: gang dang lhan cig tu rtsen par gyur pa dang ldan par gsungs pa /üîΩphag mo la sogs pa rnal 'byor ma sum cu rtsa bdun rnams dang de bzhin du thod pa'i dum bu la sogs pa dpa' bo nyi shu rtsa bzhi dang yang thabs cig ste gzhan bye ba 'bum phrag stong rnams dang mtha' yas mu med pa'i ri rab kyi
analyzed: gang dang lhan cig tu rtsen par gyur pa dang ldan par gsungs pa / phag mo la sogs pa rnal 'byor ma sum cu rtsa bdun rnams dang de bzhin du thod pa'i dum bu la sogs pa dpa' bo nyi shu rtsa bzhi dang yang thabs cig ste gzhan bye ba 'bum phrag stong rnams dang mtha' yas mu med pa'i ri rab kyi
translated: It is said that he plays and is endowed with those with whom he plays,

original: rdul gyi tshad kyi dpa' bo dang dpa' mo'i dbang phyug ma rnams dang lhan cig bzhugs pa dang ldan par gyur to zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: rdul gyi tshad kyi dpa' bo dang dpa' mo'i dbang phyug ma rnams dang lhan cig bzhugs pa dang ldan par gyur to zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: namely, the thirty-seven yoginƒ´s beginning with VƒÅrƒÅhƒ´, and likewise the twenty-four heroes beginning with KapƒÅlaspho·π≠a, and also with a thousand times a hundred thousand times ten million others, and with an infinite number of heroes and heroines equal to the atoms of Mount Meru.üîΩIt means he is endowed with dwelling together with them.

original: de'i phyir bcom ldan 'das der de bzhin du dpa' bo dang dpa' mo'i dbang phyug ma rnams dang lhan cig bsdu ba byas nas aa wa dh'u t'i'i chos kyi 'byung gnas kyi nang du yang dag pa'i ye shes kyi rang bzhin gyis bzhugs so zhes bya ba'i don
analyzed: de'i phyir bcom ldan 'das der de bzhin du dpa' bo dang dpa' mo'i dbang phyug ma rnams dang lhan cig bsdu ba byas nas aa wa dh'u t'i'i chos kyi 'byung gnas kyi nang du yang dag pa'i ye shes kyi rang bzhin gyis bzhugs so zhes bya ba'i don
translated: Therefore, the BhagavƒÅn, in the same way, having gathered with the heroines and heroesses, resides in the inner source of phenomena of the avadh≈´tƒ´ with the nature of perfect wisdom.

original: to // gnas de rnams su ye shes kyi snang bas mtshan ma bcu bzhi mthong ba ni rang gi rig pa'i rang bzhin nyid kyis te /
analyzed: to // gnas de rnams su ye shes kyi snang bas mtshan ma bcu bzhi mthong ba ni rang gi rig pa'i rang bzhin nyid kyis te /
translated: The seeing of the fourteen signs by the light of wisdom in those places is by the nature of one‚Äôs awareness.

original: de yang phyed dang bcas pa'i tshigs su bcad pas ye shes kyi mtshan ma dngos su nyams su myong ba nyid kyi phyir ro //
analyzed: de yang phyed dang bcas pa'i tshigs su bcad pas ye shes kyi mtshan ma dngos su nyams su myong ba nyid kyi phyir ro //
translated: Moreover, it is by the half-verse, because the signs of wisdom are actually experienced.

original: de'i dbang du byas nas gsungs pa /
analyzed: de'i dbang du byas nas gsungs pa /
translated: In this regard, it is said:

original: dbang po'i dra ba zhes bya ba la sogs pa ste /
analyzed: dbang po'i dra ba zhes bya ba la sogs pa ste /
translated: The web of the senses, and so on.

original: dbang po ni don dang bcas pa nyid kyi phyir dang / bde ba thams cad lhun gyis grub pas rab tu 'bab pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: dbang po ni don dang bcas pa nyid kyi phyir dang / bde ba thams cad lhun gyis grub pas rab tu 'bab pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The senses are endowed with objects, and all bliss flows spontaneously.

original: dbang po gang gis 'jig rten thams cad kyi mchog gi theg pa mthong ba ste /
analyzed: dbang po gang gis 'jig rten thams cad kyi mchog gi theg pa mthong ba ste /
translated: By which faculty one sees the vehicle that is the highest of all worlds.

original: bcom ldan 'das de bde ba thams cad dang ldan pa zhes bya ba'i ting nge 'dzin rab tu brnyes pa'o //üîΩgang gi phyir dra ba de thams cad bsdus par gyur nas ye shes kyi rgya mtsho la dpa' bo dang dpa' mo'i dbang phyug rnams dang lhan cig gzigs @15a * //
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das de bde ba thams cad dang ldan pa zhes bya ba'i ting nge 'dzin rab tu brnyes pa'o // gang gi phyir dra ba de thams cad bsdus par gyur nas ye shes kyi rgya mtsho la dpa' bo dang dpa' mo'i dbang phyug rnams dang lhan cig gzigs @15a * //
translated: The Blessed One has attained the samadhi called Endowed with All Happiness.

original: pa'o // 'di ni mtshan ma dang po'o //
analyzed: pa'o // 'di ni mtshan ma dang po'o //
translated: Because all those nets are gathered together and seen together with the lords of heroes and heroines in the ocean of wisdom. This is the first sign.

original: gnyis pa'i dbang du byas nas gsungs pa /
analyzed: gnyis pa'i dbang du byas nas gsungs pa /
translated: With reference to the second, it is said:

original: dra ba zhes bya ba ste gang sngon du bde ba thams cad dang ldan pa zhes bya ba'i ting nge 'dzin rab tu bsgrubs te bsdu ba byas nas zhes bya ba'i tshig gis dang / 'khor ba'i 'khor lo thams cad de'i rang bzhin nyid du 'dzin pa ni gnyis su mad pa nyid kyi phyir te mtshan ma gnyis pa'o //
analyzed: dra ba zhes bya ba ste gang sngon du bde ba thams cad dang ldan pa zhes bya ba'i ting nge 'dzin rab tu bsgrubs te bsdu ba byas nas zhes bya ba'i tshig gis dang / 'khor ba'i 'khor lo thams cad de'i rang bzhin nyid du 'dzin pa ni gnyis su mad pa nyid kyi phyir te mtshan ma gnyis pa'o //
translated: The so-called net, which was previously accomplished as the samadhi called Endowed with All Happiness, is gathered together by the words having gathered and the entire wheel of samsara is held to be of its very nature, because of non-duality. This is the second sign.

original: de nas gsum pa gsungs pa /
analyzed: de nas gsum pa gsungs pa /
translated: Then, the third is stated:

original: bdag gis zhes bya ba ste rags pa 'dis bdag las 'gro ba thams cad sprul pa dang bdag gi rnam par yang dag par gnas pa dang ma lus pa bdag gis rang bzhin du mthong ste bdag gi de snying po'o //
analyzed: bdag gis zhes bya ba ste rags pa 'dis bdag las 'gro ba thams cad sprul pa dang bdag gi rnam par yang dag par gnas pa dang ma lus pa bdag gis rang bzhin du mthong ste bdag gi de snying po'o //
translated: By me means that by this coarse [body], all migrating beings are emanated from me, and the nature of all of them is seen to be me.

original: de nas yang mthong ba zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: de nas yang mthong ba zhes bya ba ni /
translated: Then, seeing means

original: khams gsum pa thams cad bde ba chen po'i rnam pa'i rang bzhin sgyu ma dang smig rgyu lta bu dang rmi lam dang 'dra ba'i bde ba de thams cad bde ba chen po ste /
analyzed: khams gsum pa thams cad bde ba chen po'i rnam pa'i rang bzhin sgyu ma dang smig rgyu lta bu dang rmi lam dang 'dra ba'i bde ba de thams cad bde ba chen po ste /
translated: that the entire three realms are of the nature of the aspect of great bliss, like an illusion, a mirage, and similar to a dream. That bliss is great bliss.

original: de yang bde ba zhes bya ba ni zag pa dang bcas pa'i rnam pa sangs rgyas thams cad kyi bde ba'i rang bzhin nyid kyis so //
analyzed: de yang bde ba zhes bya ba ni zag pa dang bcas pa'i rnam pa sangs rgyas thams cad kyi bde ba'i rang bzhin nyid kyis so //
translated: Moreover, bliss means that by the nature of the bliss of all buddhas, it is of the aspect of having outflows.

original: gang gi phyir sangs rgyas rnams kyi phung po dang bcas pa dang phung po lhag ma med pa'i mya ngan las 'das pa'i dbyings gnyis te /
analyzed: gang gi phyir sangs rgyas rnams kyi phung po dang bcas pa dang phung po lhag ma med pa'i mya ngan las 'das pa'i dbyings gnyis te /
translated: Because there are two for the buddhas: the realm of nirvƒÅ·πáa with remainder and without remainder.

original: de yang phung po dang bcas pa ni nyan thos rnams kyi'o //
analyzed: de yang phung po dang bcas pa ni nyan thos rnams kyi'o //
translated: Moreover, the one with the aggregates is that of the ≈õrƒÅvakas.

original: phung po lhag ma med pa ni yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas rnams kyi'o //
analyzed: phung po lhag ma med pa ni yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas rnams kyi'o //
translated: The one without the remaining aggregates is that of the completely perfect buddhas.

original: de'i phyir zag pa med pa'i bde bas sangs rgyas rnams kyi chos kyi sku'i mtshan nyid de mthong zhes bya ba ni bzhi pa'o //
analyzed: de'i phyir zag pa med pa'i bde bas sangs rgyas rnams kyi chos kyi sku'i mtshan nyid de mthong zhes bya ba ni bzhi pa'o //
translated: Therefore, the characteristic of the dharmakƒÅya of the buddhas is the undefiled bliss. Seeing that is the fourth.

original: bde ba chen po'i ting nge 'dzin gyis zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: bde ba chen po'i ting nge 'dzin gyis zhes bya ba ni /
translated: By the samƒÅdhi of great bliss.

original: 'di ltar mthong ba'i sgras lha'i dbang pos ye shes kyi rang gi bdag nyid do //
analyzed: 'di ltar mthong ba'i sgras lha'i dbang pos ye shes kyi rang gi bdag nyid do //
translated: Thus, the word ‚Äúseeing‚Äù is the eye of the god, which is the nature of gnosis.

original: ji ltar mthong ba de bzhin du nges par gzigs pa las grangs med pa sangs rgyas kyi rang bzhin mthong bar 'gyur te /
analyzed: ji ltar mthong ba de bzhin du nges par gzigs pa las grangs med pa sangs rgyas kyi rang bzhin mthong bar 'gyur te /

original: 'on kyang thams cad bsdu ba mdzad nas nam mkha' la til gyi gang du bzhin du rgyal ba dang rgyal ba'i sras longs spyod rdzogs pa'i sku'i bdag nyid gang yin pa zhes bya ba'i don to /
analyzed: 'on kyang thams cad bsdu ba mdzad nas nam mkha' la til gyi gang du bzhin du rgyal ba dang rgyal ba'i sras longs spyod rdzogs pa'i sku'i bdag nyid gang yin pa zhes bya ba'i don to /
translated: However, having gathered them all together, like a sesame pod in space, the nature of the victors and the victors‚Äô heirs, which is the nature of the sa·πÉbhogakƒÅya, is the meaning of ‚Äúall.‚Äù

original: 'di ni tshig lnga pa'o //
analyzed: 'di ni tshig lnga pa'o //

original: tshig 'dis rkang pa drug rnams bshad do //
analyzed: tshig 'dis rkang pa drug rnams bshad do //

original: de'i phyir sngon du gsungs pa'i mtshan ma drug po bzhi rnams dang bcas pas mtshan ma bcur 'gyur ro //

original: gzhan gyi dbang du byas nas gsungs pa /
analyzed: gzhan gyi dbang du byas nas gsungs pa /
translated: With regard to the other, it is said:

original: zhes bya ba la sogs pa ste 'khor ba ni sngon @15b du bshad pa'i ting nge 'dzin tha mal pa'i nga rgyal dang bral bas 'khor ba der yang dag par 'khor bas kun rdzob dang don dam pa nyid du bstan pa zhes bya bar dgongs pa'o //
analyzed: zhes bya ba la sogs pa ste 'khor ba ni sngon @15b du bshad pa'i ting nge 'dzin tha mal pa'i nga rgyal dang bral bas 'khor ba der yang dag par 'khor bas kun rdzob dang don dam pa nyid du bstan pa zhes bya bar dgongs pa'o //
translated: and so on. Samsara is the ordinary pride that is free from the samadhi explained previously. Since one truly cycles in that samsara, it is called the conventional and ultimate.

original: de'i phyir rten dang brten pa'i gzugs kyi bdag nyid ni bcom ldan 'das dbang po'i dra ba dang mnyam pas dbye ba med pa nyid kyis te mtshan ma bcu gcig pa'o //
analyzed: de'i phyir rten dang brten pa'i gzugs kyi bdag nyid ni bcom ldan 'das dbang po'i dra ba dang mnyam pas dbye ba med pa nyid kyis te mtshan ma bcu gcig pa'o //
translated: Therefore, the support and the supported, which are the nature of form, are the Bhagavat. Since they are inseparable, they are the eleventh sign.

original: rnam par byang pas zhes bya ba ni 'khor ba de yang chos kyi sku'i khongs su son pa ste mi bden pa nyid kyi phyir ro //

original: mthong ba ni dri za'i grong khyer ji lta pa bzhin du'o //
analyzed: mthong ba ni dri za'i grong khyer ji lta pa bzhin du'o //

original: rnam par byang ba ni rgyu mtshan bcu gnyis pa'o //

original: mya ngan las 'das pa so sor sgrub ces bya ba ni mya ngan las 'das pa ni kun rdzob dang don dam pa dbyer med pa nyid kyi phyir nges par 'byung ba de ni sangs rgyas rnams kyi yul dang rigs te spyod yul ma yin pa nyid kyi
analyzed: mya ngan las 'das pa so sor sgrub ces bya ba ni mya ngan las 'das pa ni kun rdzob dang don dam pa dbyer med pa nyid kyi phyir nges par 'byung ba de ni sangs rgyas rnams kyi yul dang rigs te spyod yul ma yin pa nyid kyi
translated: ‚ÄúAttaining nirvana‚Äù means that nirvana is the emancipation of the non-duality of the conventional and the ultimate. That emancipation is the domain and lineage of the Buddhas, because it is not an object of experience.

original: gzhu rnams kyis mda' ji lta ba bzhin du ste /
analyzed: gzhu rnams kyis mda' ji lta ba bzhin du ste /

original: lhan cig skyes pa'i dga' ba'i phyir lhag ma nam mkha' mchog gi mtshan nyid dang de nyid bzhi pa ste ye shes kyi sku zhes bya ba de de bzhin du gsungs pa'o //

translated: However, nature refers to the twenty-four elements and the twenty-four transits. Among them, the nature of the heroes, which arises from each of their own elements, is the cause of sa·πÉsƒÅra, and the nature of the buddhas is the cause of supreme nirvƒÅ·πáa.

original: de ji ltar zhe na /

translated: The conduct of all the Tathagatas of the past, which is equal to the atoms of Sumeru, which is beyond expression, is the characteristic of that conduct.

original: de'i phyir gzhung rgya che la /
analyzed: de'i phyir gzhung rgya che la /

analyzed: yang na bde ba chen po'i ye shes kyi rnam pa'i ting nge 'dzin la snyoms par zhugs pas gang gzigs pa'i mtshan ma bcu bzhi ste /
