analyzed: 'od gsal ba'i rnam pa'i nga rgyal gyis bdag gis te /
translated: By the mere pride of 'I' means by the pride of the aspect of clear light.üîΩBy the mere pride of 'I' means by the pride of the aspect of clear light.üîΩBy the mere pride of 'I' means by the pride of the aspect of clear light.üîΩBy the mere pride of 'I' means by the pride of the aspect of clear light.üîΩBy the mere pride of 'I' means by the pride of the aspect of clear light.üîΩBy the mere pride of 'I' means by the pride of the aspect of clear light.üîΩBy the mere pride of 'I' means by the pride of the aspect of clear light.üîΩBy the mere pride of 'I' means by the pride of the aspect of clear light.üîΩBy the mere pride of 'I' means by the pride of the aspect of clear light.üîΩBy the mere pride of 'I' means by the pride of the aspect of clear light.üîΩBy the mere pride of 'I' means by the pride of the aspect of clear light.üîΩBy the mere pride of 'I' means by the pride of the aspect of clear light.üîΩBy the mere pride of 'I' means by the pride of the aspect of clear light.üîΩBy the mere pride of 'I' means by the pride of the aspect of clear light.üîΩBy the mere pride of 'I' means by the pride of the aspect of clear light.

original: gang gi phyir bdag gis ni 'od gsal ba'i ngo bos so //üîΩde yang 'jig rten mchog gi chos so //
analyzed: gang gi phyir bdag gis ni 'od gsal ba'i ngo bos so //üîΩde yang 'jig rten mchog gi chos so //
translated: By the mere pride of 'I' means by the pride of the aspect of clear light.üîΩBy the mere pride of 'I' means by the pride of

original: bdag gi nga rgyal tsam de nyid kyis dang sngon gyi smon lam gyi dbang gis so //
analyzed: bdag gi nga rgyal tsam de nyid kyis dang sngon gyi smon lam gyi dbang gis so //
translated: By the power of that very pride of self and by the power of former prayers,

original: ji ltar rab tu dga' ba la sogs pa nas chos kyi sprin gyi bar du byang chub sems dpa'i sa bcu rnams bsgrubs pa rnams te de'i phyir kun du 'od kyi sa bcu gcig pa la zhugs te /
analyzed: ji ltar rab tu dga' ba la sogs pa nas chos kyi sprin gyi bar du byang chub sems dpa'i sa bcu rnams bsgrubs pa rnams te de'i phyir kun du 'od kyi sa bcu gcig pa la zhugs te /
translated: having accomplished the ten bodhisattva stages from the Joyous up to the Cloud of Dharma, he enters the eleventh stage, the stage of Universal Light,

original: yang dag pa'i chos kyi sku'i bdag nyid can no //
analyzed: yang dag pa'i chos kyi sku'i bdag nyid can no //
translated: which is the nature of the body of the perfect Dharma.

original: slar yang mos pas spyod pa'i sa las dang po pa'i thog ma la gnas pa nas bcu gcig pa dang bcu gnyis pa 'khor ba ji srid par 'khor lo la gnas pa can khyad par du 'phags pa goms pa de nyid kyis nga rgyal bdag gis grub po
analyzed: slar yang mos pas spyod pa'i sa las dang po pa'i thog ma la gnas pa nas bcu gcig pa dang bcu gnyis pa 'khor ba ji srid par 'khor lo la gnas pa can khyad par du 'phags pa goms pa de nyid kyis nga rgyal bdag gis grub po
translated: Again, from the stage of practice through faith, from the first stage of the beginner up to the eleventh and twelfth stages, which remain in cyclic existence as long as it lasts, by the power of that very practice of the superiority of the stage, he accomplishes the pride of self.

original: zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: This is the meaning.

original: de'i phyir sa gnyis kyis rdo rje 'chang chen po'i sa rab tu bsgrubs so //
analyzed: de'i phyir sa gnyis kyis rdo rje 'chang chen po'i sa rab tu bsgrubs so //
translated: Therefore, by the two stages, he accomplishes the stage of Great Vajradhara.

original: gang gi phyir gnyis su med pa ni las dang po pa la sogs pa nas brtsams nas thams cad la bya ba dang las sgrub pa'am /
analyzed: gang gi phyir gnyis su med pa ni las dang po pa la sogs pa nas brtsams nas thams cad la bya ba dang las sgrub pa'am /
translated: Because non-duality is the activity and the accomplishment of the rite, beginning with the beginner, and for all,üîΩwhether or not the rite is accomplished, it is the awareness of the non-dual reality of the true Dharma.

original: mi @18b sgrub pa yang rung dam pa'i chos dngos po gnyis su med pa'i rnam par rig ces bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: mi @18b sgrub pa yang rung dam pa'i chos dngos po gnyis su med pa'i rnam par rig ces bya ba'i don to //
translated: That is the meaning.üîΩTherefore,

original: de'i phyir / dam tshig mchog gang byung ba'o //üîΩzhes bya ba ste /
analyzed: de'i phyir / dam tshig mchog gang byung ba'o // zhes bya ba ste /
translated: the supreme commitment that has arisen.

original: mchog ni 'jig rten thams cad kyi brtan pa la sogs pa rnams so //
analyzed: mchog ni 'jig rten thams cad kyi brtan pa la sogs pa rnams so //
translated: The supreme ones are all the worldly steadfast ones, etc.

original: dam tshig las byung ba yang dag pa'i ye shes kyi bdag nyid kyi phyir khyad par du 'phags pa'i 'jig rten rnams so //
analyzed: dam tshig las byung ba yang dag pa'i ye shes kyi bdag nyid kyi phyir khyad par du 'phags pa'i 'jig rten rnams so //
translated: The supreme worldly ones are those who have arisen from the commitment, because they have the nature of correct pristine awareness.

original: gzhan lta ba drug gi bdag nyid can rnams so //
analyzed: gzhan lta ba drug gi bdag nyid can rnams so //
translated: Others are those who have the nature of the six views.

original: nga dang mi mthun pa gang gis gshin rje'i las kyi bdag nyid las skyes so //
analyzed: nga dang mi mthun pa gang gis gshin rje'i las kyi bdag nyid las skyes so //
translated: Those who are not in accord with me are born from the karma of the Lord of Death.

original: ji ltar na byang chub sems dpa' rnams la gshin rje'i las yin /
analyzed: ji ltar na byang chub sems dpa' rnams la gshin rje'i las yin /
translated: How is it that the Lord of Death is the karma of the bodhisattvas?

original: gang gi phyir byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi lus rdo rje'i rang bzhin las 'chi 'pho ba la sogs pa med do //
analyzed: gang gi phyir byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi lus rdo rje'i rang bzhin las 'chi 'pho ba la sogs pa med do //
translated: Because for the Bodhisattvas, there is no death, etc., from the nature of their vajra-like bodies.

original: gang gi phyir gshin rje'i las can nyid kyis srog gcod pa grub po zhe na /
analyzed: gang gi phyir gshin rje'i las can nyid kyis srog gcod pa grub po zhe na /
translated: But if it is argued that the Bodhisattvas are established as murderers because they have the karma of Yama,

original: 'dir bshad pa gang byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi gshin rje'i las de ni bden te /
analyzed: 'dir bshad pa gang byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi gshin rje'i las de ni bden te /
translated: the author replies: It is true that the Bodhisattvas have the karma of Yama.

original: 'on kyang 'dir sna tshogs pa'i las kyi tshogs kyi dus rnams su byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyis las kyi tshogs gang byed pa de rang gi don phun sum tshogs pa de ma yin te /
analyzed: 'on kyang 'dir sna tshogs pa'i las kyi tshogs kyi dus rnams su byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyis las kyi tshogs gang byed pa de rang gi don phun sum tshogs pa de ma yin te /
translated: But the karma that the Bodhisattvas perform at various times is not for their own perfection,

original: gcig tu sems can rnams la phan pa'i blos so //
analyzed: gcig tu sems can rnams la phan pa'i blos so //
translated: but rather with the intention of benefiting sentient beings.

original: ci'i phyir 'di na bstan pa dang bla ma dang sangs rgyas dang byang chub sems dpa' rnams la gnod par byed pa de'i phyir mnar med pa la sogs par 'gro bar byed do //
analyzed: ci'i phyir 'di na bstan pa dang bla ma dang sangs rgyas dang byang chub sems dpa' rnams la gnod par byed pa de'i phyir mnar med pa la sogs par 'gro bar byed do //
translated: Why is it that they go to Avici, etc., in order to harm the teachings, the gurus, the Buddhas, and the Bodhisattvas?

original: de la sogs pa rnams la bltas nas de rnams drang ba'i rgyur te bdag rang gi phyir spyod na dmyal bar 'gro bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de la sogs pa rnams la bltas nas de rnams drang ba'i rgyur te bdag rang gi phyir spyod na dmyal bar 'gro bar 'gyur ro //
translated: Having seen such things, if one acts for the sake of oneself, one will go to hell.

original: de nyid kyis dbang phyug la sogs pa'i lta ba rnams kyi tshad ma'i bstan bcos bcom ldan 'das kyis gsungs so //
analyzed: de nyid kyis dbang phyug la sogs pa'i lta ba rnams kyi tshad ma'i bstan bcos bcom ldan 'das kyis gsungs so //
translated: The Lord has taught the treatise on logic in order to destroy the views of ƒ™≈õvara, etc.

original: de bzhin du 'jig rten gyi lta ba thams cad bdag gi rang bzhin dang bdag las byung ba'o //
analyzed: de bzhin du 'jig rten gyi lta ba thams cad bdag gi rang bzhin dang bdag las byung ba'o //
translated: In the same way, all worldly views are of the nature of the self and arise from the self.

original: 'di bcom ldan 'das kyis kye'i rdo rjer gsungs pa /
analyzed: 'di bcom ldan 'das kyis kye'i rdo rjer gsungs pa /
translated: The Lord has said this in the Hevajra Tantra:

original: nga las 'gro ba thams cad byung //
analyzed: nga las 'gro ba thams cad byung //
translated: All beings have come from me.

original: nga las sa gsum po byung ngo //
analyzed: nga las sa gsum po byung ngo //
translated: The three worlds have come from me.

original: 'di thams cad ni nga yis khyab //
analyzed: 'di thams cad ni nga yis khyab //
translated: All this is pervaded by me.

original: nga las 'gro ba gzhan ma mthong //üîΩzhes so // de nyid gsal bar mdzad pa gsungs pa /
analyzed: nga las 'gro ba gzhan ma mthong // zhes so // de nyid gsal bar mdzad pa gsungs pa /
translated: Do not see any other being than me.

original: de'i phyir zhes bya ba la sogs pa ste /
analyzed: de'i phyir zhes bya ba la sogs pa ste /
translated: In order to clarify that, he says, ‚ÄúTherefore, etc.‚Äù

original: mthong ba ye shes che zhes bya ba ni 'di yin te /
analyzed: mthong ba ye shes che zhes bya ba ni 'di yin te /
translated: ‚ÄúThe great wisdom of seeing‚Äù is as follows.

original: 'dir ye shes sngon du gsungs pa'i mtshan ma bcu bzhi po rnams ye shes dang mngon par 'brel bar bya ste de mthong ba'o //üîΩthabs @19a * //
analyzed: 'dir ye shes sngon du gsungs pa'i mtshan ma bcu bzhi po rnams ye shes dang mngon par 'brel bar bya ste de mthong ba'o // thabs @19a * //
translated: Here, the fourteen signs that were mentioned previously as the signs of pristine consciousness are connected with pristine consciousness and are seen.

original: chen ni skye bo thams cad sim par byed pa nyid kyi bde ba 'bab pa'i ye shes te /
analyzed: chen ni skye bo thams cad sim par byed pa nyid kyi bde ba 'bab pa'i ye shes te /
translated: The great method is the pristine consciousness of the descent of bliss, which satisfies all beings.

original: de'i phyir mthong zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: de'i phyir mthong zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: Therefore, the meaning of ‚Äúseeing‚Äù is as follows.

original: de'i phyir de bzhin du yongs su za zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni dbang po rnams kyi zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: de'i phyir de bzhin du yongs su za zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni dbang po rnams kyi zhes bya ba'o //
translated: Therefore, ‚Äúeating‚Äù and so on are the same way.

original: 'dir dbang po re re la lnga lnga'i rang bzhin du 'gyur te /
analyzed: 'dir dbang po re re la lnga lnga'i rang bzhin du 'gyur te /
translated: Here, each sense organ has the nature of five.

original: 'di lta ste /üîΩsha'i spyan dang / lha'i spyan dang / ye shes kyi spyan dang / shes rab kyi spyan dang / sangs rgyas kyi spyan no //
analyzed: 'di lta ste / sha'i spyan dang / lha'i spyan dang / ye shes kyi spyan dang / shes rab kyi spyan dang / sangs rgyas kyi spyan no //
translated: They are as follows:üîΩthe flesh eye, the divine eye, the pristine consciousness eye, the wisdom eye, and the buddha eye.

original: de bzhin du sha'i snyan dang / lha'i snyan dang / ye shes kyi snyan dang / shes rab kyi snyan dang / sangs rgyas kyi snyan no //
analyzed: de bzhin du sha'i snyan dang / lha'i snyan dang / ye shes kyi snyan dang / shes rab kyi snyan dang / sangs rgyas kyi snyan no //
translated: Similarly, the flesh ear, the divine ear, the pristine consciousness ear, the wisdom ear, and the buddha ear.

original: de bzhin du sha'i shangs la sogs pa dang / sha'i ljags la sogs pa dang / de bzhin du sha'i reg pa dang / sha'i yid do //
analyzed: de bzhin du sha'i shangs la sogs pa dang / sha'i ljags la sogs pa dang / de bzhin du sha'i reg pa dang / sha'i yid do //
translated: Likewise, the flesh nose, etc., the flesh tongue, etc., and likewise the flesh touch, and the flesh mind.

original: lnga lnga rim pa bzhin du go bar bya'o //
analyzed: lnga lnga rim pa bzhin du go bar bya'o //
translated: The five sets of five should be understood in order.

original: dbang po de rnams kyi ye shes chen po yongs su za ba ni thams cad las brgal ba'i mtshan nyid do //
analyzed: dbang po de rnams kyi ye shes chen po yongs su za ba ni thams cad las brgal ba'i mtshan nyid do //
translated: The great wisdom that devours those faculties has the characteristic of transcending everything.

original: brjod du med pa mi rtog pa /
analyzed: brjod du med pa mi rtog pa /
translated: It is inexpressible, non-conceptual,

original: dbang po med pa /
analyzed: dbang po med pa /
translated: without faculties,

original: spyod yul ma yin pa /
analyzed: spyod yul ma yin pa /
translated: not an object,

original: rang bzhin med pa /
analyzed: rang bzhin med pa /
translated: without intrinsic nature,

original: 'dus ma byas pa /
analyzed: 'dus ma byas pa /
translated: unconditioned,

original: gzugs med pa /
analyzed: gzugs med pa /
translated: formless,

original: go skabs med pa /
analyzed: go skabs med pa /
translated: without opportunity,

original: bde ba med pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa rnam pa sna tshogs pa'i ming rnams kyis kyang ye shes chen po yongs su za ba'o //
analyzed: bde ba med pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa rnam pa sna tshogs pa'i ming rnams kyis kyang ye shes chen po yongs su za ba'o //
translated: and without happiness. It is also called the great wisdom that devours by various names such as these.

original: 'dir des nga zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: 'dir des nga zhes bya ba ni /
translated: Here, that I means

original: bdag de'i bye brag gang la de'i gang gis ming sngon du song ba grub po zhes bya bar dgongs so //
analyzed: bdag de'i bye brag gang la de'i gang gis ming sngon du song ba grub po zhes bya bar dgongs so //
translated: the particular self, and the one who has gone before its name is established. This is the intention.

original: de'i tshe zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni gcig tu na bdag gi ming sngon du song bar ma zad de /
analyzed: de'i tshe zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni gcig tu na bdag gi ming sngon du song bar ma zad de /
translated: In one sense, not only did I have a name in the past,

original: thog ma med pa'i dus can gyi sangs rgyas thams cad de'i rang bzhin no //
analyzed: thog ma med pa'i dus can gyi sangs rgyas thams cad de'i rang bzhin no //
translated: but all the Buddhas of the past had that nature.

original: de'i tshe de rnams kyis kyang ting nge 'dzin tsam du ste /
analyzed: de'i tshe de rnams kyis kyang ting nge 'dzin tsam du ste /
translated: At that time, they also had only concentration.

original: ting nge 'dzin zhes bya ba ni yang dag par rtogs pa'i phyir bde bar rig pa'o //
analyzed: ting nge 'dzin zhes bya ba ni yang dag par rtogs pa'i phyir bde bar rig pa'o //
translated: Concentration is known as bliss because of correct realization.

original: ji ltar thog ma'i ting nge 'dzin de'i smon lam tsam du las dang po pa nyid la sangs rgyas rnams kyis gsungs pa de'i phyir /
analyzed: ji ltar thog ma'i ting nge 'dzin de'i smon lam tsam du las dang po pa nyid la sangs rgyas rnams kyis gsungs pa de'i phyir /
translated: Just as that initial concentration was spoken of by the Buddhas as mere aspiration for the beginner,

original: nges par gzung ba'i ye shes kyi ting nge 'dzin skyes mchog de rnams kyis 'jig rten rnams la rab tu bstan to //
analyzed: nges par gzung ba'i ye shes kyi ting nge 'dzin skyes mchog de rnams kyis 'jig rten rnams la rab tu bstan to //
translated: therefore, those supreme ones who have generated the concentration of ascertaining gnosis have fully revealed it to the worlds.

original: lha dang mi la sogs pa de rnams kyis mi thub pa'i sbyor bas thub pa'o //
analyzed: lha dang mi la sogs pa de rnams kyis mi thub pa'i sbyor bas thub pa'o //
translated: By the application of the unconquerable, they are conquerors of gods, humans, and so forth.

original: de rnams su yang dag pa'i snang ba rtogs pa las rang rang gi ye shes rnams kyis skyes mchog ste /
analyzed: de rnams su yang dag pa'i snang ba rtogs pa las rang rang gi ye shes rnams kyis skyes mchog ste /
translated: In those, the supreme beings, i.e., the yogins and yoginis, are born from the realization of the perfect appearances, i.e., from their own wisdoms.

original: lung gi don nam 'jig rten dang 'jig rten las 'das pa'i snyan dngags la mkhas pa de'i ngang tshul nyid kyis thub pa skyes @19b mchog go //
analyzed: lung gi don nam 'jig rten dang 'jig rten las 'das pa'i snyan dngags la mkhas pa de'i ngang tshul nyid kyis thub pa skyes @19b mchog go //
translated: The meaning of the passage is that the Sage, the supreme being, is of the nature of skill in the scriptures and in the mundane and supramundane poetics.

original: de yang mnyam rtogs zhes bya ba la sogs pa ste /
analyzed: de yang mnyam rtogs zhes bya ba la sogs pa ste /
translated: Moreover, it is said that ‚Äúhe realizes the equality, etc.‚Äù

original: mnyam pa ni thams cad du rnal 'byor dang rnal 'byor ma rnams kyi ye shes so //
analyzed: mnyam pa ni thams cad du rnal 'byor dang rnal 'byor ma rnams kyi ye shes so //
translated: Equality is the wisdom of all the yogins and yoginis.

original: de lhag par rtogs pa ste rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas rnams kyi lha'i dbang po gang gis zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: de lhag par rtogs pa ste rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas rnams kyi lha'i dbang po gang gis zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: He realizes that, i.e., the perfect buddhas, by the power of which, i.e., the power of the wisdom of the yogins and yoginis, the supreme beings, i.e., the buddhas, are born.

original: byas zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni /
analyzed: byas zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni /
translated: It is said that ‚Äúhe creates, etc.‚Äù

original: mkha' 'gro mchog rnams kyi zhes bya ba ste /
analyzed: mkha' 'gro mchog rnams kyi zhes bya ba ste /
translated: The supreme dakinis are the yoginis.

original: du ma'i sprul pa'i sku can rnams kyis yang dag pa'i ting nge 'dzin byas shing rdzogs par byas pa dang de'i rang bzhin du son pas yongs su mya ngan las 'das pa'o //
analyzed: du ma'i sprul pa'i sku can rnams kyis yang dag pa'i ting nge 'dzin byas shing rdzogs par byas pa dang de'i rang bzhin du son pas yongs su mya ngan las 'das pa'o //
translated: The many Emanation Bodies, having practiced and completed the right samadhi, and having attained that nature, are totally emancipated.

original: mchog ni 'jig rten gyi khams du mar nye bar bzhud pa'o //
analyzed: mchog ni 'jig rten gyi khams du mar nye bar bzhud pa'o //
translated: The supreme is the one who goes to many world systems.

original: des mya ngan las 'das pa'i ye shes mkha' 'gro mchog mang rnams kyis zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: des mya ngan las 'das pa'i ye shes mkha' 'gro mchog mang rnams kyis zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: The meaning of the verse is that the many dakinis of the knowledge of emancipation are supreme.

original: mkha' 'gro ni sprul pas nam mkha' la 'gro ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: mkha' 'gro ni sprul pas nam mkha' la 'gro ba'i phyir ro //
translated: Dakini means one who goes through the sky by emanation.

original: d'a n'a d'a shtsa'i khams 'don pa las de rnams kyis nam mkha' la 'gro ba zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: d'a n'a d'a shtsa'i khams 'don pa las de rnams kyis nam mkha' la 'gro ba zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: The reading of the D√¢na D√¢sa school is that they go through the sky.

original: aa ga aa ga ni gya gyur 'gro ba la'o //
analyzed: aa ga aa ga ni gya gyur 'gro ba la'o //
translated: Aga aga is used for going in a crooked way.

original: shin tu mchog tu phra ba rnams la khyab par bya ba dang khyab par byed pa nyid kyis rdzogs par byed pa zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: shin tu mchog tu phra ba rnams la khyab par bya ba dang khyab par byed pa nyid kyis rdzogs par byed pa zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: The meaning of the verse is that they are completed by the pervasion of the very supreme and subtle.

original: mchog mang gis zhes bya ba ni gzung ba dang 'dzin pa'i rnam pa bral ba dang / rang gi mtshan nyid sgyu ma'i rnam pa rnams kyis te /
analyzed: mchog mang gis zhes bya ba ni gzung ba dang 'dzin pa'i rnam pa bral ba dang / rang gi mtshan nyid sgyu ma'i rnam pa rnams kyis te /
translated: By many is meant by the aspects of the apprehended and apprehender being absent, and by the aspects of the magical illusion of intrinsic identity.

original: des ting nge 'dzin 'di dang rgyud kyang shes rab gtso bo nyid kyi phyir ting nge 'dzin dang rgyud kyi rnam par gzhag pa sna tshogs rnams dang le'u rnams kyi gzhung de dang des na sna tshogs pa nyid kyis so //
analyzed: des ting nge 'dzin 'di dang rgyud kyang shes rab gtso bo nyid kyi phyir ting nge 'dzin dang rgyud kyi rnam par gzhag pa sna tshogs rnams dang le'u rnams kyi gzhung de dang des na sna tshogs pa nyid kyis so //
translated: By that, this meditative concentration and the tantra are known, because of the preeminence of wisdom. By the various means by the various presentations of meditative concentration and tantra, and by the texts of the chapters.

original: ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why?

original: rnal 'byor ma dang dpa' bo rnams gnyis su med pa de las byung ba ste /
analyzed: rnal 'byor ma dang dpa' bo rnams gnyis su med pa de las byung ba ste /
translated: Arisen from the nonduality of the yoginƒ´s and heroes means

original: de rnams kyi sbyor ba las zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: de rnams kyi sbyor ba las zhes bya ba'o //
translated: arisen from their union.

original: dpa' bo dang rnal 'byor ma de rnams kyi gnyis su med pa'i sbyor ba las byung ba'i rdo rje 'chang chen po yang dag pa'i ye shes kyi bdag nyid can no //
analyzed: dpa' bo dang rnal 'byor ma de rnams kyi gnyis su med pa'i sbyor ba las byung ba'i rdo rje 'chang chen po yang dag pa'i ye shes kyi bdag nyid can no //
translated: The Great Vajradhara, whose nature is the authentic intuition, arises from the nondual union of those heroes and yoginƒ´s.

analyzed: dngos po thams cad dang gcig tu gyur pa kun rdzob kyi bden pa'i bdag nyid can gyi ye shes ni bcom ldan 'das kyi gzugs so zhes bya ba'i don to // slar yang gang dag sangs rgyas kyi gzugs nyid kyis sgrol bar gyur pa de rnams kyi phyi rol gyi dbang po'i rkyen gyis gang yang rung ba'i tshe nyan thos kyi theg pa la gnas pa na 'chad ba'i stobs kyis rang gi sems bde ba'i bdag nyid can gyi

original: nyams pa'i rnal 'byor bskyed do //
analyzed: nyams pa'i rnal 'byor bskyed do //
translated: Moreover, those who are liberated by the form of the Buddha, when they are abiding in the ≈örƒÅvaka Vehicle by the power of some external sense-object, generate the yoga of decline, which is of the nature of mental pleasure.

original: de nyid @20a * //
analyzed: de nyid @20a * //
translated: That is stated

analyzed: gsungs pa / nyams zhes bya ba la sogs pa'o //
translated: in ‚Äúdecline‚Äù and so forth.

analyzed: bde ba dang mi bde zhes bya ba ni sngon gyi tshig ste ma'i mngal du gnas pa'i skye bo de bsod nams dang ye shes kyi dbang gis byang chub sems dpar gyur to //

original: byang chub sems dpar gyur par ma zad kyi /

analyzed: yon tan thams cad kyis legs par brgyan pa ste /

analyzed: rdul gyi yon tan ni sangs rgyas dang sems can gnyis mnyam par 'dres pa'o //

original: mun pa'i yon tan ni sems can gyi don gyi phyir mngal la brten pa ste /
analyzed: mun pa'i yon tan ni sems can gyi don gyi phyir mngal la brten pa ste /
translated: The virtue of tamas is the reliance on the womb for the sake of sentient beings.

original: yon tan 'di rnams dang dga' ba la sogs pa rnam pa du ma rnams kyis brgyan pa ste /
analyzed: yon tan 'di rnams dang dga' ba la sogs pa rnam pa du ma rnams kyis brgyan pa ste /
translated: It is well-adorned with these virtues and with many kinds of joy, etc.

original: yon tan thams cad kyis brgyan pa'o //
analyzed: yon tan thams cad kyis brgyan pa'o //
translated: It is well-adorned with all virtues.

original: de ltar bde ba dang yon tan dag las nyams pa ste /
analyzed: de ltar bde ba dang yon tan dag las nyams pa ste /

original: de de bzhin du gsungs pa'o //
analyzed: de de bzhin du gsungs pa'o //

original: mi bde zhes bya bar dgongs so //
analyzed: mi bde zhes bya bar dgongs so //

original: gnyis med ces bya ba ni de ltar byang chub sems dpa' yang dag par skyes nas gnas pa'o //
analyzed: gnyis med ces bya ba ni de ltar byang chub sems dpa' yang dag par skyes nas gnas pa'o //
translated: Non-dual means that the bodhisattva, having been truly born, abides in that way.

original: dngos po thams cad la gnyis su med pa'i ting nge 'dzin la snyoms par zhugs par gyur to //
analyzed: dngos po thams cad la gnyis su med pa'i ting nge 'dzin la snyoms par zhugs par gyur to //
translated: He enters into the meditative concentration of non-duality in all things.

original: de'i tshe bya ba thams cad dang theg pa gsum la sogs pa ston pa de'i rnam pa'i bdag nyid du 'gyur te /
analyzed: de'i tshe bya ba thams cad dang theg pa gsum la sogs pa ston pa de'i rnam pa'i bdag nyid du 'gyur te /
translated: At that time, he becomes the very embodiment of the teaching of all actions and the three vehicles, etc.

original: slar yang 'dir ni 'byung ba'o zhes bya ba'i tshig gis so //
analyzed: slar yang 'dir ni 'byung ba'o zhes bya ba'i tshig gis so //
translated: Again, here, the word arises is used.

original: da ni 'di rnams kyi gsal ba'i sbyor ba'i dbang du mdzad nas gsungs pa /
analyzed: da ni 'di rnams kyi gsal ba'i sbyor ba'i dbang du mdzad nas gsungs pa /

analyzed: sgra las byung zhes bya ba la sogs pa ste /
translated: The arising from sound, etc.

original: sgra ni sgra skad dang thig le'o //
analyzed: sgra ni sgra skad dang thig le'o //

original: de'i gzugs las aa wa dh'u t'i'i nang du son pa'i ye shes la thig le dang n'a da steng dang 'og tu yongs su gnas pa ye shes dang rnam par shes pa r'a hu dang dus me drag po'i bdag nyid do //
analyzed: de'i gzugs las aa wa dh'u t'i'i nang du son pa'i ye shes la thig le dang n'a da steng dang 'og tu yongs su gnas pa ye shes dang rnam par shes pa r'a hu dang dus me drag po'i bdag nyid do //
translated: From its form, the gnosis that enters into the central channel is the bindu and nƒÅda, abiding above and below, the nature of the gnosis and consciousness, RƒÅhu and KƒÅlƒÅgni.

original: de las byung ba zhes bya ba ni thams cad kyi lte ba'i steng snying gi 'og tu srog dang thur du sel ba dag 'dus pas gtum mo 'bar bar gnas pa ni /
analyzed: de las byung ba zhes bya ba ni thams cad kyi lte ba'i steng snying gi 'og tu srog dang thur du sel ba dag 'dus pas gtum mo 'bar bar gnas pa ni /
translated: The arising is that, from all of them, above the navel and below the heart, the life-force and downward-clearing [vƒÅyus] gather, and the blazing ca·πá·∏çƒÅlƒ´ abides.

original: thig le ye shes las sgra las 'byung bar 'gyur te /
analyzed: thig le ye shes las sgra las 'byung bar 'gyur te /
translated: The bindu arises from the sound of gnosis.

original: 'di ltar gzhom du med pa las rnam par 'thon pa ste /
analyzed: 'di ltar gzhom du med pa las rnam par 'thon pa ste /

original: le'u bco lnga par bshad pas dpal he ru ka'i 'khor lo bcu gnyis kyi bdag nyid can yang dag pa'i ting nge 'dzin gyi gzugs thabs dang shes @20b rab kyi bdag nyid can 'thon pa ni snod dang sems can gyi bdag nyid kyi 'jig rten gyi bdag nyid
analyzed: le'u bco lnga par bshad pas dpal he ru ka'i 'khor lo bcu gnyis kyi bdag nyid can yang dag pa'i ting nge 'dzin gyi gzugs thabs dang shes @20b rab kyi bdag nyid can 'thon pa ni snod dang sems can gyi bdag nyid kyi 'jig rten gyi bdag nyid
translated: Since it is explained in the fifteenth chapter, the form of the true samƒÅdhi, which is the nature of the twelve cakras of ≈örƒ´ Heruka, arises as the nature of method and wisdom.

original: can khams gsum pa'i dkyil 'khor gyi 'khor lo'i bdag nyid can no //
analyzed: can khams gsum pa'i dkyil 'khor gyi 'khor lo'i bdag nyid can no //
translated: The world, which is the nature of the universe and inhabitants, is the nature of the ma·πá·∏çala-cakra of the three realms.

original: de de bzhin du gsungs pa /
analyzed: de de bzhin du gsungs pa /
translated: Thus, it is said:

original: dam tshig spyod pa'i spyod yul lo //
analyzed: dam tshig spyod pa'i spyod yul lo //

original: zhes pa ste /
analyzed: zhes pa ste /
translated: Thus, it is.

analyzed: dam tshig ni de las byung ba'i sems can rnams te sangs rgyas kyi 'jig rten no //

original: 'dod pa lnga nye bar longs spyod pa la sogs pa'i bya ba'i khyad par ro //
analyzed: 'dod pa lnga nye bar longs spyod pa la sogs pa'i bya ba'i khyad par ro //

original: kun du spyod pa de gang la yod pa de ni dam tshig spyod pa'i spyod yul lo //
analyzed: kun du spyod pa de gang la yod pa de ni dam tshig spyod pa'i spyod yul lo //
translated: The one who has that conduct is the domain of the conduct of the pledge beings.

original: yang na dpal he ru ka la sogs pa dpa' bo dang rnal 'byor ma rnams kyis yang dag pa'i dam tshig gi spyod pa'i mtshan nyid kyi phyir ro //
analyzed: yang na dpal he ru ka la sogs pa dpa' bo dang rnal 'byor ma rnams kyis yang dag pa'i dam tshig gi spyod pa'i mtshan nyid kyi phyir ro //
translated: Alternatively, it is because the glorious Heruka and so forth, the heroes and yoginis, have the nature of the conduct of the true pledge.

original: spyod yul zhes bya ba ni nye bar gnas pa ste /
analyzed: spyod yul zhes bya ba ni nye bar gnas pa ste /

original: rang byin gyis brlabs pa'i bdag nyid can gyi ye shes du ba la sogs pa bcu rnams kyis mtshon pa'o //
analyzed: rang byin gyis brlabs pa'i bdag nyid can gyi ye shes du ba la sogs pa bcu rnams kyis mtshon pa'o //
translated: The ten signs, such as smoke, and so forth, illustrate the wisdom that has the nature of self-consecration.

original: de'i tshe nam mkha'i dbus su gzugs kyi spyod yul te lha'i dbang po'i zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: de'i tshe nam mkha'i dbus su gzugs kyi spyod yul te lha'i dbang po'i zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: At that time, in the middle of the sky, the domain of form, the lord of the gods, and so forth, has the meaning of the lord of the gods.

original: 'dir gal te de srid du lha'i dbang po rnams la ye shes mtshon par bya'o //
analyzed: 'dir gal te de srid du lha'i dbang po rnams la ye shes mtshon par bya'o //
translated: Here, if it is possible, the signs of wisdom should be illustrated to the lords of the gods.

original: sangs rgyas kyi sku'i ngo bo yang ngo //
analyzed: sangs rgyas kyi sku'i ngo bo yang ngo //
translated: The essence of the Buddha‚Äôs body is also so.

original: de'i tshe ye shes bcos mar mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de'i tshe ye shes bcos mar mi 'gyur ro //
translated: At that time, wisdom does not become fabricated.

original: ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: dbang po'i spyod yul ba nyid kyi phyir ro //
analyzed: dbang po'i spyod yul ba nyid kyi phyir ro //

original: gang gi phyir de kho na nyid kyi cho ga sangs rgyas rnams kyi ye shes zhes bya ba'i dngos po rang gi ngo bo mi rtog par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: gang gi phyir de kho na nyid kyi cho ga sangs rgyas rnams kyi ye shes zhes bya ba'i dngos po rang gi ngo bo mi rtog par 'gyur ro //
translated: Because of that, the ritual of reality is the thing called the wisdom of the buddhas. The essence of its own nature is not conceptual.

original: de rtog pa'i dra ba rnams kyis byang chub ces bya ba 'khor ba la gnas pa por gyur pa'o //
analyzed: de rtog pa'i dra ba rnams kyis byang chub ces bya ba 'khor ba la gnas pa por gyur pa'o //
translated: That is the so-called awakening of those who are caught in the net of concepts.

original: mya ngan las 'das pa'i 'bras bu mngon par 'dod pa po rnams kyi snying rje'i 'bras bu med par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: mya ngan las 'das pa'i 'bras bu mngon par 'dod pa po rnams kyi snying rje'i 'bras bu med par 'gyur ro //

original: de'i phyir la la dag the tshom du 'gyur bas de'i tshe de'i dbang du byas nas bcom ldan 'das kyis tshig gsungs pa /
analyzed: de'i phyir la la dag the tshom du 'gyur bas de'i tshe de'i dbang du byas nas bcom ldan 'das kyis tshig gsungs pa /
translated: Therefore, since some have doubts, at that time, with respect to that, the BhagavƒÅn spoke the following verses:

original: sems gsum rnam shes zhes bya ba la sogs pa ste /
analyzed: sems gsum rnam shes zhes bya ba la sogs pa ste /
translated: The three minds are consciousness, and so on.

original: sems gsum 'di yang rnam pa gnyis te /
analyzed: sems gsum 'di yang rnam pa gnyis te /

original: de yang 'jig rten dang 'jig rten las 'das pa dag go //
analyzed: de yang 'jig rten dang 'jig rten las 'das pa dag go //
translated: Moreover, they are mundane and supramundane.

original: de ji ltar gsum zhe na /
analyzed: de ji ltar gsum zhe na /

original: rnam par shes pa drug rnams kyis mig la sogs pa gcig tu byas nas 'jug pa'i rnam par shes pa dang de sems zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: rnam par shes pa drug rnams kyis mig la sogs pa gcig tu byas nas 'jug pa'i rnam par shes pa dang de sems zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: The six consciousnesses are combined into one, and the consciousness that engages is called mind.

original: gnyis pa nyon mongs pa can gyi yid dang / gsum pa kun gzhir bshad do //
analyzed: gnyis pa nyon mongs pa can gyi yid dang / gsum pa kun gzhir bshad do //
translated: The second is the afflicted mind, and the third is the fundamental consciousness.

original: de'i phyir tha mal ba rnams kyi tha mal pa'i nga rgyal gyi sdug bsngal @21a * //üîΩgyi yid la longs spyod do //
analyzed: de'i phyir tha mal ba rnams kyi tha mal pa'i nga rgyal gyi sdug bsngal @21a * // gyi yid la longs spyod do //
translated: Therefore, ordinary people experience the suffering of ordinary pride.

original: mkhas pa rnams kyis gzung ba dang 'dzin pa'i rnam pa spangs pa'i phyir khyad par 'phags pa'i bag chags kyi nga rgyal gyis sangs rgyas nyid nyams su myong ngo //
analyzed: mkhas pa rnams kyis gzung ba dang 'dzin pa'i rnam pa spangs pa'i phyir khyad par 'phags pa'i bag chags kyi nga rgyal gyis sangs rgyas nyid nyams su myong ngo //
translated: The wise experience buddhahood through the pride of the special habitual tendencies, because they have abandoned the aspects of subject and object.

original: de rnams kyi dbye bas sems gsum po 'di spangs pa mchog tu mya ngan las 'das pa dang yang dag par ldan pas gnyis su med par shes par bya'o //
analyzed: de rnams kyi dbye bas sems gsum po 'di spangs pa mchog tu mya ngan las 'das pa dang yang dag par ldan pas gnyis su med par shes par bya'o //
translated: By the division of those, these three minds should be known as nondual, because they are endowed with the supreme nirvƒÅ·πáa that abandons them.

original: mchog tu zag pa med pa'i rnal 'byor las zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: mchog tu zag pa med pa'i rnal 'byor las zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: The meaning of ‚Äúsupreme‚Äù is that it is uncontaminated.

original: sgrub mo khyod la zhes bya ba ni bcom ldan 'das kyis rdo rje phag mo la bod pa'o //
analyzed: sgrub mo khyod la zhes bya ba ni bcom ldan 'das kyis rdo rje phag mo la bod pa'o //
translated: ‚Äú You, O Siddhi‚Äù is addressed to VajravƒÅrƒÅhƒ´ by the Blessed One.

original: khyod la ming ni nyid kyis so //
analyzed: khyod la ming ni nyid kyis so //
translated: ‚Äú You‚Äù is by nature.

original: thams cad kyi 'jig rten dang 'jig rten las 'das pa dag gi dngos grub rnam par sgrub pa'i phyir sgrub mo'o //
analyzed: thams cad kyi 'jig rten dang 'jig rten las 'das pa dag gi dngos grub rnam par sgrub pa'i phyir sgrub mo'o //
translated: ‚Äú Siddhi‚Äù is because of accomplishing all mundane and supramundane powers.

original: de'i phyir 'di thams cad ni sems de'i phyi dang nang rnams su yang /
analyzed: de'i phyir 'di thams cad ni sems de'i phyi dang nang rnams su yang /
translated: Therefore, all of this is in the outer and inner of that mind.

original: stong nyid snying rje dbyer med pa //
analyzed: stong nyid snying rje dbyer med pa //
translated: Emptiness and compassion are inseparable.

original: byang chub sems zhes bya bar dran //
analyzed: byang chub sems zhes bya bar dran //
translated: It is called ‚Äúawakened mind.‚Äù

original: de nyid sems gsum bdag nyid do //
analyzed: de nyid sems gsum bdag nyid do //
translated: That itself is the nature of the three minds.

original: 'khrul pa ma lus spangs pa'o //
analyzed: 'khrul pa ma lus spangs pa'o //
translated: It is free from all error.

original: yang na re re yi ni sems //
analyzed: yang na re re yi ni sems //
translated: Or, each of them is the mind.

original: sngon po la sogs spangs phyir ro //
analyzed: sngon po la sogs spangs phyir ro //
translated: Because of being free from blue, and so on.

original: de ltar spyan dang ldan pa yis //
analyzed: de ltar spyan dang ldan pa yis //
translated: In that way, one who has eyes

original: las dang po ba'i skyon rnams kyis //
analyzed: las dang po ba'i skyon rnams kyis //
translated: is free from the faults of a beginner.

original: gang zhig byis rnams kyis brtags pa'i //
analyzed: gang zhig byis rnams kyis brtags pa'i //

original: 'dus byas pa rnams de la med //
analyzed: 'dus byas pa rnams de la med //
translated: is not in the conditioned.

original: gang zhig yod pa de ldan no //
analyzed: gang zhig yod pa de ldan no //

original: sangs rgyas rnams kyi dbu ma'i bdag / dbu ma la ni sems med gyur //
analyzed: sangs rgyas rnams kyi dbu ma'i bdag / dbu ma la ni sems med gyur //
translated: is the middle without mind.

original: rnam shes smra ba'i bstan bcos kyi //
analyzed: rnam shes smra ba'i bstan bcos kyi //
translated: In the treatise of the proponents of consciousness,üîΩsome say it is illusory by nature,

analyzed: kha cig sgyu ma'i rang bzhin dang // rmi lam lta bur kha cig gis //

analyzed: sgyu ma'i rang bzhin gang rigs pa //

analyzed: de yis rigs pa 'dir bshad do //

analyzed: gang zhig de srid sgyu bden na //

analyzed: ji ltar rmi lam gyis sun 'byin //

original: gsal bar byed pa yang dag pa //
analyzed: gsal bar byed pa yang dag pa //
translated: The correct illuminationüîΩis like in a dream.

analyzed: ji ltar rmi lam nang du yang // rmi lam mthong ba rgya che ba //
translated: Even in a dream,

original: kun rdzob de bzhin du bstan to //
analyzed: kun rdzob de bzhin du bstan to //
translated: the vast seeing of a dream is taught as the conventional.

original: rnam shes bdag nyid che ba ni //
analyzed: rnam shes bdag nyid che ba ni //

original: skad cig gis ni sun phyung ngo //
analyzed: skad cig gis ni sun phyung ngo //

original: mthong dang ma mthong spyod yul ni //
analyzed: mthong dang ma mthong spyod yul ni //

analyzed: de ni de ru skye ba'i rigs //
translated: are born there.

original: mig la sogs pas 'khrul byas kyang //
analyzed: mig la sogs pas 'khrul byas kyang //

original: rnam shes rang gi mtshan nyid do //
analyzed: rnam shes rang gi mtshan nyid do //

original: rnam shes de ni zhugs pa na //
analyzed: rnam shes de ni zhugs pa na //

analyzed: de phyir gnyis med bden pa ste //

analyzed: mi bden byis pa'i spyod yul lo //

analyzed: de bzhin du gsungs pa /

original: 'byung ba zhes bya ba ni khams lnga rnams te sa la sogs pa de rnams kyi nang du ye shes son pa dang ye shes kyi nang du son pa'i'o //
analyzed: 'byung ba zhes bya ba ni khams lnga rnams te sa la sogs pa de rnams kyi nang du ye shes son pa dang ye shes kyi nang du son pa'i'o //
translated: The arising are the five elements, earth and so forth. Those are the internal entry of gnosis and the internal entry of gnosis.

original: rnal 'byor pa rnams kyi gang gi dus su zhes bya ba ni dus ni dus tshod de /
analyzed: rnal 'byor pa rnams kyi gang gi dus su zhes bya ba ni dus ni dus tshod de /
translated: At what time of the yogis? Time is the occasion.

original: de'i dus su gyur pa ni rnam pa gnyis te /
analyzed: de'i dus su gyur pa ni rnam pa gnyis te /
translated: At that time, there are two types.

original: ci de ni g-yo ba dang mi g-yo ba'o //
analyzed: ci de ni g-yo ba dang mi g-yo ba'o //
translated: What is that? It is moving and unmoving.

original: g-yo ba ni rnal 'byor pa rnams kyi lus la brten pa'i rang gis rig pa'i ye shes so //
analyzed: g-yo ba ni rnal 'byor pa rnams kyi lus la brten pa'i rang gis rig pa'i ye shes so //
translated: Moving is the gnosis of self-awareness based on the body of the yogis.

original: lus kyang 'byung ba lnga'i bdag nyid can no //
analyzed: lus kyang 'byung ba lnga'i bdag nyid can no //
translated: The body also has the nature of the five elements.

original: de'i phyir 'byung ba rnams kyi nyams par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de'i phyir 'byung ba rnams kyi nyams par 'gyur ro //
translated: Therefore, the elements are impaired.

original: gong bu rdul phra ba'i sbyor ba dang lus kyi khams phyin ci log gi sbyor bas nyams pa'o //
analyzed: gong bu rdul phra ba'i sbyor ba dang lus kyi khams phyin ci log gi sbyor bas nyams pa'o //
translated: Impaired by the combination of subtle particles of the aggregate and the combination of the distorted elements of the body.

original: de'i phyir rang gis rig pa'i dus su'o //
analyzed: de'i phyir rang gis rig pa'i dus su'o //
translated: Therefore, at the time of self-awareness.

original: 'byung po zhes bya ba ni dbang po la sogs pa rnams rkyen gyis brten pa'i dus su de yang 'od gsal ba'o //
analyzed: 'byung po zhes bya ba ni dbang po la sogs pa rnams rkyen gyis brten pa'i dus su de yang 'od gsal ba'o //
translated: The so-called bh≈´tas are the elements such as earth, etc.

original: de'i tshe nam mkhar 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de'i tshe nam mkhar 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
translated: At the time of their dependence on conditions, they are also clear light, because at that time they become space.

original: 'byung ba ni sangs rgyas dang byang chub sems dpa' la sogs pa rnams so //
analyzed: 'byung ba ni sangs rgyas dang byang chub sems dpa' la sogs pa rnams so //
translated: The bh≈´tas are the Buddhas, Bodhisattvas, etc.

original: yongs su gsal ba zhes bya ba ni dbang po'i gzhu lta bu shin tu gsal ba'i gzugs rnams mthong bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: yongs su gsal ba zhes bya ba ni dbang po'i gzhu lta bu shin tu gsal ba'i gzugs rnams mthong bar 'gyur ro //
translated: The so-called manifestation is the seeing of very clear forms, like the rainbow of the sense organs.

original: sems can gyi don byas nas rang bzhin gyis 'od gsal ba'i bdag nyid can thabs dang shes rab kyi bdag nyid can rnams kyis gnyis su med pa'i gzugs zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: sems can gyi don byas nas rang bzhin gyis 'od gsal ba'i bdag nyid can thabs dang shes rab kyi bdag nyid can rnams kyis gnyis su med pa'i gzugs zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: Having done the welfare of sentient beings, the ones who have the nature of clear light by nature, who have the nature of method and wisdom, are the ones who have the nondual form. This is the meaning.

original: 'di nyid kyi phyir /
analyzed: 'di nyid kyi phyir /
translated: For this very reason,

original: de'i phyir zhes bya ba ni der gnas nas so //
analyzed: de'i phyir zhes bya ba ni der gnas nas so //
translated: therefore means having remained there.

original: 'khor bar 'gyur zhes bya ba ni yang dag par 'khor ba ste //
analyzed: 'khor bar 'gyur zhes bya ba ni yang dag par 'khor ba ste //
translated: They cycle means they truly cycle.

original: sangs rgyas rnams gyi  sprul pa'i sku nges par 'khor ba'o //
analyzed: sangs rgyas rnams gyi  sprul pa'i sku nges par 'khor ba'o //
translated: The emanation bodies of the Buddhas definitely cycle.

original: 'jig rten zhes bya ba'i snod dang sems can dag gi rnam pas gnas @22b pa'o //
analyzed: 'jig rten zhes bya ba'i snod dang sems can dag gi rnam pas gnas @22b pa'o //
translated: The world is so called because it is the abode of the world of sentient beings and the world of the environment.

original: de'i phyir 'khor ba zhes bya ba ni yang dag par kun du gnas pa'i gzugs nyid kyi phyir ro //
analyzed: de'i phyir 'khor ba zhes bya ba ni yang dag par kun du gnas pa'i gzugs nyid kyi phyir ro //
translated: Therefore, samsara is so called because it is the abode of the form of reality.

original: snying po ni ye shes te de ni 'khor bar brjod pa'o zhes bya ba ni bshad pa'o //
analyzed: snying po ni ye shes te de ni 'khor bar brjod pa'o zhes bya ba ni bshad pa'o //
translated: The essence is wisdom, which is said to be samsara.

original: de yang lus pa med par bskyed par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de yang lus pa med par bskyed par 'gyur ro //
translated: That is also generated without remainder.

original: de la zhes bya ba ni gal te de srid 'jig rten ye shes kyi bdag nyid ma yin na de'i tshe mngon sum gyis ji ltar tha mal pa'i nga rgyal gyis gnas /
analyzed: de la zhes bya ba ni gal te de srid 'jig rten ye shes kyi bdag nyid ma yin na de'i tshe mngon sum gyis ji ltar tha mal pa'i nga rgyal gyis gnas /
translated: If the world were not of the nature of wisdom, then how could it abide with the pride of the ordinary?

original: rang bzhin gyis 'od gsal ba'i bdag nyid can gyi ye shes yod na /
analyzed: rang bzhin gyis 'od gsal ba'i bdag nyid can gyi ye shes yod na /
translated: If there were wisdom, which is by nature luminous clarity,

original: de'i tshe bdag nyid sems can rnams kyi 'gro ba drug tu 'gyur zhe na /
analyzed: de'i tshe bdag nyid sems can rnams kyi 'gro ba drug tu 'gyur zhe na /
translated: then at that time, the nature of sentient beings would be the six destinies.

original: des 'dir sgyu ma lta bu zhes bya ba ni gang tha mal pa la tha mal pa'i 'jig rten rnams kyi mthong ba de mi bden te /
analyzed: des 'dir sgyu ma lta bu zhes bya ba ni gang tha mal pa la tha mal pa'i 'jig rten rnams kyi mthong ba de mi bden te /
translated: Here, the so-called illusion is not true for the ordinary world, which sees the ordinary.

original: ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: dmyal ba la sogs pa dang / 'khor los sgyur ba la sogs pa de'i chos dang / bcom ldan 'das dang thams cad sgyu ma'o //
analyzed: dmyal ba la sogs pa dang / 'khor los sgyur ba la sogs pa de'i chos dang / bcom ldan 'das dang thams cad sgyu ma'o //
translated: Because the hells, etc., the Dharma of the universal monarch, etc., and the Blessed One are all illusions.

original: de'i phyir bskyed par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de'i phyir bskyed par 'gyur ro //
translated: Therefore, they will be generated.

original: 'dir sgyu ma lta bu'i de ji lta bu /
analyzed: 'dir sgyu ma lta bu'i de ji lta bu /
translated: Here, what is that illusion-like?

original: sngon gyi byang chub kyi rtsa bar rab tu bzhugs pa na /
analyzed: sngon gyi byang chub kyi rtsa bar rab tu bzhugs pa na /
translated: Previously, when abiding in the root of enlightenment,

original: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po'i rang gi sems las byung ba'i bdud bye ba phrag sum cu rtsa drug rnams kyis bskor ba de rnams kyis nyon mongs pa'i phyogs zad pa'i rgyu yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub yongs su bsgrubs pa'o //
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po'i rang gi sems las byung ba'i bdud bye ba phrag sum cu rtsa drug rnams kyis bskor ba de rnams kyis nyon mongs pa'i phyogs zad pa'i rgyu yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub yongs su bsgrubs pa'o //
translated: the thirty-six million mƒÅras arisen from the mind of the bodhisattva mahƒÅsattva were surrounded by those who had exhausted the side of afflictions, and they accomplished perfect enlightenment.

original: de'i phyir sgyu ma dag med pa rang gi lus dang ngag dang yid las byung ba'i nyon mongs pa zad pa ni rang bzhin rnams zad pa ste /
analyzed: de'i phyir sgyu ma dag med pa rang gi lus dang ngag dang yid las byung ba'i nyon mongs pa zad pa ni rang bzhin rnams zad pa ste /
translated: Therefore, the exhaustion of afflictions arisen from one's own body, speech, and mind, which are non-existent like illusions, is the exhaustion of intrinsic natures.

original: de'i phyir de la thim pa'i dngos po med pa zhes bya ba'i tshig gis so //
analyzed: de'i phyir de la thim pa'i dngos po med pa zhes bya ba'i tshig gis so //
translated: Therefore, it is said by the phrase the non-existence of things dissolving into that.

original: mya ngan las 'das pa zhes bya ba ni rig pa 'dis sangs rgyas rnams kyi mya ngan las 'das pa la gzhan gyi dngos po yod pa ma yin no //
analyzed: mya ngan las 'das pa zhes bya ba ni rig pa 'dis sangs rgyas rnams kyi mya ngan las 'das pa la gzhan gyi dngos po yod pa ma yin no //
translated: The so-called nirvana is the nirvana of the Buddhas by this knowledge, there is no other entity.

original: sgyu ma grub pa'i mtha' dang bral ba nyid kyi mya ngan las 'das pa zhes bya ba med do //
analyzed: sgyu ma grub pa'i mtha' dang bral ba nyid kyi mya ngan las 'das pa zhes bya ba med do //
translated: The so-called nirvana is free from the philosophy of the magician, it does not exist.

original: de'i phyir sgyu ma lta bur mya ngan las 'das pa 'khor ba'i pha rol tu son pa'o //
analyzed: de'i phyir sgyu ma lta bur mya ngan las 'das pa 'khor ba'i pha rol tu son pa'o //
translated: Therefore, nirvana is like an illusion, it goes to the other side of samsara.

original: sgyu ma 'khor ba'i phyi rol du gyur pa'i dngos po mya ngan las 'das pa ni med do //
analyzed: sgyu ma 'khor ba'i phyi rol du gyur pa'i dngos po mya ngan las 'das pa ni med do //
translated: There is no entity called nirvana which is outside of samsara, the illusion.

original: de ltar yang dag pa'i ting nge 'dzin gyis mtshan nyid ro mnyam pa'i rnam pa'i ye shes chen po mchog gnyis su med pa chos thams cad kyi rtsa bar gyur pa zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: de ltar yang dag pa'i ting nge 'dzin gyis mtshan nyid ro mnyam pa'i rnam pa'i ye shes chen po mchog gnyis su med pa chos thams cad kyi rtsa bar gyur pa zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: Thus, the supreme nondual great knowledge of the aspect of the equal taste of the characteristics by the true samadhi is the root of all dharmas.

original: yang na gang 'dzin pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa ste /
analyzed: yang na gang 'dzin pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa ste /
translated: Or, that which is grasped and so forth.

original: srid pa'i rtse mo zhes bya ba ni rtse mo ni gtso bo'i ye shes te sangs rgyas kyi gzugs kyi rnam par @23a * //
analyzed: srid pa'i rtse mo zhes bya ba ni rtse mo ni gtso bo'i ye shes te sangs rgyas kyi gzugs kyi rnam par @23a * //
translated: The summit of existence is the supreme gnosis, the form of the Buddha.

original: gnas pa srid pa de dang ldan pa ste /
analyzed: gnas pa srid pa de dang ldan pa ste /
translated: It is existence, and it is endowed with that summit.

original: de las srid pa mchog byung zhes bya bar dgongs pa'o //
analyzed: de las srid pa mchog byung zhes bya bar dgongs pa'o //
translated: It is the origin of the highest existence.

original: de'i rtse mor gyur pa yongs su sdud pa'o //
analyzed: de'i rtse mor gyur pa yongs su sdud pa'o //
translated: It is the summit of that, and it is the highest.üîΩThat is nirvana, which is held to be such gnosis.

original: 'di 'dra ba'i ye shes gang 'dzin par gyur pa ste mya ngan las 'das pa de yin no zhes rnam par shes par smra ba rnams kyis zer ro//
analyzed: 'di 'dra ba'i ye shes gang 'dzin par gyur pa ste mya ngan las 'das pa de yin no zhes rnam par shes par smra ba rnams kyis zer ro//
translated: This is what the Vij√±anavadins say.

original: 'dir zhes bya ba ni rgyud 'dir te /
analyzed: 'dir zhes bya ba ni rgyud 'dir te /
translated: Here in this tantra,

original: gang gi phyir sems can rnams kyi rang gi bsam pa nye bar thugs su chud pa nyid kyis bcom ldan 'das kyis chos bzhi rab tu ston to //
analyzed: gang gi phyir sems can rnams kyi rang gi bsam pa nye bar thugs su chud pa nyid kyis bcom ldan 'das kyis chos bzhi rab tu ston to //
translated: because the Lord has understood the thoughts of sentient beings, he teaches the four dharmas.

original: de ci zhe na /
analyzed: de ci zhe na /
translated: What are they?

original: bye brag tu smra ba dang mdo sde'i mtha' ba dang / rnal 'byor spyod pa dang / dbu ma dang / tshad ma'i bstan bcos thams cad kyang de bzhin du gsungs te 'dir rab tu bstan pa'o //
analyzed: bye brag tu smra ba dang mdo sde'i mtha' ba dang / rnal 'byor spyod pa dang / dbu ma dang / tshad ma'i bstan bcos thams cad kyang de bzhin du gsungs te 'dir rab tu bstan pa'o //
translated: The VaibhƒÅ·π£ika, SautrƒÅntika, YogƒÅcƒÅra, Madhyamaka, and all the treatises on logic are also taught in this way, and are revealed here.

original: de'i phyir rnal 'byor spyod pa pa rnams kyis ye shes 'dzin pa'i bdag nyid can ni rigs pa'o zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: de'i phyir rnal 'byor spyod pa pa rnams kyis ye shes 'dzin pa'i bdag nyid can ni rigs pa'o zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: Therefore, the YogƒÅcƒÅras say that the nature of the wisdom-holder is logical.üîΩThe intention of some of them is that the position of the Madhyamaka and YogƒÅcƒÅra is logical.

original: de rnams kyi la la dag gis dgongs pa ni dbu ma dang rnal 'byor spyod pa'i phyogs la brten pa 'di ni rigs par bcom ldan 'das kyis gsungs pa de ci zhes gsungs pa /

original: sku ni sgyu ma lta bu zhes bya ba la sogs pa ste /

analyzed: de'i gnas las zhes bya ba ni nam mkha' dri ma med pa nyi ma gung gi nam mkha' lta bu'i rnam pa'i sems sngon po dang ser bo la sogs pa'i snang ba dang bral ba chos kyi sku'i rang gi mtshan nyid stong pa nyid kyi bdag nyid can
translated: The place of that is the stainless sky, the mind in the aspect of the sky at noon, free from the appearances of blue, yellow, and so forth, the nature of emptiness, the intrinsic identity of the dharmakƒÅya.

original: gyi rang gi ngo bor rtogs pa rab kyi mthar thug pa de'i gnas la ste /
analyzed: gyi rang gi ngo bor rtogs pa rab kyi mthar thug pa de'i gnas la ste /

original: der gnas pa las so //
analyzed: der gnas pa las so //
translated: From abiding there.

original: sku zhes bya ba ni sprul pa'i sku sgyu ma lta bur rnam par 'phro ba zhes bya bar 'brel lo //
analyzed: sku zhes bya ba ni sprul pa'i sku sgyu ma lta bur rnam par 'phro ba zhes bya bar 'brel lo //

original: rig 'gyur zhes bya ba ni gsal bar rtogs par 'gyur ba'o //
analyzed: rig 'gyur zhes bya ba ni gsal bar rtogs par 'gyur ba'o //

original: gang sngon nyams su myong ba'i bde ba chen po'i rnam pa'i ye shes so //
analyzed: gang sngon nyams su myong ba'i bde ba chen po'i rnam pa'i ye shes so //

original: dbang po zhes bya ba ni lha'i dbang po la sogs pa'i rkyen rnams kyis kyang rtogs pa'o //
analyzed: dbang po zhes bya ba ni lha'i dbang po la sogs pa'i rkyen rnams kyis kyang rtogs pa'o //

original: de ci zhe na /
analyzed: de ci zhe na /
translated: What is that?

original: bdag chen po ni ye shes gzugs zhes bya ba ste /
analyzed: bdag chen po ni ye shes gzugs zhes bya ba ste /

original: ye shes kyis bsnyems pa'i nga rgyal gyi bdag nyid can rnal 'byor spyod pa rnams so //
analyzed: ye shes kyis bsnyems pa'i nga rgyal gyi bdag nyid can rnal 'byor spyod pa rnams so //

analyzed: de'i phyir cung zad de rnams kyi ye shes nyon mongs dang bcas pa'o //
translated: Therefore, they are slightly afflicted by gnosis.

analyzed: sbyin byed ni mig la sogs pa'i yul lo //

analyzed: grub ba @23b ni phung po la sogs pa'o //

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na /

original: mi mthong zhes bya ba ste /
analyzed: mi mthong zhes bya ba ste /

original: ji ltar nam mkha' la 'gro ba'i grub pa la sogs pa de bzhin du mig la sogs pa rnams kyis yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub rtogs pa'i bdag nyid can gyi ye shes 'gro ba ni nam mkha' la 'gro ba'i gzugs kyis so //

original: de'i phyir rnal 'byor spyod pa rnams dang mdo sde'i mtha' pa rnams kyis nam mkha'i gzugs ni ye shes so zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: de'i phyir rnal 'byor spyod pa rnams dang mdo sde'i mtha' pa rnams kyis nam mkha'i gzugs ni ye shes so zhes bya ba'i don to //

analyzed: de rnams kyi phyogs gcig pa nyid kyi phyir bskal pa grangs med pa du ma rnams kyis sangs rgyas nyid du rjes su 'gro ba'o //

original: de bye brag smra ba rnams dang mdo sde pa rnams kyis rtag tu ye shes rtag pa stong pa nyid kyi mtshan nyid kyi phyir ro //
analyzed: de bye brag smra ba rnams dang mdo sde pa rnams kyis rtag tu ye shes rtag pa stong pa nyid kyi mtshan nyid kyi phyir ro //
translated: The VaibhƒÅ·π£ikas and SautrƒÅntikas always experience the wisdom of emptiness, because it is characterized by emptiness.

analyzed: dgra bcom pa'i 'bras bu 'dod pa rnams kyis nam mkha' mngon sum du nyams su myong bar byed do //

original: de'i phyir mi mthong bar mi 'gyur te /

analyzed: de ltar mtha' bzhi ba rnams kyi rang bzhin las bcom ldan 'das nang du bzhud pa chos kyi dbyings kyi ngo bo rnam pa thams cad kyi rang bzhin stong pa nyid kyi mtshan nyid dang shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'i bdag nyid can gdul bya'i gzugs
translated: Thus, from the nature of the four extremes, the Blessed One's inner departure, which is the essence of the dharmadhƒÅtu, should be individually understood as having the nature of all aspects, characterized by emptiness, and having the nature of the perfection of wisdom,

original: can nyid kyi phyir so sor shes par bya'o zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: can nyid kyi phyir so sor shes par bya'o zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: because it has the form of those to be guided. This is the meaning.

original: da ni ye shes che zhes bya ba la sogs pa ste /
analyzed: da ni ye shes che zhes bya ba la sogs pa ste /
translated: Now, beginning with great wisdom,

analyzed: rdo rje phag mos gsol pa ste //
translated: VajravƒÅrƒÅhƒ´ asked,

analyzed: dpa' bo rnams kyis rang gi mtshan nyid zhus pa'o //

original: de'i phyir gsungs pa /üîΩye shes chen po zhes bya ba ste /
analyzed: de'i phyir gsungs pa / ye shes chen po zhes bya ba ste /

analyzed: gang sngon du bshad pa'i mtha' bzhi'i nang du gyur pa'i bcom ldan 'das so //
translated: ‚ÄúThe great wisdom‚Äù is the BhagavƒÅn who is within the four extremes that were previously explained.

analyzed: de nyid longs spyod rdzogs pa'i sku dang ye shes chen po ste / ye shes gang gi ro rnams kyis zhes bya ba ste /
translated: That itself is the sa·πÉbhogakƒÅya and the great wisdom.üîΩ‚ÄúThe tastes of that wisdom‚Äù are the experiences of the four extremes.

analyzed: mtha' bzhi'i ro myong ba ste rig pa'o //

original: gang gis ye shes chen po'i ro rnams kyis tshim pa'i rdo rje phag mo skad cig kun du thams cad nas thams cad du snying rje chen po stong pa nyid kyi bdag nyid can gyi shes @24a * //

translated: ‚ÄúThe great wisdom‚Äù is VajravƒÅrƒÅhƒ´, who is satisfied by the tastes of the great wisdom, who is all-pervading in every moment, and who is the emptiness that is the nature of great compassion.

original: rab stong pa lha zhes bya ba ni dpal he ru ka la bod pa'o //
analyzed: rab stong pa lha zhes bya ba ni dpal he ru ka la bod pa'o //
translated: ‚ÄúThe empty goddess‚Äù is addressed to ≈örƒ´ Heruka.

original: bdag tshim zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: bdag tshim zhes bya ba ni /
translated: ‚ÄúI am satisfied‚Äù is

original: gsungs pas zhes bya ba ni rang nyid kyis rtogs pa las gnas skabs thams cad du gzung ba ste /
analyzed: gsungs pas zhes bya ba ni rang nyid kyis rtogs pa las gnas skabs thams cad du gzung ba ste /

original: sems can rnams 'jug pa'i rgyur ro//

analyzed: de'i phyir tshim zhes bya ba ni snying rje chen po gang gis yongs su gang bar gyur to zhes bya ba'o //

analyzed: de rnams ye shes dang shes bya'i rkyen gyis te /

analyzed: deng zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni rtogs par sla'o //

analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis gsungs pa zhes bya ba'i bshad pa /
translated: The explanation of what the BhagavƒÅn said.

analyzed: lan gdab pa'i don du dpa' bo rnams zhes bya ba la sogs pa ste /

analyzed: rang bzhin las bzhengs pas na dpa' bo'o //
translated: Because they arise from the nature, they are heroes.

original: de yang rang bzhin kun zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: de yang rang bzhin kun zhes bya ba la /
translated: Moreover, all natures means

analyzed: rang bzhin zhes bya ba ni 'jig rten las 'das pa'i las kyi rang bzhin rnams las thams cad 'byung ba ste rang bzhin de rnams kyi chos can zhes pa'o //
translated: nature refers to all that arises from the nature of supramundane activity. It is said that they possess the dharmas of those natures.

analyzed: 'dir ni 'jig rten las 'das pa rnams rang bzhin rnams las 'byung ba'o //

original: de'i phyir de rnams zhes bya ba ni dpa' bo rnams kyi rang bzhin gyi ngo bo nyid chos kyi dbyings kyi rang bzhin gyi zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: de'i phyir de rnams zhes bya ba ni dpa' bo rnams kyi rang bzhin gyi ngo bo nyid chos kyi dbyings kyi rang bzhin gyi zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: Therefore, ‚Äúthose‚Äù means the natures of the heroes, the nature of the realm of phenomena.

original: de gang rnams kyis rig pa ni dus so //
analyzed: de gang rnams kyis rig pa ni dus so //

original: de'i phyir dus gnyis bshad de /
analyzed: de'i phyir dus gnyis bshad de /

original: dus kyis zhes bya ba la sogs pa ste /
analyzed: dus kyis zhes bya ba la sogs pa ste /

analyzed: de rnams thim pa dang longs spyod pa la sogs byed pas dus so //

analyzed: de'i phyir sngon du dal gyis dal gyis rang bzhin las langs pa'am 'thon pa'o //

original: de srid dri za'i sems can gyi bdag nyid can no //
analyzed: de srid dri za'i sems can gyi bdag nyid can no //
translated: To that extent, it is the nature of the gandharva sentient being.

original: 'dod pa zhes bya ba ni sngon gyi bag chags rjes su dran pa'o //
analyzed: 'dod pa zhes bya ba ni sngon gyi bag chags rjes su dran pa'o //
translated: ‚ÄúDesire‚Äù is the recollection of previous latent tendencies.

original: de'i phyir de'i dus rnams su ma dang pha kun du sbyor ba mthong nas skye ba blangs par byas te /
analyzed: de'i phyir de'i dus rnams su ma dang pha kun du sbyor ba mthong nas skye ba blangs par byas te /
translated: Therefore, at those times, having seen the union of mother and father, one takes birth.

original: de'i tshe 'dod pa can gyi lus sems kyi skabs phye bas byung ba ste 'dod pa sems las byung zhes bya ba'i tshig gis so //
analyzed: de'i tshe 'dod pa can gyi lus sems kyi skabs phye bas byung ba ste 'dod pa sems las byung zhes bya ba'i tshig gis so //
translated: At that time, desire arises from the separation of body and mind, as stated by the words ‚Äúdesire arises from the mind.‚Äù

original: de ltar 'dod pa sems gnyis dag las ni //
analyzed: de ltar 'dod pa sems gnyis dag las ni //
translated: Thus, from the two, desire and mind,

analyzed: byung ba gzugs ni gtso bo zhes bya ba ste //
translated: form arises, which is called ‚Äúprimary.‚Äù

original: 'di rnams kyis sna tshogs pa'i gzugs su byung ba dang rnal 'byor pa rnams kyis yang ngo //
analyzed: 'di rnams kyis sna tshogs pa'i gzugs su byung ba dang rnal 'byor pa rnams kyis yang ngo //
translated: By these, form arises in various ways, and also for yogis.

original: de rnams kyi skabs phye bas byung ba ste /
analyzed: de rnams kyi skabs phye bas byung ba ste /
translated: It arises from the separation of those two,

original: yang dag pa'i ting nge 'dzin gyis gtso bo bskyed @24b pa'o //
analyzed: yang dag pa'i ting nge 'dzin gyis gtso bo bskyed @24b pa'o //
translated: generated by the primary mind of correct concentration.

original: lhan cig skyes pa'i dga' ba las mchog gi gzugs kyi rang bzhin bcom ldan 'das kyi ye shes kyi rkyen gyi bdag nyid can zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: lhan cig skyes pa'i dga' ba las mchog gi gzugs kyi rang bzhin bcom ldan 'das kyi ye shes kyi rkyen gyi bdag nyid can zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: The meaning is that from the innate joy, the supreme form nature, which is the nature of the condition of the BhagavƒÅn‚Äôs gnosis, arises.

original: de bzhin du rnyed dka' zhes bya ba la sogs pa ste /
analyzed: de bzhin du rnyed dka' zhes bya ba la sogs pa ste /
translated: Similarly, it is said to be ‚Äúdifficult to attain,‚Äù and so on.

original: 'jig rten gsum rnams su zhes bya ba ni 'dod pa dang gzugs dang gzugs med pa'i srid pa rnams su rnyed dka' ba dang rnam par rtogs dka' ba dang / mtshan nyid kyis mi mtshon pa dang / mi gsal ba dang dbang po med pa'i ye shes bcom ldan 'das kyi ye shes gzugs kyi bdag nyid do //
analyzed: 'jig rten gsum rnams su zhes bya ba ni 'dod pa dang gzugs dang gzugs med pa'i srid pa rnams su rnyed dka' ba dang rnam par rtogs dka' ba dang / mtshan nyid kyis mi mtshon pa dang / mi gsal ba dang dbang po med pa'i ye shes bcom ldan 'das kyi ye shes gzugs kyi bdag nyid do //
translated: The three worlds are the worlds of desire, form, and formlessness. The knowledge of the Blessed One is the nature of form, which is difficult to attain, difficult to understand, not indicated by characteristics, unclear, and without sense organs in those worlds.

original: ci yang rnyed sla ba ste rnal 'byor pa rnams kyi bsgom pa gsal bar gyur pa las byung ba'o//
analyzed: ci yang rnyed sla ba ste rnal 'byor pa rnams kyi bsgom pa gsal bar gyur pa las byung ba'o//
translated: It is also easy to attain, arising from the clear realization of meditation for yogins.

original: de nyid dang po'i sangs rgyas mchog tu mi 'gyur ba'i rnam pa tha mal pa rnams kyis mi mthong ba'i gzugs nyid pas lha dang mi la sogs pa rnams kyis rnyed dka' la rnal 'byor pa rnams kyi yang spyod yul ma yin pa brjod du med pa yongs
analyzed: de nyid dang po'i sangs rgyas mchog tu mi 'gyur ba'i rnam pa tha mal pa rnams kyis mi mthong ba'i gzugs nyid pas lha dang mi la sogs pa rnams kyis rnyed dka' la rnal 'byor pa rnams kyi yang spyod yul ma yin pa brjod du med pa yongs
translated: That very [knowledge] is the form that is not seen by ordinary beings, who are the primordial buddhas, the supreme unchanging ones. Therefore, it is difficult to attain for gods, humans, and so forth, and is not the domain of yogins. It is inexpressible,

original: su mi rtogs pa rnyed par dka' ba zhes bya ba ni rnam grangs so //
analyzed: su mi rtogs pa rnyed par dka' ba zhes bya ba ni rnam grangs so //
translated: and is said to be difficult to attain, which is a synonym for non-conceptual.

original: de'i phyir / thog ma dbus mtha' yang dag gnas //
analyzed: de'i phyir / thog ma dbus mtha' yang dag gnas //
translated: Therefore,

original: zhes bya ba ste /
analyzed: zhes bya ba ste /
translated: the beginning, middle, and end are well-established.

original: thog ma ni dga' ba'o //
analyzed: thog ma ni dga' ba'o //
translated: The beginning is joy.

original: dbus ni mchog dga' ba'o //
analyzed: dbus ni mchog dga' ba'o //
translated: The middle is supreme joy.

original: mtha' ni bral ba'i dga' ba'o //
analyzed: mtha' ni bral ba'i dga' ba'o //
translated: The end is the joy of separation.

original: yang na thog ma ni dang po sbyor ba'o //
analyzed: yang na thog ma ni dang po sbyor ba'o //
translated: Or, the beginning is the first union.

original: dbus ni dkyil 'khor rgyal po mchog / ces bya ba'i ting nge 'dzin to //
analyzed: dbus ni dkyil 'khor rgyal po mchog / ces bya ba'i ting nge 'dzin to //
translated: The middle is the samƒÅdhi called the supreme king of ma·πá·∏çalas.

original: mtha' ni las rgyal po mchog go //
analyzed: mtha' ni las rgyal po mchog go //
translated: The end is the supreme king of actions.

original: 'di ltar ting nge 'dzin bzhi rnams la yongs su gnas zhes bya ba ste thig le'i rnal 'byor dang bcas pa'i phra mo'i rnal 'byor ro //
analyzed: 'di ltar ting nge 'dzin bzhi rnams la yongs su gnas zhes bya ba ste thig le'i rnal 'byor dang bcas pa'i phra mo'i rnal 'byor ro //
translated: Thus, one should be well-established in the four samƒÅdhis, which is the subtle yoga together with the bindu yoga.

original: de bzhin du yang thog ma zhes bya ba ni thim pa'o //
analyzed: de bzhin du yang thog ma zhes bya ba ni thim pa'o //
translated: Similarly, the beginning is dissolution.

original: dbus ni longs spyod pa'o //
analyzed: dbus ni longs spyod pa'o //
translated: The middle is enjoyment.

original: mtha' ni dpa' bo thams cad kyi bdag po'o //
analyzed: mtha' ni dpa' bo thams cad kyi bdag po'o //
translated: The end is the lord of all heroes.

original: de yang pullir ma la sogs pa rnams su go bar bya'o //
analyzed: de yang pullir ma la sogs pa rnams su go bar bya'o //
translated: That should be understood in the P≈´r·πáagiri and so forth.

original: de yang dga' ba la sogs pa gsum gyi bar du zhes bya ba la sogs pa ste /
analyzed: de yang dga' ba la sogs pa gsum gyi bar du zhes bya ba la sogs pa ste /
translated: And that is up to the three joys and so forth.

original: sems gang zhes bya ba ni byang chub kyi sa bon 'dzag pa'i lhag ma las te /
analyzed: sems gang zhes bya ba ni byang chub kyi sa bon 'dzag pa'i lhag ma las te /
translated: The mind called the ‚Äúseed of enlightenment‚Äù is the remainder of the emission.

original: sems de zhes bya ba ni dga' ba gsum rnams kyi'o //
analyzed: sems de zhes bya ba ni dga' ba gsum rnams kyi'o //
translated: The mind called ‚Äúthat mind‚Äù is the three joys.

original: ro mnyam son zhes bya ba ni ro mnyam pa myangs pa'o //
analyzed: ro mnyam son zhes bya ba ni ro mnyam pa myangs pa'o //
translated: Having attained the same taste means having experienced the same taste.

original: gang du lhan cig skyes pa'i dga' ba'i bdag nyid du gyur pa ste /
analyzed: gang du lhan cig skyes pa'i dga' ba'i bdag nyid du gyur pa ste /

analyzed: sems gcig pa'i dngos po ni ro mnyam pa zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: The meaning of the same taste is the entity of the single mind.

original: 'o na bcom ldan 'das kyis dga' ba bzhi gsungs pa'i tshig de ji ltar zhe na /
analyzed: 'o na bcom ldan 'das kyis dga' ba bzhi gsungs pa'i tshig de ji ltar zhe na /
translated: Well then, how is it that the BhagavƒÅn spoke of four joys?

original: dga' ba gsum @25a * //
analyzed: dga' ba gsum @25a * //
translated: The three joys

original: ni ; he yi rdo rje las 'don te //
analyzed: ni ; he yi rdo rje las 'don te //
translated: are extracted from the Hevajra Tantra:

original: dga' ba yis ni cung zad bde //
analyzed: dga' ba yis ni cung zad bde //
translated: Joy is slightly blissful,üîΩsupreme joy is likewise superior,

original: mchog tu dga' ba de bzhin lhag / bral ba'i dga' ba chags bral 'gyur //
analyzed: mchog tu dga' ba de bzhin lhag / bral ba'i dga' ba chags bral 'gyur //
translated: joyless joy is free from attachment,

original: lhag ma lhan skyes dga' ba'o //
analyzed: lhag ma lhan skyes dga' ba'o //
translated: the remaining innate joy.

original: zhes bya ba dang / de bzhin du /
analyzed: zhes bya ba dang / de bzhin du /
translated: And likewise:

original: mchog dang bral ba gnyis dbus su //
analyzed: mchog dang bral ba gnyis dbus su //
translated: The supreme and the joyless are in the middle.

original: mtshon zhing lta ba brtan par gyis //üîΩzhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: mtshon zhing lta ba brtan par gyis //üîΩzhes bya ba'o //
translated: Contemplate and view them.

original: 'di lta bu la gal te the tshom du gyur na de'i tshe bdag gis byed pa bshad pa /
analyzed: 'di lta bu la gal te the tshom du gyur na de'i tshe bdag gis byed pa bshad pa /
translated: If there is doubt about this, then the author explains:

original: 'dir rnam pa thams cad du bzhi pa med do //
analyzed: 'dir rnam pa thams cad du bzhi pa med do //
translated: Here there is no fourth at all.

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: de yang zhes bya ba'i tshig gis so //
analyzed: de yang zhes bya ba'i tshig gis so //
translated: The word also indicates that.

original: de ji ltar slob dpon dang gsang ba dang shes rab ye shes ni dga' ba gsum rnams so //
analyzed: de ji ltar slob dpon dang gsang ba dang shes rab ye shes ni dga' ba gsum rnams so //
translated: How is that? The master, the secret, and the wisdom initiation are the three joys.

original: de yang zhes bya ba ni de rnams su gzung bas rang gis rig pa'i bde ba zag pa med pa gnyis pa thams cad rnam par spangs pa'o //
analyzed: de yang zhes bya ba ni de rnams su gzung bas rang gis rig pa'i bde ba zag pa med pa gnyis pa thams cad rnam par spangs pa'o //
translated: And also means that by apprehending those, the bliss of self-awareness is free from all that is defiled, which is the second.

original: ye shes ni shes rab ye shes te dbang po gnyis snyoms par zhugs pa las byung ba'i mtshan nyid ni ma yin no //
analyzed: ye shes ni shes rab ye shes te dbang po gnyis snyoms par zhugs pa las byung ba'i mtshan nyid ni ma yin no //
translated: Wisdom is the wisdom initiation, and it is not characterized by arising from the union of the two organs.

original: de'i phyir yang dag par nyams su myong ba'i mtshan nyid rnam par 'gyur ba med pa rdo rje 'chang gis dbugs dbyung ba'o //
analyzed: de'i phyir yang dag par nyams su myong ba'i mtshan nyid rnam par 'gyur ba med pa rdo rje 'chang gis dbugs dbyung ba'o //
translated: Therefore, it is the vajra holder's consolation, which is characterized by perfect experience and is unchanging.

original: de yang zhes bya ba ni gsum pa'i bye brag khyad par du rtse ba'o //
analyzed: de yang zhes bya ba ni gsum pa'i bye brag khyad par du rtse ba'o //
translated: And also means that the third is the special play.

original: gang gi phyir de bral ba de bzhin du bshad do //
analyzed: gang gi phyir de bral ba de bzhin du bshad do //

original: de'i phyir bzhi pa nyid nye bar dmigs pa med do //
analyzed: de'i phyir bzhi pa nyid nye bar dmigs pa med do //

original: de nyid kyi phyir bcom ldan 'das kyis rdo rje'i tshigs pa bar mdzad nas skal ba dang ldan pa'i skye bo rnams la bstan pa'o //
analyzed: de nyid kyi phyir bcom ldan 'das kyis rdo rje'i tshigs pa bar mdzad nas skal ba dang ldan pa'i skye bo rnams la bstan pa'o //

original: byis pa'i skye bo rnams la gsal ba ma yin no //
analyzed: byis pa'i skye bo rnams la gsal ba ma yin no //

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: dga' ba dang mchog tu dga' ba dang bral ba'i dga' ba dang lhan cig skyes pa'i dga' ba zhes bya ba rnams kyis phyin ci log gis 'don pa'o //
analyzed: dga' ba dang mchog tu dga' ba dang bral ba'i dga' ba dang lhan cig skyes pa'i dga' ba zhes bya ba rnams kyis phyin ci log gis 'don pa'o //
translated: Because of the inversion of the words joy, supreme joy, free from joy, and innate joy.

original: da ni slar yang phyed dang bcas pa'i tshigs su bcad pa bdun rnams kyis mkha' 'gro rnams kyi dgos pa dang byed pa gsungs pa /
analyzed: da ni slar yang phyed dang bcas pa'i tshigs su bcad pa bdun rnams kyis mkha' 'gro rnams kyi dgos pa dang byed pa gsungs pa /
translated: Now, again, with seven and a half verses, it is stated that the purpose and function of the dakinis is

original: rnyed dka' zhes bya ba la sogs pa nas ro mnyam gur zhes bya ba'i bar du nas te sngon du gsungs pa'o //
analyzed: rnyed dka' zhes bya ba la sogs pa nas ro mnyam gur zhes bya ba'i bar du nas te sngon du gsungs pa'o //

original: mkha' 'gro zhes bya ba ni gang gi tshe nyams su myong bar gyur pa thabs kyi bde ba las so //
analyzed: mkha' 'gro zhes bya ba ni gang gi tshe nyams su myong bar gyur pa thabs kyi bde ba las so //

original: de nyid du dpal he ru ka la sogs pa mkha' 'gro nyi shu rtsa lnga 'byung ngo //
analyzed: de nyid du dpal he ru ka la sogs pa mkha' 'gro nyi shu rtsa lnga 'byung ngo //
translated: That is, the glorious Heruka and so on, the twenty-five dakinis.

original: de'i phyir zhes bya ba ni mchog tu zag pa med pa'i sbyor ba goms pa las so //
analyzed: de'i phyir zhes bya ba ni mchog tu zag pa med pa'i sbyor ba goms pa las so //
translated: Therefore, means from the practice of the supreme, uncontaminated union.

original: gang byang chub kyi sems rdo rje'i lam nas steng du son @25b pa dang / dz'a landha ra'i bu gar yang log pa dang / ao dyan gyi bu ga rnams su rab tu gnas pa dang rnal 'byor ma thams cad dang ro mnyam par song ba'o //
analyzed: gang byang chub kyi sems rdo rje'i lam nas steng du son @25b pa dang / dz'a landha ra'i bu gar yang log pa dang / ao dyan gyi bu ga rnams su rab tu gnas pa dang rnal 'byor ma thams cad dang ro mnyam par song ba'o //
translated: That which is the bodhicitta that has gone up the path of the vajra, returned to the aperture of the Brahma in the head, and is well-established in the apertures of O·∏çyana, and so on, has become the same taste as all yoginis.

original: de'i phyir 'byung ba ste nyi shu rtsa lnga zhes bya ba ni nye bar mtshon pa ste 'on kyang nam mkha' yongs su khengs pa'o //
analyzed: de'i phyir 'byung ba ste nyi shu rtsa lnga zhes bya ba ni nye bar mtshon pa ste 'on kyang nam mkha' yongs su khengs pa'o //
translated: Therefore, the twenty-five are the illustration, but they fill the sky.

original: de nyid du mkha' 'gro rgya mtsho'o //
analyzed: de nyid du mkha' 'gro rgya mtsho'o //
translated: That is, the Ocean of Dakas.

original: de'i phyir bde ba'i rang bzhin gyis gzugs dang de'i rnam pa rnams su yongs su gnas pa'o //
analyzed: de'i phyir bde ba'i rang bzhin gyis gzugs dang de'i rnam pa rnams su yongs su gnas pa'o //
translated: Therefore, the form of bliss and its aspects are completely present.

original: 'og dang steng gi rab tu sbyor bas khyab par bya ba dang khyab par byed pas 'dres pa'o //
analyzed: 'og dang steng gi rab tu sbyor bas khyab par bya ba dang khyab par byed pas 'dres pa'o //
