original: de'i phyir rab tu sbyor ba 'dis bzhi pa med do //
analyzed: de'i phyir rab tu sbyor ba 'dis bzhi pa med do //
translated: Therefore, this application is the fourth.

original: de ltar gsum pa nyid kyi rnam grangs zhes bya bar dgongs so //
analyzed: de ltar gsum pa nyid kyi rnam grangs zhes bya bar dgongs so //
translated: Thus, enumeration of the third is intended.

original: dkyil 'khor chen po'i sbyor ba las zhes bya ba ni dkyil 'khor rnam pa gsum ste /
analyzed: dkyil 'khor chen po'i sbyor ba las zhes bya ba ni dkyil 'khor rnam pa gsum ste /
translated: The application of the great ma·πá·∏çala is the three ma·πá·∏çalas.

original: de yang sku'i dkyil 'khor dang / gsang ba'i dkyil 'khor dang / byang chub sems kyi dkyil 'khor ro //
analyzed: de yang sku'i dkyil 'khor dang / gsang ba'i dkyil 'khor dang / byang chub sems kyi dkyil 'khor ro //
translated: Further, there is the ma·πá·∏çala of the body, the ma·πá·∏çala of the secret, and the ma·πá·∏çala of bodhicitta.

original: de yang byang chub sems kyi dkyil 'khor la gnyis te /
analyzed: de yang byang chub sems kyi dkyil 'khor la gnyis te /
translated: Further, the ma·πá·∏çala of bodhicitta is twofold:

original: bde ba dang zhu ba dag go //
analyzed: bde ba dang zhu ba dag go //
translated: bliss and melting.

original: de ltar dkyil 'khor bzhi rnams la re re la gsum gsum du shes par bya'o /
analyzed: de ltar dkyil 'khor bzhi rnams la re re la gsum gsum du shes par bya'o /
translated: Thus, one should understand that each of the four ma·πá·∏çalas has three parts.

original: de yang le'u bco lnga pa rnams su dpal he ru ka'i yang dag pa'i ting nge 'dzin gyi dkyil 'khor du de nyid bshad pa'o zhes bya bar dgongs so //
analyzed: de yang le'u bco lnga pa rnams su dpal he ru ka'i yang dag pa'i ting nge 'dzin gyi dkyil 'khor du de nyid bshad pa'o zhes bya bar dgongs so //
translated: Moreover, in the fifteen chapters, it is the reality of the mandala of the glorious Heruka's perfect samadhi that is explained.

original: tshad rnams kyis go bar bya'o //
analyzed: tshad rnams kyis go bar bya'o //
translated: This is understood by the measurements.

original: de'i phyir sbyor ba las zhes bya ba ni gzhom du med pa brtan par gyur pa gnas pa las dkyil 'khor pa rnam par spro bar bya'o //
analyzed: de'i phyir sbyor ba las zhes bya ba ni gzhom du med pa brtan par gyur pa gnas pa las dkyil 'khor pa rnam par spro bar bya'o //
translated: Therefore, from the yoga means that from the unshakable, firm state, the mandala should be emanated.

original: de nyid kyi phyir /
analyzed: de nyid kyi phyir /
translated: For that very reason,

original: rdo rje mkha' 'gro bdag nyid che //
analyzed: rdo rje mkha' 'gro bdag nyid che //
translated: the great being of the Vajra dakini

original: zhes bya ba ste /
analyzed: zhes bya ba ste /
translated: is the one who accomplishes the three worlds.

original: rdo rje zhes bya ba ni mi phyed pa dang mi chod pa dang mi tshig pa dang mi g-yo ba dang stong pa nyid ni rdo rje'o //
analyzed: rdo rje zhes bya ba ni mi phyed pa dang mi chod pa dang mi tshig pa dang mi g-yo ba dang stong pa nyid ni rdo rje'o //
translated: Vajra means indivisible, uncuttable, unburnable, immovable, and emptiness.

original: de'i phyir bdag nyid che ba ste rdo rje mkha' 'gro sa gsum bsgrub par bya ba zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: de'i phyir bdag nyid che ba ste rdo rje mkha' 'gro sa gsum bsgrub par bya ba zhes bya ba'o //
translated: Therefore, the great being of the Vajra dakini is the one who accomplishes the three worlds.

original: 'dir bshad pa 'dir sngon du 'jig pa dang / 'chags pa dang gnas pa dang stongs pa'i dus dang bzhi srid do //
analyzed: 'dir bshad pa 'dir sngon du 'jig pa dang / 'chags pa dang gnas pa dang stongs pa'i dus dang bzhi srid do //
translated: Here it is explained that in the beginning there are four periods of destruction, formation, abiding, and void.

original: sems can rnams la de bzhin du nang gi bdag nyid kyi rnal 'byor la yang ste /
analyzed: sems can rnams la de bzhin du nang gi bdag nyid kyi rnal 'byor la yang ste /
translated: In the same way, with regard to sentient beings, there is the yoga of the inner self.

original: de ji ltar zhe na /
analyzed: de ji ltar zhe na /
translated: How is that?

original: byang chub kyi sems 'bab pa'i thig le de 'jig pa'i dus so //
analyzed: byang chub kyi sems 'bab pa'i thig le de 'jig pa'i dus so //
translated: The time of the destruction of the drop of the falling bodhicitta.

original: slar yang de'i tshe nang du son pa'i bde ba rnams su stong pa chen po'i ting nge 'dzin ni stongs pa nyid kyi dus so //
analyzed: slar yang de'i tshe nang du son pa'i bde ba rnams su stong pa chen po'i ting nge 'dzin ni stongs pa nyid kyi dus so //
translated: Again, at that time, the samƒÅdhi of the great emptiness of the bliss that has entered inside is the time of emptiness.

original: de bzhin du n'a da las byung ba'i bar ni 'chags pa'i dus so //
analyzed: de bzhin du n'a da las byung ba'i bar ni 'chags pa'i dus so //
translated: In the same way, up to the arising of the nƒÅ·∏çƒ´s is the time of creation.

original: de spro ba dang bsdu ba'i sbyor bas ni gnas pa'i dus @26a * //
analyzed: de spro ba dang bsdu ba'i sbyor bas ni gnas pa'i dus @26a * //
translated: The time of abiding is through the yoga of emanating and gathering.

original: su'o // 'di ltar gang gi phyir 'gyur /
analyzed: su'o // 'di ltar gang gi phyir 'gyur /
translated: In this way, why is that?

original: rdo rje mkha' 'gro bdag nyid che ba'o //
analyzed: rdo rje mkha' 'gro bdag nyid che ba'o //
translated: The great self of the Vajra·∏çƒÅka.

original: ci'i phyir na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir na /
translated: Why is that?

original: mtha' med cing mu med pa'i 'jig rten gyi khams stong gsum gyi stong chen po rnams su de rnams kyi sprul pa'i sku nyid pas sa gsum mo //
analyzed: mtha' med cing mu med pa'i 'jig rten gyi khams stong gsum gyi stong chen po rnams su de rnams kyi sprul pa'i sku nyid pas sa gsum mo //
translated: The three worlds are the three worlds of the trichiliocosm, the world systems without end or middle, because of the nirmƒÅ·πáakƒÅya of those.

original: sku dang gsung dang thugs kyi bdag nyid can sgrub pa gzhan gyi 'jig rten gyi khams su gnas pa na grangs med pa'i sangs rgyas kyi zhing sbrul pas rab tu 'jug par byed do zhes bya bar dgongs so //
analyzed: sku dang gsung dang thugs kyi bdag nyid can sgrub pa gzhan gyi 'jig rten gyi khams su gnas pa na grangs med pa'i sangs rgyas kyi zhing sbrul pas rab tu 'jug par byed do zhes bya bar dgongs so //
translated: The Lord of Body, Speech, and Mind, abiding in other worlds of beings, enters by means of emanations of countless Buddha-fields.

original: gang tshe zhes bya ba la sogs pa ste /
analyzed: gang tshe zhes bya ba la sogs pa ste /
translated: When, etc.

original: skye 'gro'i gtso bo tshangs pa zhes bya ba ni 'dir bcom ldan 'das kyis gsan pa gsungs pa ste /
analyzed: skye 'gro'i gtso bo tshangs pa zhes bya ba ni 'dir bcom ldan 'das kyis gsan pa gsungs pa ste /
translated: The chief of beings, called Brahma, is here said to be the Lord.

original: gang gi tshe 'gro ba rnams thog mar tshangs pas bskyed par 'gyur ba'i dus byung ngo //
analyzed: gang gi tshe 'gro ba rnams thog mar tshangs pas bskyed par 'gyur ba'i dus byung ngo //
translated: When the time came for beings to be generated by Brahma at the beginning,üîΩthen, where, etc.

original: de'i tshe gang du zhes bya ba ni 'jig rten gyi khams skyes pa de'i tshe de'i dus so //
analyzed: de'i tshe gang du zhes bya ba ni 'jig rten gyi khams skyes pa de'i tshe de'i dus so //
translated: means in the world-realm that was generated at that time, at that occasion.üîΩBefore, etc.

original: sngon zhes bya ba ni dang por gtso bo nges par byung ba'o //
analyzed: sngon zhes bya ba ni dang por gtso bo nges par byung ba'o //
translated: means that the primal nature first arose.

original: 'on kyang stong pa nyid kyi ting nge 'dzin la rab tu zhugs pa ste /
analyzed: 'on kyang stong pa nyid kyi ting nge 'dzin la rab tu zhugs pa ste /
translated: However, he entered the concentration on emptiness.

original: gnas 'gyur ji ltar stong pa ru //
analyzed: gnas 'gyur ji ltar stong pa ru //
translated: How did he change his abode to emptiness?

original: zhes bya ba'i tshig gis so //
analyzed: zhes bya ba'i tshig gis so //
translated: This is the meaning of the verse.

original: de'i tshe sangs rgyas rnams don med par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de'i tshe sangs rgyas rnams don med par 'gyur ro //
translated: In that case, the Buddhas would be purposeless.

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: sems can gyi don med pa nyid kyis myur du dmyal ba la sogs pa rnams su 'gro bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: sems can gyi don med pa nyid kyis myur du dmyal ba la sogs pa rnams su 'gro bar 'gyur ro //
translated: Because of the absence of benefit for sentient beings, they would quickly go to the hells and so forth.

original: mgon po sems can 'grol byed pa //
analyzed: mgon po sems can 'grol byed pa //
translated: The Lord is the liberator of sentient beings.

original: zhes bya ba'i tshig gis so //
analyzed: zhes bya ba'i tshig gis so //
translated: This is the meaning of the words.

original: byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyis gcig tu na stong pa nyid 'ba' zhig bsgoms pas grol bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyis gcig tu na stong pa nyid 'ba' zhig bsgoms pas grol bar 'gyur ro //
translated: The Bodhisattvas are liberated by cultivating emptiness alone.

original: phyogs gcig pa rnams kyi don med par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: phyogs gcig pa rnams kyi don med par 'gyur ro //
translated: The benefit of the one-sided is absent.

original: de'i tshe gzhan du zhes bya ba la sogs pa ste //
analyzed: de'i tshe gzhan du zhes bya ba la sogs pa ste //
translated: At that time, the others, etc.

original: 'jig rten gyi khams gzhan du gnas pa'i sangs rgyas thams cad bsdus te byon nas bka' 'gros pa /
analyzed: 'jig rten gyi khams gzhan du gnas pa'i sangs rgyas thams cad bsdus te byon nas bka' 'gros pa /
translated: All the Buddhas dwelling in other world systems gather and come, and they say:

original: gal te de srid ji ltar byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po 'di gcig tu stong pa nyid 'ba' zhig bsgom pa la gnas na /
analyzed: gal te de srid ji ltar byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po 'di gcig tu stong pa nyid 'ba' zhig bsgom pa la gnas na /
translated: If that is so, how is it that this Bodhisattva, the great being, abides in the cultivation of emptiness alone?

original: de ltar bdag nyid kyi don mi nus par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de ltar bdag nyid kyi don mi nus par 'gyur ro //
translated: In that case, he will be unable to accomplish his own aim.

original: de'i tshe khyad par 'phags pa ma yin pa'i thar pa la bzhugs pa'o //

analyzed: mnyam pa med pa'i sems can gyi don rmi lam du yang byed par mi 'gyur ro //

original: de ltar ngan 'gror 'gro bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de ltar ngan 'gror 'gro bar 'gyur ro //

original: de'i phyir yang dag pas bskyod pa ste /
analyzed: de'i phyir yang dag pas bskyod pa ste /

original: yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub chung ngu 'di zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub chung ngu 'di zhes bya ba'o //

original: nyon mongs bya ba la sogs pa ste @26b tshigs su bcad pa 'di zhes bya ba 'di'o //
analyzed: nyon mongs bya ba la sogs pa ste @26b tshigs su bcad pa 'di zhes bya ba 'di'o //

original: gcig tu 'dres par gyur pas 'di rnams kyis bskul pa'o //
analyzed: gcig tu 'dres par gyur pas 'di rnams kyis bskul pa'o //
translated: They are stirred up by these, having become a single, mixed whole.

original: nyon nyon byang chub spros son pa //
analyzed: nyon nyon byang chub spros son pa //
translated: Afflictions, afflictions, enlightenment is attained through elaborations.

original: zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni /

analyzed: gson gson byang chub rnams kyi spros pa'i rang bzhin du gyur pa'o //

original: spros pa zhes bya ba ni mi bden pa'o //
analyzed: spros pa zhes bya ba ni mi bden pa'o //

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na /

analyzed: sems can bsgral ba'i sems med pa //

analyzed: zhes bya ba ste gang gi phyir sems can rnams sgrol ba'i rgyu'i sems med pa'o //

analyzed: de'i phyir byang chub rnams spros par song ba'o //

original: gang gi phyir spros par mi 'gyur zhe na gsungs pa /
analyzed: gang gi phyir spros par mi 'gyur zhe na gsungs pa /

analyzed: sgyu ma'i rang bzhin khyod bzhugs nas // zhes bya ba ste /

analyzed: sgyu ma'i rang bzhin gyis khyod rnams kyis bzhugs par mdzod la /

analyzed: ces bya ba ste /

analyzed: sogs pa'i tshigs rnams su ste /

original: thung ngu zhes bya ba la sogs pa dang 'di nyid du zhes bya ba ni nag po'i tshes gcig la sogs pa ji ltar 'phel bar gyur pa de bzhin du thung du ni dkar po'i mtha' can no //

analyzed: ji snyed stong pa nyid bcu drug shes par bya'o zhes bya bar 'brel lo //

analyzed: de ltar thams cad rtogs sla'o //

analyzed: gang gi spyod yul yin zhe na gsungs pa /

analyzed: bshad du med pa zhes bya ba ni phung po dang khams dang skye mched rnams dang de bzhin du dbang po dang las kyi dbang po'i bya ba rnams so //
translated: The so-called inexpressible is the aggregates, elements, and sense-fields, and likewise the faculties and the activities of the sense-faculties.

original: sum cu rtsa drug thig le zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: sum cu rtsa drug thig le zhes bya ba ni /
translated: The so-called thirty-six bindus is

original: thig le'i rnal 'byor gyis brjod du med pa'i rang gi rig pa'i ye shes kyi rnam pa zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: thig le'i rnal 'byor gyis brjod du med pa'i rang gi rig pa'i ye shes kyi rnam pa zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: the inexpressible intrinsic-awareness gnosis in the form of the bindu yoga.

original: de bzhin du byang chub kyi sems padma'i sna rtser thig le'i nang du son pa'i dkyil 'khor sum cu rtsa bdun gyi bdag nyid can bsgom par bya'o zhes bya ba ste /
analyzed: de bzhin du byang chub kyi sems padma'i sna rtser thig le'i nang du son pa'i dkyil 'khor sum cu rtsa bdun gyi bdag nyid can bsgom par bya'o zhes bya ba ste /
translated: Likewise, one should meditate on the bodhicitta in the tip of the lotus, which is the nature of the thirty-seven ma·πá·∏çalas within the bindu.

original: thig le'i rnal 'byor ro //
analyzed: thig le'i rnal 'byor ro //
translated: This is the bindu yoga.

original: de nyid bshad du med pa mtshan nyid med pa mtshon pa zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: de nyid bshad du med pa mtshan nyid med pa mtshon pa zhes bya ba'o //
translated: That itself is the so-called inexpressible, the characterless, the indicated.

original: phra mo'i rnal 'byor rnal 'byor mo //
analyzed: phra mo'i rnal 'byor rnal 'byor mo //
translated: The subtle yoga is the yoginƒ´.üîΩThis is

original: zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni /
translated: what is said.

original: de la de bzhin du padma'i sna'i rtse mo de nyid du phra mo'i srog rnam par gzung ba las bde ba'i rang bzhin nyid de de ltar rnal 'byor ma'i rgyud sum cu rtsa drug gi nang du gyur pa'i rgyud ni rnal 'byor gyi rgyud do //
analyzed: de la de bzhin du padma'i sna'i rtse mo de nyid du phra mo'i srog rnam par gzung ba las bde ba'i rang bzhin nyid de de ltar rnal 'byor ma'i rgyud sum cu rtsa drug gi nang du gyur pa'i rgyud ni rnal 'byor gyi rgyud do //
translated: In that way, in the very tip of the lotus nose, by apprehending the subtle life-force, the nature of bliss, thus, the yoga tantra is the tantra included in the thirty-six yoginƒ´ tantras.

original: de ltar thabs dang shes rab kyi bdag nyid can thig le'i rnal 'byor dang phra mo'i rnal 'byor dang gnyis ka'i rgyud rnams kyis kyang sprul pa'i sku'o //
analyzed: de ltar thabs dang shes rab kyi bdag nyid can thig le'i rnal 'byor dang phra mo'i rnal 'byor dang gnyis ka'i rgyud rnams kyis kyang sprul pa'i sku'o //
translated: In that way, the bindu yoga and the subtle yoga, which have the nature of method and wisdom, and the tantras of both, are also the nirmƒÅ·πáakƒÅya.

original: de la sprul pa'i sku 'dir ci las 'ongs she na /
analyzed: de la sprul pa'i sku 'dir ci las 'ongs she na /
translated: In that way, from what does this nirmƒÅ·πáakƒÅya come?

original: gsungs pa / dus kyi dbye ba dang zhes bya ba la sogs pa ste /
analyzed: gsungs pa / dus kyi dbye ba dang zhes bya ba la sogs pa ste /
translated: It is said, ‚Äúthe divisions of time,‚Äù and so on.

original: dus rnams kyi dbye bas rab tu phye ba'o //
analyzed: dus rnams kyi dbye bas rab tu phye ba'o //
translated: It is distinguished by the divisions of time.

original: de ci zhe na ;
analyzed: de ci zhe na ;
translated: What is that?

original: zla bas dang zhes bya bas te zla ba bcu gnyis rnams so //
analyzed: zla bas dang zhes bya bas te zla ba bcu gnyis rnams so //
translated: ‚ÄúThe months,‚Äù and so on. The twelve months.

original: de'i 'pho ba rnams nye bar mtshon pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de'i 'pho ba rnams nye bar mtshon pa'i phyir ro //
translated: They are illustrated by their transits.

original: rdzogs ldan dang gsum ldan zhes bya ba ni re re'i 'pho ba rnams kyis dus bzhi rnams kyi nang du gyur pa'o //
analyzed: rdzogs ldan dang gsum ldan zhes bya ba ni re re'i 'pho ba rnams kyis dus bzhi rnams kyi nang du gyur pa'o //
translated: The so-called K·πõtayuga and the three yugas are within the four periods of each revolution.

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: g-yon pa dang g-yas pa'i sna'i bu ga ngag gis dkyil 'khor bcur 'gyur ro //
analyzed: g-yon pa dang g-yas pa'i sna'i bu ga ngag gis dkyil 'khor bcur 'gyur ro //
translated: The right and left nostrils become the ten ma·πá·∏çalas by the breath.

original: dkyil 'khor thams cad kyi 'pho ba rnams kyis brgyad brgyas lhag pa'i stong phrag gcig go //
analyzed: dkyil 'khor thams cad kyi 'pho ba rnams kyis brgyad brgyas lhag pa'i stong phrag gcig go //
translated: The revolutions of all the ma·πá·∏çalas are one thousand and eight hundred.

original: 'jug pa dang gnas pa dang ldang ba'i dbugs rnams su 'gyur ro //
analyzed: 'jug pa dang gnas pa dang ldang ba'i dbugs rnams su 'gyur ro //
translated: They are the breaths of entry, abiding, and exit.

original: de ltar re re'i dkyil 'khor la brgyad cus lhag pa'i brgya phrag gi dbugs rgyu bar 'gyur @31b ro //
analyzed: de ltar re re'i dkyil 'khor la brgyad cus lhag pa'i brgya phrag gi dbugs rgyu bar 'gyur @31b ro //
translated: Thus, in each ma·πá·∏çala, there are one hundred and eighty breaths.

original: de la rdzogs ldan zhes bya ba ni rkang pa bzhi la sogs pa'i las dang dkyil 'khor bzhi'i sbyor bas so //
analyzed: de la rdzogs ldan zhes bya ba ni rkang pa bzhi la sogs pa'i las dang dkyil 'khor bzhi'i sbyor bas so //
translated: Therein, the so-called K·πõtayuga is the union of the four ma·πá·∏çalas, such as the four feet, and so on.

original: de la nam mkha' dang rlung dang me dang chu'i dkyil 'khor rnams g-yon pa'i sna'i bu ga rnams su 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de la nam mkha' dang rlung dang me dang chu'i dkyil 'khor rnams g-yon pa'i sna'i bu ga rnams su 'gyur ro //
translated: Therein, the ma·πá·∏çalas of space, wind, fire, and water are on the left nostril.

original: de bzhin du gsum ldan zhes bya ba ni gsum ldan gyi dus su rkang pa gsum ldan gyi bdag nyid can gyi chos dang rkang pa gcig zad pas dkyil 'khor gsum du 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de bzhin du gsum ldan zhes bya ba ni gsum ldan gyi dus su rkang pa gsum ldan gyi bdag nyid can gyi chos dang rkang pa gcig zad pas dkyil 'khor gsum du 'gyur ro //
translated: Similarly, ‚Äúthree-part‚Äù means that at the time of the three-part eon, the dharma of the three-part nature and the exhaustion of the three parts become the three ma·πá·∏çalas.

original: de yang g-yon par sa'i dkyil 'khor ro //
analyzed: de yang g-yon par sa'i dkyil 'khor ro //
translated: Moreover, the earth ma·πá·∏çala is on the left.

original: de bzhin du g-yas par sa dang chu'o //
analyzed: de bzhin du g-yas par sa dang chu'o //
translated: Similarly, the earth and water are on the right.

original: de ltar gnyis zhes bya ba ni gnyis ldan gyi dus rnams su rkang pa gnyis pa'i bdag nyid can gyi chos dang rkang pa gnyis zad pas dkyil 'khor gnyis su 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de ltar gnyis zhes bya ba ni gnyis ldan gyi dus rnams su rkang pa gnyis pa'i bdag nyid can gyi chos dang rkang pa gnyis zad pas dkyil 'khor gnyis su 'gyur ro //
translated: Thus, ‚Äútwo‚Äù means that at the time of the two-part eon, the dharma of the two-part nature and the exhaustion of the two parts become the two ma·πá·∏çalas.

original: de yang me dang rlung ngo //
analyzed: de yang me dang rlung ngo //
translated: Moreover, they are fire and wind.

original: slar yang rtsod dus 'gyur zhes bya ba ni rtsod pa'i dus su rkang pa gcig pa'i bdag nyid can gyi chos dang rkang pa gsum zad pas dkyil 'khor gcig tu 'gyur ro //
analyzed: slar yang rtsod dus 'gyur zhes bya ba ni rtsod pa'i dus su rkang pa gcig pa'i bdag nyid can gyi chos dang rkang pa gsum zad pas dkyil 'khor gcig tu 'gyur ro //
translated: Again, ‚Äúthe time of strife‚Äù means that at the time of the strife eon, the dharma of the one-part nature and the exhaustion of the three parts become the one ma·πá·∏çala.

original: de'i phyir rdzogs ldan la nyi shus lhag pa'i dbugs bdun brgyar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de'i phyir rdzogs ldan la nyi shus lhag pa'i dbugs bdun brgyar 'gyur ro //
translated: Therefore, the perfect eon is seven hundred and twenty breaths.

original: gsum ldan la bzhi bcus lhag pa'i lnga brgya'o //
analyzed: gsum ldan la bzhi bcus lhag pa'i lnga brgya'o //
translated: In the third, it is five hundred years plus forty.

original: gnyis ldan la drug cus lhag pa'i sum brgya'o //
analyzed: gnyis ldan la drug cus lhag pa'i sum brgya'o //
translated: In the second, it is three hundred years plus sixty.

original: rtsod dus kyi sngon du bshad do //
analyzed: rtsod dus kyi sngon du bshad do //
translated: This is explained before the age of dispute.

original: de ltar 'pho ba bcu gnyis rnams kyis rdzogs ldan gyi dus rnams su stong phrag brgyad dang brgya phrag drug la bzhi bcus lhag pa'o//
analyzed: de ltar 'pho ba bcu gnyis rnams kyis rdzogs ldan gyi dus rnams su stong phrag brgyad dang brgya phrag drug la bzhi bcus lhag pa'o//
translated: Thus, in the ages of completeness, the twelve transits are eight thousand and six hundred plus forty.

original: de bzhin du gsum ldan la stong phrag drug dang brgya phrag bzhi la brgyad cus lhag pa'o //
analyzed: de bzhin du gsum ldan la stong phrag drug dang brgya phrag bzhi la brgyad cus lhag pa'o //
translated: In the same way, in the age of three-fourths, it is six thousand and four hundred plus eighty.

original: gnyis ldan rnams su stong phrag bzhi dang brgya phrag gsum la nyi shus lhag pa'o //
analyzed: gnyis ldan rnams su stong phrag bzhi dang brgya phrag gsum la nyi shus lhag pa'o //
translated: In the ages of two-fourths, it is four thousand and three hundred plus twenty.

original: de bzhin du rtsod pa'i dus rnams su stong phrag gnyis dang brgya phrag gcig la drug cus lhag pa'o //
analyzed: de bzhin du rtsod pa'i dus rnams su stong phrag gnyis dang brgya phrag gcig la drug cus lhag pa'o //
translated: In the same way, in the ages of dispute, it is two thousand and one hundred plus sixty.

original: de ltar dus bzhi rnams kyi zhag gcig gi tshad do //
analyzed: de ltar dus bzhi rnams kyi zhag gcig gi tshad do //
translated: This is the measure of one day in the four ages.

original: de bzhin du byang du bgrod pa dang lhor bgrod pa dag gis lo gcig gi rlung gi tshad ni 'bum phrag bdun cu rtsa bdun dang stong phrag bdun cu rtsa drug go //
analyzed: de bzhin du byang du bgrod pa dang lhor bgrod pa dag gis lo gcig gi rlung gi tshad ni 'bum phrag bdun cu rtsa bdun dang stong phrag bdun cu rtsa drug go //
translated: Similarly, the measure of the wind in one year for those moving north and south is 7,760,000.

original: de rnams kyi yang dkyil 'khor rnams kyi cha'i dbye ba bshad par bya ste /
analyzed: de rnams kyi yang dkyil 'khor rnams kyi cha'i dbye ba bshad par bya ste /
translated: Now the division of the parts of the ma·πá·∏çala of those will be explained.

original: de la dkyil 'khor so so'i cha ni 'bum phrag bdun dang khri phrag bdun dang stong phrag bdun la brgya phrag dug gis lhag pa'o //
analyzed: de la dkyil 'khor so so'i cha ni 'bum phrag bdun dang khri phrag bdun dang stong phrag bdun la brgya phrag dug gis lhag pa'o //
translated: The parts of each ma·πá·∏çala are 70,000, 7,000, and 700, with an excess of 800.

original: de ltar bzhi 'gyur ni rdzogs ldan gyi dus su ste 'bum phrag sum cu rtsa gcig dang khri phrag gcig la bzhi brgyas lhag pa'o //
analyzed: de ltar bzhi 'gyur ni rdzogs ldan gyi dus su ste 'bum phrag sum cu rtsa gcig dang khri phrag gcig la bzhi brgyas lhag pa'o //
translated: In the age of completeness, that is quadrupled: 310,000, with an excess of 480.

original: gsum ldan rnams su 'bum phrag nyi shu rtsa gsum dang khri @32a * //
analyzed: gsum ldan rnams su 'bum phrag nyi shu rtsa gsum dang khri @32a * //
translated: In the age of three-fourths, it is 233,000,üîΩwith an excess of 800.

original: phrag gsum dang stong phrag gnyis la brgyad brgyas lhag pa'o //
analyzed: phrag gsum dang stong phrag gnyis la brgyad brgyas lhag pa'o //
translated: In the age of two-fourths, it is 116,000,üîΩwith an excess of 400.

original: de bzhin du gnyis ldan du 'bum phrag bco lnga dang khri phrag lnga stong la brgya phrag gnyis kyis lhag pa'o //
analyzed: de bzhin du gnyis ldan du 'bum phrag bco lnga dang khri phrag lnga stong la brgya phrag gnyis kyis lhag pa'o //
translated: In the same way, in the case of those who live two thousand years, the diameter of the circle is one hundred and fifty thousand yojanas.

original: rtsod dus sngon du bshad do //
analyzed: rtsod dus sngon du bshad do //
translated: The length of life in the period of dispute has been explained above.üîΩThus, the diameter of each circle of those who live one hundred years is

original: de ltar tshe lo brgya pa rnams kyi dkyil 'khor re re'i gang tshad bshad pa /
analyzed: de ltar tshe lo brgya pa rnams kyi dkyil 'khor re re'i gang tshad bshad pa /
translated: one hundred yojanas.

original: de brgya 'gyur du 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de brgya 'gyur du 'gyur ro //
translated: This is multiplied by one hundred,

original: de yang bye ba bdun dang 'bum phrag bdun cu rtsa bdun la khri phrag drug gis lhag pa'o //
analyzed: de yang bye ba bdun dang 'bum phrag bdun cu rtsa bdun la khri phrag drug gis lhag pa'o //
translated: that is, by seven million seven hundred thousand, plus sixty thousand.

original: de ltar byas pas bzhi 'gyur du 'gyur te /
analyzed: de ltar byas pas bzhi 'gyur du 'gyur te /
translated: This is multiplied by four,

original: bye ba phrag sum cu rtsa gcig dang 'bum phrag bcu la khri phrag bzhis lhag pa'o //
analyzed: bye ba phrag sum cu rtsa gcig dang 'bum phrag bcu la khri phrag bzhis lhag pa'o //
translated: that is, by one hundred thirty-five million, plus forty thousand.

original: de bzhin du gsum ldan la bye ba nyi shu rtsa gsum dang 'bum phrag sum cu rtsa gnyis dang khri tsho brgyad do //
analyzed: de bzhin du gsum ldan la bye ba nyi shu rtsa gsum dang 'bum phrag sum cu rtsa gnyis dang khri tsho brgyad do //
translated: In the same way, in the case of those who live three thousand years, the diameter of the circle is twenty-three million, thirty-two hundred thousand, and eight thousand yojanas.

original: de ltar gnyis ldan la bye ba phrag bco lnga dang 'bum phrag lnga bcu rtsa lnga dang khri tsho gnyis so //
analyzed: de ltar gnyis ldan la bye ba phrag bco lnga dang 'bum phrag lnga bcu rtsa lnga dang khri tsho gnyis so //
translated: In the case of those who live two thousand years, the diameter of the circle is fifteen million, fifty-two hundred thousand, and two thousand yojanas.

original: rtsod dus sngon du bshad do //
analyzed: rtsod dus sngon du bshad do //
translated: The age of discord was explained earlier.

original: de ltar chung ngu dang 'bring po dang chen po'i dbye bas dus rnams kyi tshad do //
analyzed: de ltar chung ngu dang 'bring po dang chen po'i dbye bas dus rnams kyi tshad do //
translated: Thus, the measure of the ages is by the divisions of the lesser, middling, and greater.

original: de yang 'chad par 'gyur ba rnams su dus dang lug la sogs pa'i zla ba rnams mkha' 'gro ma la sogs pa'i le'u rnams su rgya che bar bshad par bya'o //
analyzed: de yang 'chad par 'gyur ba rnams su dus dang lug la sogs pa'i zla ba rnams mkha' 'gro ma la sogs pa'i le'u rnams su rgya che bar bshad par bya'o //
translated: And that will be explained in the chapters of the dakinis, etc., in the extensive explanation of the months of Aries, etc.

original: dus kyi dbye ba rab tu phye ba gang gis de bzhin gshegs pa rnams kyi sprul pa'i sku rnams kyis sems can gyi don mnyam pa med par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: dus kyi dbye ba rab tu phye ba gang gis de bzhin gshegs pa rnams kyi sprul pa'i sku rnams kyis sems can gyi don mnyam pa med par 'gyur ro //
translated: By the division of the ages, the emanation bodies of the Tathagatas become unequaled in the benefit of sentient beings.

original: rdo rje'i zhal bzhi zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: rdo rje'i zhal bzhi zhes bya ba ni /
translated: The four vajra faces

original: rdo rje'i ni rdo rje 'chang gi ste dpal he ru ka'i bdag nyid du skyes pa'i dus bzhi'i dbye ba'i ngo bos dang zhal bzhi dga' ba bzhi ste de brgyad gnyis zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: rdo rje'i ni rdo rje 'chang gi ste dpal he ru ka'i bdag nyid du skyes pa'i dus bzhi'i dbye ba'i ngo bos dang zhal bzhi dga' ba bzhi ste de brgyad gnyis zhes bya ba'o //
translated: are the four faces of Vajradhara, the nature of the glorious Heruka, born of the nature of the division of the four times. The four faces are the four joys, and those are the eight pairs.

original: dus re re la dga' ba bzhir 'gyur te //
analyzed: dus re re la dga' ba bzhir 'gyur te //
translated: Each of the four times has four joys.

original: chung ngu dang 'bring po dang chen po'i dus dbye bas so //
analyzed: chung ngu dang 'bring po dang chen po'i dus dbye bas so //
translated: The four ages are distinguished by the periods of the small, the medium, and the great.

original: de yang dgod pa dang lta ba dang lag pa gzung ba dang gnyis sprod ni rdzogs ldan du'o //
analyzed: de yang dgod pa dang lta ba dang lag pa gzung ba dang gnyis sprod ni rdzogs ldan du'o //
translated: In the age of completeness, there is the display, the gaze, the holding of hands, and the union.

original: rnam pa sna tshogs ba dang rnam par smin pa dang rnam par nyed pa dang mtshan nyid dang bral ba ni gsum ldan du'o //
analyzed: rnam pa sna tshogs ba dang rnam par smin pa dang rnam par nyed pa dang mtshan nyid dang bral ba ni gsum ldan du'o //
translated: In the age of three quarters, there is the various, the matured, the exhausted, and the free from characteristics.

original: bum pa dang slob dpon dang gsang ba dang shes rab ni gnyis ldan du'o //
analyzed: bum pa dang slob dpon dang gsang ba dang shes rab ni gnyis ldan du'o //
translated: In the age of two quarters, there is the vase, the master, the secret, and the wisdom.

original: sad pa dang rmi lam dang gnyid mthug po log pa dang bzhi pa'i rang bzhin 'di ni rtsod pa'i dus so //
analyzed: sad pa dang rmi lam dang gnyid mthug po log pa dang bzhi pa'i rang bzhin 'di ni rtsod pa'i dus so //
translated: The nature of the four‚Äîthe awakened, the dreaming, the deep sleep, and the fourth‚Äîis the age of strife.

original: de ltar rgyud bzhi dang skad cig bzhi dang dbang bzhi dang / rang bzhin bzhi ste /
analyzed: de ltar rgyud bzhi dang skad cig bzhi dang dbang bzhi dang / rang bzhin bzhi ste /
translated: Thus, there are four tantras, four moments, four initiations, and four natures.

original: rim pa ji lta ba bzhin shes par bya'o //
analyzed: rim pa ji lta ba bzhin shes par bya'o //
translated: They should be understood in order.

original: de ltar rdzogs ldan gyi dus su gcig la gcig bltas pas dga' ba skye ste /
analyzed: de ltar rdzogs ldan gyi dus su gcig la gcig bltas pas dga' ba skye ste /
translated: In the age of completeness, by looking at each other, joy arises.

original: 'di ni lta ba'i rgyud do //
analyzed: 'di ni lta ba'i rgyud do //
translated: This is the tantra of the gaze.

original: @32b bgad pa tsam gyis de ltar mchog dga' skye ste 'di ni dgod pa'i rgyud do //
analyzed: @32b bgad pa tsam gyis de ltar mchog dga' skye ste 'di ni dgod pa'i rgyud do //
translated: Just by laughing, supreme joy arises in this way. This is the laughing tantra.

original: de bzhin du lag pas lag pa la reg pa tsam gyis dga' bral te khyad par can gyi 'dod chags skye ba 'di ni lag sprad kyi rgyud do //
analyzed: de bzhin du lag pas lag pa la reg pa tsam gyis dga' bral te khyad par can gyi 'dod chags skye ba 'di ni lag sprad kyi rgyud do //
translated: Just by touching hand to hand, the joy of separation arises, and special passion arises. This is the hand-clasping tantra.

original: mngon sum du 'khyud pas lhan skyes 'thob pa zhes bya ba ni gnyis 'khyud kyi rgyud do //
analyzed: mngon sum du 'khyud pas lhan skyes 'thob pa zhes bya ba ni gnyis 'khyud kyi rgyud do //
translated: By directly embracing, the innate is attained. This is the embracing tantra.

original: de ltar lhan skyes dang por byas nas rdzogs ldan gyi dus la sogs pa'i sems can rnams kyi sems rang gis bskyed de /
analyzed: de ltar lhan skyes dang por byas nas rdzogs ldan gyi dus la sogs pa'i sems can rnams kyi sems rang gis bskyed de /
translated: Thus, having made the innate the first, the mind of sentient beings in the age of completeness and so on is generated by oneself.

original: chos kyi chos nyid kyis so //
analyzed: chos kyi chos nyid kyis so //
translated: This is the tantra of the innate.

original: de bzhin du gsum ldan gyi dus su sna tshogs pa'i 'khyud pa dang 'o la sogs pas rnam par bkra ba'i dga' ba skye ste 'di ni rnam pa sna tshogs pa'i skad cig ma'o //
analyzed: de bzhin du gsum ldan gyi dus su sna tshogs pa'i 'khyud pa dang 'o la sogs pas rnam par bkra ba'i dga' ba skye ste 'di ni rnam pa sna tshogs pa'i skad cig ma'o //
translated: Similarly, in the age of three-quarters, various joys arise from various embraces, kisses, and so on. This is the moment of variety.

original: rnam par smin pa'i dga' ba yang mchog tu 'gro ba ste /
analyzed: rnam par smin pa'i dga' ba yang mchog tu 'gro ba ste /
translated: The joy of maturation also goes to the supreme.

original: de ltar padmar rdo rje bcug pas mtshan nyid dang bral ba'i skad cig ma'o //
analyzed: de ltar padmar rdo rje bcug pas mtshan nyid dang bral ba'i skad cig ma'o //
translated: Thus, by inserting the vajra into the lotus, there is the moment free from characteristics.

original: shin tu mthun pa dam pas rnam par nyed pa byed de 'di ni bral ba'i dga' ba dang rnam par nyed pa'i skad cig ma'o //
analyzed: shin tu mthun pa dam pas rnam par nyed pa byed de 'di ni bral ba'i dga' ba dang rnam par nyed pa'i skad cig ma'o //
translated: The supreme union causes the melting, which is the moment of the joy of separation and melting.

original: mtshan nyid dang bral ba ste spyod yul ma yin pa nyid kyis dang mtshan nyid dang bral bas /
analyzed: mtshan nyid dang bral ba ste spyod yul ma yin pa nyid kyis dang mtshan nyid dang bral bas /
translated: Free from characteristics, it is not an object of the senses, and free from characteristics,

original: lhan skyes kyi dga' ba skye ste 'di ni mtshan nyid dang bral ba'i skad cig ma'o //
analyzed: lhan skyes kyi dga' ba skye ste 'di ni mtshan nyid dang bral ba'i skad cig ma'o //
translated: the innate joy arises, which is the moment free from characteristics.

original: de bzhin du bum pa rnams kyis bum pa'i dga' ba ste /
analyzed: de bzhin du bum pa rnams kyis bum pa'i dga' ba ste /
translated: In the same way, the joy of the vase arises from the vases.

original: dbang bskur drug skye ba 'di ni bum pa'i dbang ngo //
analyzed: dbang bskur drug skye ba 'di ni bum pa'i dbang ngo //
translated: The arising of the six empowerments is the vase empowerment.

original: slob dpon gyi dbang bcu las mchog tu dga' ba skye ba ste 'di ni slob dpon gyi dbang ngo //
analyzed: slob dpon gyi dbang bcu las mchog tu dga' ba skye ba ste 'di ni slob dpon gyi dbang ngo //
translated: From the ten master empowerments, supreme joy arises, which is the master empowerment.

original: gsum pa gsang ba'i dbang gis bral ba'i dga' ba skye ba ste 'di ni gsang ba'i dbang ngo //
analyzed: gsum pa gsang ba'i dbang gis bral ba'i dga' ba skye ba ste 'di ni gsang ba'i dbang ngo //
translated: From the third, the secret empowerment, the joy of separation arises, which is the secret empowerment.

original: shes rab ye shes kyis lhan cig skyes pa skye ba ste 'di ni shes rab ye shes kyi dbang ngo //
analyzed: shes rab ye shes kyis lhan cig skyes pa skye ba ste 'di ni shes rab ye shes kyi dbang ngo //
translated: The arising of the innate joy by the wisdom-knowledge initiation is the fourth.

original: de bzhin du sh'akya seng+ge la sogs pas theg pa gsum rnams kyis sprul pa'i skur sbyor ba ni sad pa ste /
analyzed: de bzhin du sh'akya seng+ge la sogs pas theg pa gsum rnams kyis sprul pa'i skur sbyor ba ni sad pa ste /
translated: Thus, the awakening of the emanation body by the three vehicles, such as the Lion of the Shakyas, is the waking state.

original: dga' ba 'byung ste 'di ni sad pa'i rang bzhin no //üîΩrmi lam longs spyod rdzogs pa'i sku mchog tu dga' ba skye ba ste 'di ni rmi lam gyi rang bzhin no //
analyzed: dga' ba 'byung ste 'di ni sad pa'i rang bzhin no // rmi lam longs spyod rdzogs pa'i sku mchog tu dga' ba skye ba ste 'di ni rmi lam gyi rang bzhin no //
translated: The arising of joy is the nature of the waking state.üîΩThe arising of supreme joy by the dream enjoyment body is the nature of the dream state.

original: gnyid mthug po ni chos kyi sku bral ba'i dga' ba skye ba ste 'di ni gnyid mthug po'i rang bzhin no //
analyzed: gnyid mthug po ni chos kyi sku bral ba'i dga' ba skye ba ste 'di ni gnyid mthug po'i rang bzhin no //
translated: The arising of the joy of separation by the deep sleep reality body is the nature of the deep sleep state.

original: bzhi pa ni lhan cig skyes pa'i sku bde ba chen po skye ba ste 'di ni bzhi pa'i rang bzhin no //
analyzed: bzhi pa ni lhan cig skyes pa'i sku bde ba chen po skye ba ste 'di ni bzhi pa'i rang bzhin no //
translated: The arising of great joy by the innate body is the nature of the fourth state.

original: de ltar phyogs kyi dbye ba rnams kyis zhes bya ba la sogs pa dga' ba bcu drug tu 'gro ba'o //
analyzed: de ltar phyogs kyi dbye ba rnams kyis zhes bya ba la sogs pa dga' ba bcu drug tu 'gro ba'o //
translated: Thus, the sixteen joys are the divisions of the directions, and so on.

original: ji ltar zla ba'i cha shas rnams kyis 'phel ba dang zad pa'i rgyu nyid kyi dpe rang gis @33a * //
analyzed: ji ltar zla ba'i cha shas rnams kyis 'phel ba dang zad pa'i rgyu nyid kyi dpe rang gis @33a * //
translated: Just as one sees the waxing and waning of the moon‚Äôs digits,

original: mthong ngo // de bzhin du dus bzhi'i phyogs rnams kyi sems can rnams kyis byas pas gsal bar mthong ste rang gis rig pa'o //
analyzed: mthong ngo // de bzhin du dus bzhi'i phyogs rnams kyi sems can rnams kyis byas pas gsal bar mthong ste rang gis rig pa'o //
translated: so one sees the manifestation of the sentient beings of the four times, by their own activity, and one knows them.

original: cha shas bcu drug rnams dang ldan //
analyzed: cha shas bcu drug rnams dang ldan //
translated: Endowed with the sixteen digits.

original: zhes bya ba ni dga' ba bcu drug rnams dang ldan pa ste dus bzhis so //
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni dga' ba bcu drug rnams dang ldan pa ste dus bzhis so //
translated: The sixteen joys are endowed with the four times.

original: dbye ba de rnams kyi zla ba'i cha shas rnams kyis lo brgya'i bar du sems can rnams la snang bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: dbye ba de rnams kyi zla ba'i cha shas rnams kyis lo brgya'i bar du sems can rnams la snang bar 'gyur ro //
translated: The digits of the moon, by those divisions, appear to sentient beings for a hundred years.

original: sprul pa'i sku du ma spro zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: sprul pa'i sku du ma spro zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: The meaning is that many emanation bodies are emitted.

original: thung ngu zhes bya ba la sogs pa ste de rnams kyi sdud pa'i rgyu nyi ma'i spyod pa rnams su zhes bya ba ste /
analyzed: thung ngu zhes bya ba la sogs pa ste de rnams kyi sdud pa'i rgyu nyi ma'i spyod pa rnams su zhes bya ba ste /
translated: Short and so on. The cause of their gathering is the conduct of the sun.

original: nyi ma rnams su spyod pa ni ji ltar byang du bgrod pa dang lhor bgrod pa'i dbye ba rnams kyi zla ba'i cha shas kyis rgyu ste /
analyzed: nyi ma rnams su spyod pa ni ji ltar byang du bgrod pa dang lhor bgrod pa'i dbye ba rnams kyi zla ba'i cha shas kyis rgyu ste /
translated: The sun is the moon, which moves by the parts of the moon in the divisions of the northern and southern courses.

original: des zla ba phyogs gnyis rnams kyis dman no //
analyzed: des zla ba phyogs gnyis rnams kyis dman no //
translated: By that, the moon is diminished by the two fortnights.

original: de bzhin du dus bzhi sna tshogs pa'i dga' ba rnams kyis dman pa nyid du 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de bzhin du dus bzhi sna tshogs pa'i dga' ba rnams kyis dman pa nyid du 'gyur ro //
translated: In the same way, it is diminished by the various four seasons.

original: sku'i yi ge ni nges bar gzung ba'o //
analyzed: sku'i yi ge ni nges bar gzung ba'o //
translated: The syllable of the body is the definite retention.

original: de rnams kyi cha shas za ba nyid kyang zhes bya ba ni bskal pa 'tshig pa'i dus rnams su dga' ba thams cad kyi cha shas zad par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de rnams kyi cha shas za ba nyid kyang zhes bya ba ni bskal pa 'tshig pa'i dus rnams su dga' ba thams cad kyi cha shas zad par 'gyur ro //
translated: The consumption of its parts is the exhaustion of the parts of all the joys at the time of the destruction of the eon.

original: 'dir yang bzhi pa ni 'das pa'i mtshan nyid do //
analyzed: 'dir yang bzhi pa ni 'das pa'i mtshan nyid do //
translated: Here, the fourth is the characteristic of the past.

original: des na dang gi yi ge bsdu pa'o //
analyzed: des na dang gi yi ge bsdu pa'o //
translated: Therefore, the syllable da is included.

original: nyi ma ni de kho na nyid kyi nyi ma ste 'od gsal ba rnam par rtog pa'i chos thams cad za ba zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: nyi ma ni de kho na nyid kyi nyi ma ste 'od gsal ba rnam par rtog pa'i chos thams cad za ba zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: The sun is the sun of reality, the clear light, which consumes all conceptual phenomena.

original: bud med kun zhes bya ba ni bud med sgyu ma thams cad de ;
analyzed: bud med kun zhes bya ba ni bud med sgyu ma thams cad de ;
translated: All women are all illusory women.

original: de ci zhe na /
analyzed: de ci zhe na /
translated: What is that?

original: sna tshogs pa'i rang bzhin rnams sgyu ma'i rnam pa rnams su rab tu 'jug go //
analyzed: sna tshogs pa'i rang bzhin rnams sgyu ma'i rnam pa rnams su rab tu 'jug go //
translated: The various natures enter into the forms of illusion.

original: bud med nyid thob nas shes rab kyi gzugs ni rtag tu phyag rgya zhes bya ba ste phyag rgya chen po de'i tshe 'di zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: bud med nyid thob nas shes rab kyi gzugs ni rtag tu phyag rgya zhes bya ba ste phyag rgya chen po de'i tshe 'di zhes bya ba'o //
translated: Having attained the state of woman, the form of wisdom is always the seal, i.e., the great seal. At that time, this is what is called.

original: sngon du bshad pa'i 'od gsal ba ni thabs te skyes bu nyid bsgrubs nas sprul pa'i sku can rnams kyi sku rnams kyis gnyis su med pa'i ye shes bla na med pa'o zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: sngon du bshad pa'i 'od gsal ba ni thabs te skyes bu nyid bsgrubs nas sprul pa'i sku can rnams kyi sku rnams kyis gnyis su med pa'i ye shes bla na med pa'o zhes bya ba'o //
translated: The clear light explained previously is the means. Having accomplished the state of man, the bodies of those who have the emanation body are the unsurpassed wisdom of nonduality.

original: 'di yis rang bzhin gyis 'od gsal ba rnams dang ldan pa bla na med pa'i ye shes brjod du med pa thogs pa med pa bsnun du med pa mchog tu gnyis su med pa zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: 'di yis rang bzhin gyis 'od gsal ba rnams dang ldan pa bla na med pa'i ye shes brjod du med pa thogs pa med pa bsnun du med pa mchog tu gnyis su med pa zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: This means that one who possesses the naturally clear light attains the unsurpassed, inexpressible, unobstructed, unattached, supreme nondual wisdom.

original: 'dir thams cad rang bzhin gyis 'od gsal ba'i rnam pa yin na de'i tshe /
analyzed: 'dir thams cad rang bzhin gyis 'od gsal ba'i rnam pa yin na de'i tshe /
translated: Here, if everything is of the aspect of natural luminosity, then

original: ji ltar sems can rnams kyi tha mal pa'i bdag nyid kyi sems 'byung bar 'gyur /
analyzed: ji ltar sems can rnams kyi tha mal pa'i bdag nyid kyi sems 'byung bar 'gyur /
translated: How could the minds of sentient beings arise in their ordinary state?

original: de rnams kyis kyang dmyal ba la sogs pa'i sdug bsngal nyams su myong bar 'gyur /
analyzed: de rnams kyis kyang dmyal ba la sogs pa'i sdug bsngal nyams su myong bar 'gyur /
translated: And they would experience the suffering of hell and so on.

original: de nas tha mal pa rnams kyi 'di 'dra ba'i ye shes med par @33b 'gyur /
analyzed: de nas tha mal pa rnams kyi 'di 'dra ba'i ye shes med par @33b 'gyur /
translated: Then, for ordinary people, such pristine awareness would not exist.üîΩLikewise, it would be partial, obstructed pristine awareness, and not unsurpassed.

original: de bzhin du phyogs gcig pa nyid dang thogs pa dang bcas pa'i ye shes dang bla na med pa ma yin par 'gyur zhe na 'dir bshad pa /
analyzed: de bzhin du phyogs gcig pa nyid dang thogs pa dang bcas pa'i ye shes dang bla na med pa ma yin par 'gyur zhe na 'dir bshad pa /
translated: Here, it is explained:

original: de'i phyir gsungs pa /
analyzed: de'i phyir gsungs pa /
translated: Therefore, it is said:

original: de rgyu mtshan med pa dang mi rigs pa dang lung dang rnam par dpyod pa med pa ma yin no //
analyzed: de rgyu mtshan med pa dang mi rigs pa dang lung dang rnam par dpyod pa med pa ma yin no //
translated: That is not without a reason, unreasonable, or without analysis in scripture.

original: de cis she na /
analyzed: de cis she na /
translated: What is that?

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis gsungs pa'i tshig gis so //
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis gsungs pa'i tshig gis so //
translated: By the words spoken by the Blessed One.

original: de'i phyir 'di ltar gsungs pa 'gro zhes bya ba la sogs pa ste /
analyzed: de'i phyir 'di ltar gsungs pa 'gro zhes bya ba la sogs pa ste /
translated: Therefore, it is said like this: ‚ÄúGoing‚Äù and so on.

original: rnal 'byor chen po zhes bya ba ni byang chub sems dpa' chen po rnal 'byor dang ldan pa rnams la skye ba'o //
analyzed: rnal 'byor chen po zhes bya ba ni byang chub sems dpa' chen po rnal 'byor dang ldan pa rnams la skye ba'o //
translated: ‚ÄúGreat yoga‚Äù means arising for the great bodhisattvas endowed with yoga.

original: byang chub sems ni 'od chen po //
analyzed: byang chub sems ni 'od chen po //
translated: The enlightenment mind is the great light.

original: zhes bya ba ni byang chub rnams kyi sems byed pa sngon gyi smon lam gyis khyab par byas pa'i gzugs mchog tu gnyis su med pa'i rang bzhin gyis 'od gsal ba'i ngo bo'i ye shes rnams kyi 'od ni snang ba ye shes chen po'i ngo bo nyid do
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni byang chub rnams kyi sems byed pa sngon gyi smon lam gyis khyab par byas pa'i gzugs mchog tu gnyis su med pa'i rang bzhin gyis 'od gsal ba'i ngo bo'i ye shes rnams kyi 'od ni snang ba ye shes chen po'i ngo bo nyid do
translated: The enlightenment minds are the pristine wisdoms whose nature is the supreme, nondual, luminous clarity, which is pervaded by the former aspiration to enlightenment. The light of those pristine wisdoms is the nature of the great light of pristine wisdom.

original: // des sems can rnams kyi ye shes kyi snang bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: // des sems can rnams kyi ye shes kyi snang bar 'gyur ro //
translated: By that, the light of pristine wisdom of sentient beings will occur.

original: ni'i yi ge ni nges par gzung ba'o //
analyzed: ni'i yi ge ni nges par gzung ba'o //
translated: The syllable ni is a definitive marker.

original: de'i phyir thogs pa med pa mchog tu gnyis su med pa /
analyzed: de'i phyir thogs pa med pa mchog tu gnyis su med pa /
translated: Therefore, it is unobstructed, supreme, nondual,

original: brjod du med pa'i ye shes mchog thams cad pa thams cad kyi bdag nyid can no //
analyzed: brjod du med pa'i ye shes mchog thams cad pa thams cad kyi bdag nyid can no //
translated: inexpressible, supreme, and the nature of all.

original: de rnams kyis dmyal ba la sogs pa'i sdug bsngal nyams su myong bar mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de rnams kyis dmyal ba la sogs pa'i sdug bsngal nyams su myong bar mi 'gyur ro //
translated: By those, the sufferings of the hells and so forth will not be experienced.

original: ji ltar skyes bu dam pa rnams dang phrad pas dman par skyes pa yang rgan por 'gyur ro //
analyzed: ji ltar skyes bu dam pa rnams dang phrad pas dman par skyes pa yang rgan por 'gyur ro //
translated: Just as by meeting with holy beings, even those born in lower realms will become old.

original: de'i phyir stong nyid snying rje mi phyed pa zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: de'i phyir stong nyid snying rje mi phyed pa zhes bya ba ni /
translated: Therefore, the expression ‚Äúindivisible emptiness and compassion‚Äù

original: stong pa nyid sngon du bshad pa'i mchog tu gnyis su med pa'i ye shes so //
analyzed: stong pa nyid sngon du bshad pa'i mchog tu gnyis su med pa'i ye shes so //
translated: refers to the supreme nondual intuition explained earlier as emptiness.

original: de'i rang bzhin ni chos kyi bdag med pa'o //
analyzed: de'i rang bzhin ni chos kyi bdag med pa'o //
translated: Its nature is the selflessness of things.

original: snying rje ni sems can gyi khams gang zag rnams kyi bdag med pa dang lhan cig gcig tu byas nas dbye ba med ba zag pa med pa'o //
analyzed: snying rje ni sems can gyi khams gang zag rnams kyi bdag med pa dang lhan cig gcig tu byas nas dbye ba med ba zag pa med pa'o //
translated: Compassion is the realm of sentient beings, which is the selflessness of persons, made into a unity, undivided, and uncontaminated.

original: de bzhin nyid kyi ye shes dang yang dag pa'i mtha'i rang bzhin no //
analyzed: de bzhin nyid kyi ye shes dang yang dag pa'i mtha'i rang bzhin no //
translated: It is the nature of reality and the reality limit.

original: dngos rnams nam mkha'i me tog bzhin //üîΩzhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: dngos rnams nam mkha'i me tog bzhin // zhes bya ba ni /
translated: Things are like sky-flowers.

original: dngos po rnams ni chos thams cad de de rnams kyi dbus na bzhugs pa'i byang chub sems dpa' chen po nam mkha'i me tog bzhin te gos pa med pa nyid kyis so //
analyzed: dngos po rnams ni chos thams cad de de rnams kyi dbus na bzhugs pa'i byang chub sems dpa' chen po nam mkha'i me tog bzhin te gos pa med pa nyid kyis so //
translated: Things are all things, and the great bodhisattva who resides in their midst is like a sky-flower, because he is uncontaminated.

original: ji ltar nam mkha' me tog 'khor ba ni rlung gis bskyod pa de bzhin du byang chub sems dpa' dngos pos nam mkha' bkang nas bzhugs so //
analyzed: ji ltar nam mkha' me tog 'khor ba ni rlung gis bskyod pa de bzhin du byang chub sems dpa' dngos pos nam mkha' bkang nas bzhugs so //
translated: Just as a flower garland circling in the sky is moved by the wind, in the same way, the Bodhisattva, abiding in the sky filled with things,

original: cung zad smon lam gyis bskyod pa yis me tog bzhin nam mkha' thams cad dri bsung bar byed de @34a * //
analyzed: cung zad smon lam gyis bskyod pa yis me tog bzhin nam mkha' thams cad dri bsung bar byed de @34a * //
translated: moves a little by the wind of his vow, and perfumes the entire sky with the fragrance of the flower,

original: byang chub sems dpa' sems can rnams kyi don dgos pa ye shes kyi dri bsung byed do zhes bya bar dgongs so //
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' sems can rnams kyi don dgos pa ye shes kyi dri bsung byed do zhes bya bar dgongs so //
translated: the Bodhisattva perfumes all beings with the fragrance of the knowledge of his purpose.

original: de'i phyir sad gyur zhes bya ba la sogs pa ste /
analyzed: de'i phyir sad gyur zhes bya ba la sogs pa ste /
translated: Therefore, he says, ‚Äúawakened,‚Äù and so on.

original: sangs rgyas nyid kyang lag par gnas zhes bya ba'i mthar thug pa rtogs sla'o //
analyzed: sangs rgyas nyid kyang lag par gnas zhes bya ba'i mthar thug pa rtogs sla'o //
translated: The meaning is easy to understand up to ‚ÄúBuddhahood itself is in the hand.‚Äù

original: mkha' 'gro ma kun ngo bo zhes bya ba ni rtsa thams cad kyi rang bzhin byang chub kyi sems so //
analyzed: mkha' 'gro ma kun ngo bo zhes bya ba ni rtsa thams cad kyi rang bzhin byang chub kyi sems so //
translated: ‚ÄúThe nature of all dakinis‚Äù is the nature of all channels, the bodhicitta.

original: de nyid sems dpa' ste mkha' 'gro ma thams cad kyi ngo bo'o //
analyzed: de nyid sems dpa' ste mkha' 'gro ma thams cad kyi ngo bo'o //
translated: That itself is the hero, the nature of all dakinis.

original: rdo rje mkha' 'gro mchog tu bde //
analyzed: rdo rje mkha' 'gro mchog tu bde //
translated: The vajra dakini is supremely blissful.

original: zhes bya ba ni sems can 'di rnams kyi byang chub kyi sems kyi ngo bo'o //
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni sems can 'di rnams kyi byang chub kyi sems kyi ngo bo'o //
translated: This is the essence of the enlightenment spirit of these sentient beings.

original: rdo rje ni dbyer med pa'i ye shes rang gis rig pa'i bde ba 'pho ba med pa'i mkha' 'gro ste /
analyzed: rdo rje ni dbyer med pa'i ye shes rang gis rig pa'i bde ba 'pho ba med pa'i mkha' 'gro ste /
translated: The vajra is the wisdom of non-division, the bliss of self-awareness, the dakini of non-transference.

original: de mchog dang mchog tu mi 'gyur ba'i bde ba zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: de mchog dang mchog tu mi 'gyur ba'i bde ba zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: It is the meaning of the supreme and unchanging bliss.

original: ye shes 'di 'dra ba'i gal te rnal 'byor pa rnams la med na de'i tshe sems can gyi don byed pa med par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: ye shes 'di 'dra ba'i gal te rnal 'byor pa rnams la med na de'i tshe sems can gyi don byed pa med par 'gyur ro //
translated: If this kind of wisdom does not exist for the yogis, then they will not be able to benefit sentient beings.

original: de rnams kyi yang las las zhes bya ba la sogs pa ste /
analyzed: de rnams kyi yang las las zhes bya ba la sogs pa ste /
translated: And their karma, etc.

original: gzi brjid che zhes bya ba ni shin tu gsal ba de rnams kyis so //
analyzed: gzi brjid che zhes bya ba ni shin tu gsal ba de rnams kyis so //
translated: With great splendor means with great clarity.

original: gzhan rtogs par sla'o //
analyzed: gzhan rtogs par sla'o //
translated: The rest is easy to understand.

original: de'i phyir zhes bya ba ni de'i phyir sems can rnams kyi sangs rgyas dang chos dang dge 'dun rnams la skyabs su 'gro ba bstan par bya'o //
analyzed: de'i phyir zhes bya ba ni de'i phyir sems can rnams kyi sangs rgyas dang chos dang dge 'dun rnams la skyabs su 'gro ba bstan par bya'o //
translated: Therefore, for that reason, one should teach sentient beings to go for refuge to the Buddha, Dharma, and Sangha.

original: skyabs su 'gro ba gang gis sangs rgyas la rdzas su chags pa dang chos dang dge 'dun la yang 'gyur ba'o //
analyzed: skyabs su 'gro ba gang gis sangs rgyas la rdzas su chags pa dang chos dang dge 'dun la yang 'gyur ba'o //
translated: One goes for refuge in whom? In the Buddha, the Dharma, and the Sa·πÖgha.

original: rdzu 'phrul che zhes bya ba ni nyan thos la sogs pa las kyang khyad par du byed pa'o //
analyzed: rdzu 'phrul che zhes bya ba ni nyan thos la sogs pa las kyang khyad par du byed pa'o //
translated: Great magical power is to distinguish him from the ≈õrƒÅvakas, etc.

original: de'i phyir yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas rnams la gsang ba gsum gyi bdag nyid can zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: de'i phyir yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas rnams la gsang ba gsum gyi bdag nyid can zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: Therefore, the perfect Buddhas means the nature of the three secrets.

original: da ni ci 'dra zhes bya ba la sogs pa'i tshigs su bcad pa gnyis rnams kyis bcom ldan 'das ma rdo rje phag mo'i rjes su chags par gnas pas byang chub kyi phyogs kyi chos sum cu rtsa bdun po rnams kyis brtags pa spong ba'i rigs pas dris
analyzed: da ni ci 'dra zhes bya ba la sogs pa'i tshigs su bcad pa gnyis rnams kyis bcom ldan 'das ma rdo rje phag mo'i rjes su chags par gnas pas byang chub kyi phyogs kyi chos sum cu rtsa bdun po rnams kyis brtags pa spong ba'i rigs pas dris
translated: Now, with two verses beginning with What is like this?, he asks about VajravƒÅrƒÅhƒ´, the Blessed Lady, with the thirty-seven factors of awakening, by the reasoning of abandoning conceptualization through the state of passion.

original: pa ste / de ltar ji ltar zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni mdor bstan pa'i tshigs su bcad pa'o //
analyzed: pa ste / de ltar ji ltar zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni mdor bstan pa'i tshigs su bcad pa'o //
translated: Thus, What is like this? and so on is the verse of brief indication.

original: gsang ba der ni phyag byas nas //
analyzed: gsang ba der ni phyag byas nas //
translated: Having bowed to that secret,

original: zhes bya ba ni gsang ba'i dbang po rnams su byang chub kyi sems 'dzag pa'i bde ba chen po'i ye shes ni gsang ba ste /
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni gsang ba'i dbang po rnams su byang chub kyi sems 'dzag pa'i bde ba chen po'i ye shes ni gsang ba ste /

original: shes bya'i rnam pa'i ngo bos bcom ldan 'das ma rdo rje phag mo de nyid du babs pas phyag byas pa'o //
analyzed: shes bya'i rnam pa'i ngo bos bcom ldan 'das ma rdo rje phag mo de nyid du babs pas phyag byas pa'o //
translated: That very Vajravarahi, the Blessed Lady, is worshipped by the descent of the nature of the aspects of the objects of knowledge.

original: 'di nyid la lha rdzas rnal 'byor ma zhes bya ba @34b ni rnal 'byor ma thams cad kyi rang bzhin can gtso mo'o //
analyzed: 'di nyid la lha rdzas rnal 'byor ma zhes bya ba @34b ni rnal 'byor ma thams cad kyi rang bzhin can gtso mo'o //
translated: She is called the divine yogini, the chief of the nature of all yoginis.

original: 'di 'dra zhes bya ba ni de ltar rig pa'i ye shes tshig gis rab tu gsungs pa ste /
analyzed: 'di 'dra zhes bya ba ni de ltar rig pa'i ye shes tshig gis rab tu gsungs pa ste /

original: gang gi tshe gnyis su med pa de'i tshe'o //
analyzed: gang gi tshe gnyis su med pa de'i tshe'o //

original: yang nas yang zhes bya ba ni sgra brnyan ltar zhus so zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: yang nas yang zhes bya ba ni sgra brnyan ltar zhus so zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: Again and again means that the question is like an echo.

original: ci zhus pa zhe na gsungs pa zhes bya ba ste /
analyzed: ci zhus pa zhe na gsungs pa zhes bya ba ste /

original: bcom ldan 'das kyi lan gyi tshig rang gis rig pa'i rnam par rtog par 'gyur ba'o //
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyi lan gyi tshig rang gis rig pa'i rnam par rtog par 'gyur ba'o //
translated: The words of the reply of the Blessed One become the conception of one's own knowledge.

original: de ci zhe na /
analyzed: de ci zhe na /
translated: What is that?

original: phra mo'i rnam pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa ste /
analyzed: phra mo'i rnam pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa ste /
translated: The subtle aspect and so forth.

original: rtsa gsum zhes bya ba ni la la n'a dang ra sa n'a dang dbu ma ste phra mo'i rnal 'byor rnams 'byung bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: rtsa gsum zhes bya ba ni la la n'a dang ra sa n'a dang dbu ma ste phra mo'i rnal 'byor rnams 'byung bar 'gyur ro //
translated: The three channels are lalanƒÅ, rasanƒÅ, and the central channel, from which the subtle yogas arise.

original: rnam par shes pa gsum gyi rgyu can zhes bya ba ni 'jug pa dang sems dang kun gzhi rnams kyi rgyu'o //
analyzed: rnam par shes pa gsum gyi rgyu can zhes bya ba ni 'jug pa dang sems dang kun gzhi rnams kyi rgyu'o //
translated: Having the cause of the three consciousnesses means the cause of the three: the engaging, the mental, and the all-base.

original: ci'i phyir rgyu zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir rgyu zhe na /
translated: Why is it the cause?

original: lus dang ngag dang yid kyi 'khor lo rnams su byang chub kyi sems rab tu 'bab pa la rtsa re res kyang rnam par shes pa gsum bskyed par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: lus dang ngag dang yid kyi 'khor lo rnams su byang chub kyi sems rab tu 'bab pa la rtsa re res kyang rnam par shes pa gsum bskyed par 'gyur ro //

original: de nyid kyis kyang de phyir zhes bya ba la sogs pa ste /
analyzed: de nyid kyis kyang de phyir zhes bya ba la sogs pa ste /

original: de la brten pa rnams kyang phra mo'i thig le zhes bya ba ni rang gis rig pa'i rang bzhin gyis rig pas zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: de la brten pa rnams kyang phra mo'i thig le zhes bya ba ni rang gis rig pa'i rang bzhin gyis rig pas zhes bya ba'o //
translated: There, the subtle bindu that is based on that is the nature of one's vidyƒÅ, which is known as awareness.

original: rnam pa sna tshogs pa'i rdzu 'phrul chen po'i rnal 'byor ma rnams rtsa ste byang chub kyi phyogs kyi chos sum cu rtsa bdun po'i rang bzhin 'byung ba'o //

analyzed: re re la ni de yongs ldan zhes bya ba ni rang gi dkyil 'khor re re'i rnal 'byor ma rnams kyi gtso bo sum cu rtsa bdun gyi bdag nyid can rnams so //
translated: Each one is endowed with that, meaning that each yoginƒ´ of the ma·πá·∏çala is endowed with the nature of the thirty-seven.

original: de'i phyir mkha' 'gro ma kun zhes bya ba ni rnal 'byor ma 'di rnams thams cad rang gis rig pa'i nam mkha' la skyes pa'o //
analyzed: de'i phyir mkha' 'gro ma kun zhes bya ba ni rnal 'byor ma 'di rnams thams cad rang gis rig pa'i nam mkha' la skyes pa'o //

analyzed: de bzhin du yang gsungs pa sum cu rtsa gsum du skyes pa 'ba' zhig ma yin te /

analyzed: de yang zhes bya ba ni rnal 'byor ma sum cu rtsa bdun rnams so//

original: thams cad ji lta ba zhes bya ba ni ji ltar rnal 'byor ma sum cu rtsa bdun rnams kyis 'chad par 'gyur ba'i rim pa 'dis ming mdor bstan pa bshad do //

original: phyir zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: phyir zhes bya ba'i don to //

translated: Why is that? The BhagavƒÅn is delighted, that is, he abides in the nature of the bliss of method and wisdom.

original: de ji ltar zhe na /
analyzed: de ji ltar zhe na /
translated: How is that?

original: sems dpa' rtsa thams cad ro gcig pa'i rang bzhin rdo rje dang padma yang dag par sbyor ba las byung ba'i thig le ste /
analyzed: sems dpa' rtsa thams cad ro gcig pa'i rang bzhin rdo rje dang padma yang dag par sbyor ba las byung ba'i thig le ste /
translated: The hero is the nature of the single taste of all channels, the bindu that arises from the union of the vajra and lotus.

original: sems dpa' ni thig le'o //
analyzed: sems dpa' ni thig le'o //
translated: The hero is the bindu.üîΩIn those, the movement of the bindu through the practice of union is the supreme virtue of peace.

original: de rnams su 'pho ba'i sbyor bas bar du gyur pa zag pa med pa'i bde ba de zhi ba mchog tu dge ba byed pa po de de bzhin du'o //
analyzed: de rnams su 'pho ba'i sbyor bas bar du gyur pa zag pa med pa'i bde ba de zhi ba mchog tu dge ba byed pa po de de bzhin du'o //
translated: Since he is such a one who creates that, he is like that.

original: de de ltar bde ba gzung bar gyur pas /
analyzed: de de ltar bde ba gzung bar gyur pas /
translated: Since he is such a one who apprehends that bliss,

original: rdo rje mkha' 'gro zhes bya ba ni mchog tu mi 'gyur ba'i sbyor ba dang ldan pa'o //
analyzed: rdo rje mkha' 'gro zhes bya ba ni mchog tu mi 'gyur ba'i sbyor ba dang ldan pa'o //
translated: he is called the vajra dakini, endowed with the practice of supreme unchanging bliss.

original: dngos po des bdag nyid bcom ldan 'das rdo rje mkha' 'gro zhes bya bar 'brel lo //
analyzed: dngos po des bdag nyid bcom ldan 'das rdo rje mkha' 'gro zhes bya bar 'brel lo //
translated: That entity is related to the Blessed One, called Vajradaka.

original: rtsa'i yi ges rdo rje mkha' 'gro'i sku la dmigs nas rnal 'byor ma sna tshogs kyi rang bzhin skye'o zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: rtsa'i yi ges rdo rje mkha' 'gro'i sku la dmigs nas rnal 'byor ma sna tshogs kyi rang bzhin skye'o zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: Having visualized the body of Vajradaka with the channel syllables, the meaning is that the various yoginis are born.

original: de ltar phyag rgya phyag rgya chen po ste rtsibs bcu gnyis rnams @36a * //
analyzed: de ltar phyag rgya phyag rgya chen po ste rtsibs bcu gnyis rnams @36a * //
translated: Thus, the mudra is the great mudra, and the twelve spokes are

original: su yang dag par gnas pa'o //
analyzed: su yang dag par gnas pa'o //
translated: perfectly present.

original: gnas der bcom ldan 'das longs spyod rdzogs pa dang / sprul pa skye ba ni mdog ces bya ba la sogs pa de nyid dang bdag gi zhes bya ba ni he ru ka rdo rje phag mo dang snyoms par zhugs pa'i gzugs kyi rnam pa de'i rang bzhin 'byung ba'o //
analyzed: gnas der bcom ldan 'das longs spyod rdzogs pa dang / sprul pa skye ba ni mdog ces bya ba la sogs pa de nyid dang bdag gi zhes bya ba ni he ru ka rdo rje phag mo dang snyoms par zhugs pa'i gzugs kyi rnam pa de'i rang bzhin 'byung ba'o //
translated: In that place, the birth of the Blessed One's enjoyment body and emanation body is color, etc. That very self refers to the nature of the form of Heruka in union with Vajravarahi.

original: de'i phyir 'di yis zhes bya ba la sogs pa ste /
analyzed: de'i phyir 'di yis zhes bya ba la sogs pa ste /
translated: Therefore, by this, etc.

original: bcom ldan 'das khyad par du byed pa 'di gsungs so zhes bya ba la sogs pa ste /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das khyad par du byed pa 'di gsungs so zhes bya ba la sogs pa ste /
translated: The Blessed One spoke this distinction, etc.

original: rdo rje phag mos sdud par byed pa rang nyid kyi skyon bsal ba ste /
analyzed: rdo rje phag mos sdud par byed pa rang nyid kyi skyon bsal ba ste /
translated: Vajravarahi, the compiler, removes her own faults.

original: bcom ldan 'das thams cad ston pa po zhes bya bar dgongs so //
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das thams cad ston pa po zhes bya bar dgongs so //
translated: The Bhagavat thinks, ‚ÄúI am the one who shows everything.‚Äù

original: mkha' 'gro ma kun bde ster ba //
analyzed: mkha' 'gro ma kun bde ster ba //
translated: The dakinis all bestow bliss.

original: zhes bya ba ni rtsa thams cad bde ba'i rang bzhin du zhes bya bar dgongs so //
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni rtsa thams cad bde ba'i rang bzhin du zhes bya bar dgongs so //
translated: This means that all the channels are of the nature of bliss.

original: gzhan rtogs par sla'o //
analyzed: gzhan rtogs par sla'o //
translated: The rest is easy to understand.

original: da ni de bzhin gshegs pa'i sku chos kyi dbyings kyi bdag nyid 'di'i mngon sum dang rjes su dpag pa'i dngos po'i rab tu gnas pa dang rab tu mi gnas pa'i mya ngan las 'das pa bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: da ni de bzhin gshegs pa'i sku chos kyi dbyings kyi bdag nyid 'di'i mngon sum dang rjes su dpag pa'i dngos po'i rab tu gnas pa dang rab tu mi gnas pa'i mya ngan las 'das pa bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: Now, in order to teach the nirvƒÅ·πáa that is the nonabiding of the reality of the direct perception and inference of this body of the TathƒÅgata, which is of the nature of the dharmadhƒÅtu,

original: gang slar yang nges par gzhag pa gsungs pa /
analyzed: gang slar yang nges par gzhag pa gsungs pa /
translated: he declares the summary:

original: thog ma dang tha ma med ces bya ba la sogs pa ste /
analyzed: thog ma dang tha ma med ces bya ba la sogs pa ste /
translated: ‚ÄúWithout beginning or end,‚Äù and so on.

original: nam mkha' zhes bya ba ni zhi ba 'das pa rab tu gyur pa'i ye shes so //
analyzed: nam mkha' zhes bya ba ni zhi ba 'das pa rab tu gyur pa'i ye shes so //
translated: Space is the wisdom that has fully transformed into the peace of nirvƒÅ·πáa.

original: thog ma med pa zhes bya ba ni thog ma dang tha ma spangs pa mchog dang bral ba ni dang po dang tha ma'o //
analyzed: thog ma med pa zhes bya ba ni thog ma dang tha ma spangs pa mchog dang bral ba ni dang po dang tha ma'o //
translated: ‚ÄúBeginningless‚Äù means free from beginning and end. ‚Äú Supreme‚Äù means free from first and last.

original: tha ma ni don dam pa dang rang bzhin med pa nyid kyi phyir ro //
analyzed: tha ma ni don dam pa dang rang bzhin med pa nyid kyi phyir ro //
translated: The ‚Äúend‚Äù is the ultimate, because it is devoid of intrinsic reality.

original: rab tu mi gnas pa mchog tu mya ngan las 'das pa chos kyi dbyings kyi mtshan nyid dang dngos po dang dngos po med pa las ring du song ba'i ye shes zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: rab tu mi gnas pa mchog tu mya ngan las 'das pa chos kyi dbyings kyi mtshan nyid dang dngos po dang dngos po med pa las ring du song ba'i ye shes zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: ‚Äú Non-abiding‚Äù means supreme nirvana, the characteristic of the realm of reality, and the wisdom that has gone far beyond existence and nonexistence. This is the meaning.

original: 'dir gal te de srid du don med pa can thog ma dang tha ma med pa nyid kyis rab tu mi gnas pa dang rab tu gnas pa dang bral ba yin na de'i tshe lung thams cad don med par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: 'dir gal te de srid du don med pa can thog ma dang tha ma med pa nyid kyis rab tu mi gnas pa dang rab tu gnas pa dang bral ba yin na de'i tshe lung thams cad don med par 'gyur ro //
translated: Here, if it is thus devoid of beginning and end, non-abiding, and free from abiding, then all scriptures would be meaningless.

original: de bzhin gshegs pa'i gsung yang tshad mar mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa'i gsung yang tshad mar mi 'gyur ro //
translated: The speech of the Tathagata would not be valid.

original: de rnams kyis kyang dmyal ba la sogs par 'gro bar byed do zhes gzhan dag the tshom za na /
analyzed: de rnams kyis kyang dmyal ba la sogs par 'gro bar byed do zhes gzhan dag the tshom za na /
translated: Others may doubt that those who go to hell and so on would be led there by them.

original: de'i phyir bcom ldan 'das kyis gsungs pa'i lan gyi tshig gsungs pa /
analyzed: de'i phyir bcom ldan 'das kyis gsungs pa'i lan gyi tshig gsungs pa /
translated: Therefore, the reply of the Bhagavat is stated:

original: gang 'dra ba zhes bya ba la sogs pa ste /
analyzed: gang 'dra ba zhes bya ba la sogs pa ste /
translated: ‚ÄúWhat is it like?‚Äù and so forth.

original: dpe gsungs pa'o //
analyzed: dpe gsungs pa'o //
translated: The example is stated.

original: gzhan du 'du shes zhes bya ba ni gzhan du phyi rol gyi nam mkha' yongs su brtags pa gang 'dra ba ste /
analyzed: gzhan du 'du shes zhes bya ba ni gzhan du phyi rol gyi nam mkha' yongs su brtags pa gang 'dra ba ste /
translated: ‚ÄúPerceived as other‚Äù is the external space that is imagined as other.

original: mdo sde pa rnams kyis rnam pa thams cad kyi dngos por ro //
analyzed: mdo sde pa rnams kyis rnam pa thams cad kyi dngos por ro //
translated: The Sautrantikas say that it is a thing in all aspects.

original: de 'dra ba ni bdag rig @36b pa ste zhes bya ba ni rab tu gnas pa'i mya ngan las 'das pa'i rang bzhin rdo rje phag mos yang dag par rtogs pa'o //
analyzed: de 'dra ba ni bdag rig @36b pa ste zhes bya ba ni rab tu gnas pa'i mya ngan las 'das pa'i rang bzhin rdo rje phag mos yang dag par rtogs pa'o //
translated: ‚ÄúThat is like the self-awareness‚Äù is the nature of the nirvana that is well-established, which is realized by Vajravarahi.

original: snang ba med kyang yongs su gsal //
analyzed: snang ba med kyang yongs su gsal //
translated: ‚ÄúAlthough it is without appearance, it is completely clear.‚Äù

original: zhes bya ba ni gzung ba dang 'dzin pa'i rnam pa dang bral bas snang ba med pa dang de'i rnam pa rnams kyis sems can rnams kyi dga' bar byed pa nyid kyi phyir yongs su gsal bar yang ste rang gis rig pa'i rang bzhin zhes bya ba'i don
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni gzung ba dang 'dzin pa'i rnam pa dang bral bas snang ba med pa dang de'i rnam pa rnams kyis sems can rnams kyi dga' bar byed pa nyid kyi phyir yongs su gsal bar yang ste rang gis rig pa'i rang bzhin zhes bya ba'i don
translated: Since it is free from the aspects of subject and object, it is without appearance. Since it delights sentient beings with its aspects, it is completely clear. The meaning is that it is the nature of self-awareness.

original: to // de ltar bcom ldan 'das 'byung ba zhes bya ba ni rnam pa thams cad kyi bdag nyid 'dir med pa ste /
analyzed: to // de ltar bcom ldan 'das 'byung ba zhes bya ba ni rnam pa thams cad kyi bdag nyid 'dir med pa ste /
translated: Thus, the Blessed One has said that the nature of all things is non-existence here.

original: gcig dang du ma'i rang bzhin dang 'dir bral bas so //
analyzed: gcig dang du ma'i rang bzhin dang 'dir bral bas so //
translated: Because of the absence of the nature of one and many here.

original: der zhes bya ba ni rnam pa thams cad du gong du rdul phra rab kyi cha drug gis dbye bas med do //
analyzed: der zhes bya ba ni rnam pa thams cad du gong du rdul phra rab kyi cha drug gis dbye bas med do //
translated: There, in every way, there is no atom divided into six parts, as was said above.

original: 'on kyang tha snyad du 'jig rten pa gzhan la zhes bya ba ste 'jig rten gyi tha snyad tsam mo //
analyzed: 'on kyang tha snyad du 'jig rten pa gzhan la zhes bya ba ste 'jig rten gyi tha snyad tsam mo //
translated: But conventionally, for the sake of others, i.e., for the sake of worldly convention.

original: mi bden pa'i bden pa nyid de /
analyzed: mi bden pa'i bden pa nyid de /
translated: That is not true reality.

original: de rnams kyi rtog pa sna tshogs rnams la gnod par 'gyur te /
analyzed: de rnams kyi rtog pa sna tshogs rnams la gnod par 'gyur te /
translated: Their various conceptual thoughts are destroyed.

original: dar gyi srin bu bzhin no //
analyzed: dar gyi srin bu bzhin no //
translated: Like the silkworm in its cocoon.

original: de'i phyir ma skyes pa mi 'gag pa sgyu ma dang smig rgyu dang mtshungs pa'o //
analyzed: de'i phyir ma skyes pa mi 'gag pa sgyu ma dang smig rgyu dang mtshungs pa'o //
translated: Therefore, the unborn does not cease, like an illusion, like a mirage.

original: der ni mngon sum gyis kyang yod par ma mthong mi bden pa'o //
analyzed: der ni mngon sum gyis kyang yod par ma mthong mi bden pa'o //
translated: There, by direct perception, one does not see existence, it is not true.

original: dbang po rnams la rang bzhin ni //
analyzed: dbang po rnams la rang bzhin ni //
translated: The nature of the sense faculties

original: mthong yang med par blta bar byos //
analyzed: mthong yang med par blta bar byos //
translated: is seen but should be seen as non-existent.

original: rang bzhin gyis ni dbang po med //
analyzed: rang bzhin gyis ni dbang po med //
translated: And by nature it is without sense faculties.

original: de ru gzugs ni ji bzhin mthong //
analyzed: de ru gzugs ni ji bzhin mthong //
translated: There, forms are seen as they are.

original: yid kyis dmigs pa'i gzugs kyang ni //
analyzed: yid kyis dmigs pa'i gzugs kyang ni //
translated: The forms that are the objects of the mindüîΩAre also like that.

original: yid ni nam mkha'i mtshan nyid do //
analyzed: yid ni nam mkha'i mtshan nyid do //
translated: The mind has the characteristic of space.

original: thams cad rgyu rkyen tshogs las skyes //
analyzed: thams cad rgyu rkyen tshogs las skyes //
translated: Everything arises from the assembly of causes and conditions,

original: s'a lu la sogs myu gu bzhin //
analyzed: s'a lu la sogs myu gu bzhin //
translated: Like rice sprouts and so on.üîΩIt is not asserted that

original: bems po'i dngos po thams cad du //üîΩrnam par 'phro par mi 'dod do //
analyzed: bems po'i dngos po thams cad du //üîΩrnam par 'phro par mi 'dod do //
translated: All inanimate things arise from that.
